text: Visiting from the Pacific Northwest when I came upon this place.  The burgers were great. I first had the Philly burger and decided to come back another day to try the gyro burger. Both were great and I highly recommend getting jalapenos in both to get a zing to the burgers. They make their sauces fresh everyday (i.e. ranch).  The owner was very kind as she even gave me a few cucumbers at no charge for my teething daughter. Yes it just a cucumbers but the shear thoughtfulness that the owner had was top notch customer service in my book.  When I come back to Arizona, will definitely be stopping by here again
Chili dogs were fantastic. Ruben sandwich equally fantastic. Diversity of soft drinks second to none. Great place with great prices.
If the classic root beers and sodas don't sell you then the burgers will. Lots of choices of burgers but every one of them is great!

This place was deilcious! I went there today with my boyfriend and we both loved it. He got a bacon cheeseburger "Rocket Style" and he let me have some. The burger was cooked perfectly and the toppings were fresh (I especially loved the crispy bacon). I got a cali sandwich but ended up being so full from the bites I stole off my boyfriend's burger that I didn't finish it. Next time I think I will just get my own burger . I say get a burger "Rocket Style" and you will never want a normal burger again!

Also make sure you give your self some time to pick what soda you want because there are a ton of choices! I don't think of this as a negative factor (as some reviewers did), I think it makes this burger joint unique!
Had the chili cheese fries.  Was disappointed.  The cashier didn't know the menu at all.  Husband had a burger. One of the staff members said he would bring us mustard and forgot.

I would give it zero stars if possible. I couldn't even eat my cheeseburger. The meat had no flavor whatsoever. Went with two other people. They said the same. For the amount of money they charge, save yours and go somewhere else. So disappointing.

Have been wanting to try Rocket Burger for awhile now, and finally had my chance last night. Before even ordering, I picked out a bottled soda which took longer than the wait for my food. There are so many choices it was hard to decide!

I ordered the bacon cheeseburger and fried pickles, which both were so good. The others' in my party ordered the teriyaki burger and a kids chicken tender bites. Both of which they enjoyed. Not to mention all this food, with 3 bottled sodas was only $23. So we got great food, with great service, for a great value. Will be back again very soon!

First time here after reading the good reviews..I had a Tasteless chili cheese dog, bun was served broken in three pieces and was seemed to be old and stale. The soda machine was broken and cans of soda were offered but not with refills like machine sodas. Overall I was disappointed and will not be back.
This place is AMAZING! Grabbed the California burger with some cheese curds! Small hidden place but is awesome.

Stopped in for dinner tonight. Had the spousal unit and my mother along. Mom had regular burger, wife had the teriyaki burger and I gave the staff a choice between three burgers and they chose the Baja double. Baja was awesome loved the Mexican slaw and the hint of lime. Burger was fresh and cooked perfectly. We then chose fries, onion rings  and cheese curds. Fries were very good cheese curds were so good wife and mom wanted an order to go. 

Huge selection of craft soda as well as craft soda in the fountain nice change from big soda company. Will definitely be back to try other menu items.

Just gotta say yummy... so good it tickles... dw, my son, got the terriaki Burger... ummmm really??? With a fried pineapple slice.... let's just talk about the housemade terriaki sauce... and not your typical bun either... listen... don't get me wrong... its a Burger joint... BUT it's not 'just' another Burger joint... after all the 'taste is outta this world'... and the fries... exceptional!!! 

On to the cherry... they probably have over 200 different sodas... old school favs and some new school stuff... everything from Virgil's root beer... to the ever natural Oogave drinks... they even have one called dog snot and Kitty pittle (not feeling THAT adventurous today)... creamy deliciousness... 

Whether it's next door to you... or across town... it is DEFINITELY worth the ride...
Great food. But it is not cheap as advertised by Yelp with one $ sign. Its expensive.

2 weeks ago my bf and I were discussing Sonic and their slushies. That prompted a conversation about  "Slush Puppie" drinks that I grew up with back in Tennessee. I loved the lemon/lime ones that they used to sell at the local corner store. That prompted me to Google to see if anyone sold them now and in Phoenix. To my surprise Rocket Burger popped up! We decided to check them out as they also have over 300 sodas for sale some that are hard to find. I let out a child like squeal when we walked it. There it was, glowing like an angel!! SLUSH PUPPIES!!!!! I purchased the biggest size they had and it was as good as I remember as a child. The owner, Steve was very nice and we chatted him and his counter guys up for a bit. We took a look at their menu. WOW is all I can say. So many options. We went for the Double Bacon Cheese burger, fried mushrooms (with cornmeal). Absolutely delicious. The burger was tasty, flavorful and the bun toasted to perfection. The mushrooms were divine! Best outside of Bun Huggers up in Flagstaff. I would highly recommend this place. If you love vintage soda pop, a great burger and Slush Puppies check them out. We ended up ordering them for takeout last Friday night. My bf had the gyro burger and we ordered the french fries. I had the BCB again. Once again a great meal!! Will be returning over, and over again..

The burgers at this place are amazing! The different combos that are available create a burger that goes above and beyond, like the Reuburger, a combo of delicious burger and a reuben sandwich. The subs are pretty delectable, too. I helped my wife finish off a Philly Cheesesteak that hit the spot. Don't miss the mushrooms...a real treat! And talk about an incredible soda selection!
   I did experience a small issue on a recent visit...a part of my order was left out, and a return to pick it up was required. I contacted one of the owners, Steve, who sets a very high standard for customer service. He went above and beyond to correct the small issue, demonstrating genuine concern for his customers and the quality of the product and care with which it is served. Don't wait to try this little local joint...I can't see how any self-respecting lover of excellent burgers could be disappointed with this gem!

The food is so good! But you will be very disappointed with the service. The staff seems very cold and are not the most courteous. The atmosphere is run down and very dirty. But despite all this the food  is so good! Meats are tender and fresh and the buns are soft and very fresh. It might be best if you go drunk so that you can taste the food but forget what it's like on the inside

I'm going to go back.  If only to try a different soda.  Fantastic!  It honestly would be a 4.5 kind of place but I'm rounding up because of how quick the service was and the insane variety of sodas you can choose from.  it's basically the Total Wine of soda places.  I got some Leninade soda and it was delicious!  The wife got a grape soda that made you forget about any other grape soda you've ever had.  The food is great too.  I had the Santa Fe burger and it had a weird sweetness to it that I wasn't expecting (it had to be the pickles!) , and a very nice bun that absorbed everything the burger was throwing at it, and it was a lot (Good house sauce!).  Again, I will go back, and I will get root beer!

This place is awesome and I haven't even had the chance to go inside. My husband has picked up food and yummy sodas from here twice. He said the service was awesome and the owners are super nice. The food is yummy!!!! Best pastrami in town! My boys love the rocket sauce. The cheese curds and onion rings are the best! Best Deal in town.

I never do reviews, but I had to after going to Rocket Burger heaven!  This is my new guilty pleasure.  The burgers are juicy, big and satisfying, their subs are tasty and inventive, and their onion rings are awesome, crunchy greatness.  Their fries are perfectly crisp, and their fried mushrooms are crunchy, fresh and wonderful.
Super cheap, super tasty.  Like everyone says they've got a crazy amount of sodas (try Gale's rootbeer) and a Slushpuppy machine.  Everything I've tried has been good and they're quick.

This was my second time here. I had the double gyro burger.  I thought it was awesome and I was impressed for the second time in a row.  The owner brought out some Mexi Slaw and it had some amazing flavors.  They also have craft sodas on tap now and all of them were very true to taste and not too sweet. Love this place!
Excellent local burgers.  You HAVE to come see the ridiculously large gourmet soda selection.

If  you buy 5 of their hundreds of bottled sodas,  then you get one free.

The burgers and chicken sandwiches are awesome. I would go more often, but it is very warm in there during the summer.

Buffalo Chicken and the Afterburner are great. Very messy, but good.

Fries are awesome about 3/4 of the time. The other 1/4 of the time they are average.

The place looks like a dive from the outside...not much better inside, but great food and drink.

If you "sign-in" through Yelp or Facebook, then they give you 10% off!
awesome place! took my parents while they were visiting phoenix. great food and even better sodas and prices!

Best place ever to go eat. They prep everything there, home make all sauces and salad prep and it's absolutely delicious! Their California Club is absolutely delicious and outstanding! Their burgers are to die for! 12/10 would recommend.
For a local hamburger place this is it for me.  They have it all.  Great fries, wonderful burger, and good buns (and yes that's vital!).  Any soda you can think of!  GREAT PLACE!

Okay, so i went with 4 stars but there are a few caveats.  My first visit was a 5 star experience: i went on a weekday night with a moderate crowd.  The Chicago burger was everything I could ask for in a burger - super juicy and tasty.  My second experience was unfortunately a 3 star experience: I went on a Saturday afternoon with a line to the door.  Now I didnt mind the long line because thats a sign of quality food and my last burger had been amazing so i was happy to wait.  Unfortunately, the staff didn't seem to handle the rush all that well.  The girls at the register were still friendly but things got a little messy out on the floor and in the rush to get the food out to so many people a few things got overlooked.  Most noticeably, my fries came out a bit undercooked and there were some pools of oil in the basket.  I have a family of 5 and all of our fries were way too greasy, also I went with the Chili burger this time and the chili itself tasted canned so the burger lost that freshness.  Still, this is a good spot just avoid the rushes

This Is a Tasty Burger!!

Found this place on yelp looking for a non-major burger chain. I got the Sante Fe Burger, fry combo. So good! The burger was cooked perfectly with crispy bacon. The fries are amazing and everything came out quickly and hot. Sante Fe has a huge fried green child on it. Definitely be back.
They sell Dublin Dr Pepper. The food was good and reasonably priced, but let's stick to the important facts, they sell Dublin Dr Pepper.

Only disappointment leaving rocket burger is that we dont have room for more! Had the New York burger..again..and it was amazing as usual. Wife had the kraut dog and said it was the best sauerkraut she's had. Baby had a side of avocado that she chowed. Fried mushrooms were on point, and of course the awesome assortment of pop makes this Michigan family happy.

This place is awesome. My niece loves the rocket sauce on her burger and called it sublime. I had the Afterburner grilled chicken sandwich and it was excellent! All the different flavors were a perfect blend. The rocket relish and horseradish mayo with jalapeños added a nice kick. And you can share an order of fries. Plenty big and some of the best fries I've ever had.
Great burger place for sure! The fries are really good as well. Definitely worth going to.

I am normally not a burger person, but this little place won my heart.

I walked in with a wall of fridges full of variety of unusual sodas greeting me. The menu was simple but covers everything that you would want from a burger joint. 

Service was nice and quick. I ordered Cali Burger and was shocked by how good it was. The burger was juicy and moist, but not fatty or greasy. The bacon was crispy but not overwhelming. Avocado was fresh and green. The bun was toasted just right. 

I wasn't too impressed on the cheese fries, but their onion ring was deeeeeelicious!!!

Can't wait to take some friends to go with me soon!!
This place is fantastic! Awesome concept, Awesome Burgers, and 5-stars on bringing back slush puppies. Great place.
Omg!!! Amazing food!!! Service was fast and friendly!!! I will definitely be returning in the near future!!!

2 of us had the New Yorker it was amazing! Fresh bread great slaw packed with tender pastrami. 2 had the Angus cheese burger on home made bun equally as good. 1 had the chicken bites real chicken breast freshly breaded excellent! Try the fresh made onion rings delicious. Can't wait to go back.

Good but not great. My wife had a sub and I had a burger. Both were good. I will say the burger became such a mess I would have preferred a frock and knife. 

The fries were good but the cheese curds were awful. I literally has a bunch of curds that had no cheese. Also the cheese curds were overly salty. 

They don't serve name brand drinks but their own brand. It was nifty concept until I realized why the big names exist... they're better tasting. 

All in all they were good. I wouldn't go out of my way to eat here.

This place is rapidly becoming one of our favorites! I usually get the bacon cheeseburger, but decided to go out on a limb and try something different. Had the Mexican burger and was not disappointed. Onion rings and fried zucchini are both great--might be a bit too salty for some, but my family prefers to salt their salt. The topper is the soda pop selection. I'm totally addicted to the butterscotch root beer--currently.

Hard to find good chili fries in Arizona. This place has it down. Hand cut fries with a bean less chili on top, the way it should be. Burger was delicious with a soft bun with crispy edges.  Kudos to the friendly staff for their outstanding service.
The greatest! Every time I take a first bite into their double New York burger, my atheism falls under siege. This is manna from heaven.

Rocket Burger offers a variety of choices that you probably won't find at larger food chains. :P Pretty much everything there is delicious. And,and, AAAAND (Look how excited I am) they have a HUGE selection of bottled sodas. Seriously. There's just a WALL of carbonated, fizzy, goodness~.

Long trip from Las Vegas to Rocket Burger and Subs with the family. The food here makes the trip well worth it. Well, I'm actually here to see family, but we always have to stop at Rocket Burger when we're in town. Wifey and Grandma loves the meatball sub. I normally get the New Yorker, but I think the new fave is the Afterburner. And make sure you make it a double and get an order of onion rings with those delicious fries. Soda selection is boss. Chocolate soda is actually quite delish.
Love this place. A wall of coolers contains every bottled soda and rootbeer known to man. Great burgers, try the New Yorker sub.

I came to Rocket Burger expecting one thing and then got blown away entirely! I came in with my S.O. and we were greeted warmly by the girl behind the counter. She explained everything for us and was super helpful in suggesting the Santa Fe Burger. I loved it! We were able to pick from so many flavors of soda while we waited! Even though it was date night we still enjoyed the casual atmosphere and very low prices! Definitely coming back and recommending it to all our friends!!

Burgers are awesome, the buns really make the sandwich amazing. Cooks are really cool and care about how everything comes out. The family loves this place and the price is almost the same as fast food and only a million times better

Some of the best subs I have ever had!! And I travel a lot and will most definitely be coming back for more! Love the selection of soda's they have and being from Hawaii.... They even had some from there also. Loved the place!

What a find!  The location might leave a bit to be desired, but the burgers definitely do not.  This is a unique restaurant that has amazing burgers, fries, and a wall of bottled sodas. I ordered a double afterburner burger and with the works and it was a lot of food.  The horseradish mayo was awesome!  They have a triple burger (Rocket side) that I cannot imagine trying to take down!

If you prefer to stay away from the chain restaurants and are looking for a great burger, look no further!  I am looking forward to going back!

Wow.  Plain and simple.  Wow.  The Eddie Lopez pastrami burger was pure Awesome and the fries they came with were a delight.  Came in because of the yelp reviews.  Our party of nine was pleased.  I recommend the blueberry Maine root soda and the Gale's rootbeer.  I am glad there is a place like this on the west side.  I am looking forward to my next visit.  Cheers to rocket burgers and subs!
Love this place!  I often bring my guests from out of town and never fails... Everyone loves the food and atmosphere!  My guests often just want to come back for the wide variety od drinks!

I would give it 4 stars if they would use the Air Conditioner.  With all of the soda combinations and solid burgers what's not to like.  It's hard to enjoy your food when it's so dang hot inside.  I will return when the temps come back down.

We've been here twice now and we love this place! Everything we have ordered has just been fantastic and we can't wait to go back again!

The rocket burger? Yum, yum, yum!!! The roast beef with the horseradish mayo on sourdough? Delish!!!!! Fries? Could they be any better?? The large greek salad (add a side of gyro for a $1?). Uh yes, please!!

Top off all that food, with great prices, more kinds of bottled soda than you can shake a stick at (including a Judge Wapner variety!), and super friendly staff --- we will be lifetime addicts!
:-)

The old adage of "it's what is on the inside that matters" is true when it comes to this place! It's located in an older strip mall with a Church's Chicken in the front, not someplace boyfriend and I would stop for on a whim, but other Yelpers had good things to say and they were spot on. It's in a renovated convenience store, so the layout is a bit odd. Also, it was kind of humid when we went, nothing too unbearable though. The food was phenomenal! I got a pulled pork sandwich (which just melts in your mouth) and boyfriend got a New York burger. He said that the pastrami is strange, but in a good way. The soda selection is unreal! Rows and rows with bottle after bottle of quite possibly every type of soda you can imagine. We'll definitely be back!

Great food awesome prices and a monsterous selection non alcoholic drinks (over 300) I just tried the "afterburner chicken combo" about 8 dollars with fries drink and tax included.  Wow that was an amazing sandwhich . . . I live over 40 miles from the shop but eat here as often as I can because of the value and quality of the food!

Went to Rocket Burger & Subs today after reading so many positive things from Yelp and was not disappointed.  

The food was very good, fresh and Yay...Faygo soda!! The soda selection is awesome and unique.  We got two Faygo's w/ lunch and got two different sodas to try later.  Shoestring fries were very good and hot.  Roast beef sandwich very good as was California Club.  Chicken strips were very good and were real meat; not like the pressed chicken you get at other places.  We plan to come back often and try more menu items and stock up on Faygo.

The owners are also friendly and personable which gives this place an old school, neighborhood establishment kind of vibe.  I think it is important to keep our entrepreneurial spirit alive and love to support local businesses; especially when they show the kind of quality, attention to detail and personality that Rocket Burger and Subs displayed on our visit.

I wish I could give this place more stars. But a place with the word "Burgers" in it led me to setting high expectations for the burger I ordered. Thank goodness for my big appetite that day because I ordered the regular burger and a chili dog. 

The chili dog was spot on! The burger, cold and not much to it. Maybe I should have sent it back, but I hate being wasteful, so I ate it. But sadly that made me not want to order a burger there again for a long time. I'll give it another chance someday because of high rating.

Like trying new places and going to places like this over a chain restaurant. Love the wall of bottled sodas. I am doing low carb right now and ordered the after burners but with no bun and just asked for some sort of lettuce wrap or just on lettuce. It came out in an awesome chopped salad with the burger on top and it was awesome. Burger with no bun can be pretty simple but this was not at all. Love it.

I have dined twice for their sandwiches, and they are average at best. Haven't sampled their hot dogs or hamburgers yet, maybe that is their strong point. However, they have a HUGE selection of bottled pop.  And they have FAYGO, in glass bottles made with cane sugar.  Excellent!  If you haven't had faygo go and try a bottle.

Thanks to Yelp happened on this nice friendly burger/sub shop. Great friendly staff putting out high quality food. Best selection of craft soda from all over. We had a really good pastrami sandwich which I am extremely picky about and a green chilli burger with delicious cheese curds and fried pickles definitely coming back here again. You won't be disappointed if you try it. Owner of the business super nice. Thanks Rocket Burger.
I love this place! I like having so many soda options and the food was super yummy ! Can't wait to go back!

A couple of coworkers and I went to Rocket Burger for lunch today based on one of those coworkers' recommendation of the place.

The staff member who took my order was very nice and the food was ready within about five minutes which was nice. And the wall covered in different sodas from all over the place was pretty cool.

While I enjoyed the fries very much due to the seasoning I was only mildly impressed with the burger itself. I got a double bacon cheeseburger which I expected to enjoy and finish. There was something about the sauce though that I couldn't figure out and it ruined my experience.

I hate the fact that something like the flavor of the sauce has anything to do with my rating of the place, but it was something I couldn't get through and I couldn't finish my burger. I tried working through it, too. It just got to a point where o couldn't ignore it any longer and the aftertaste was no different.

Would I visit again? Most likely but I won't be going out of my way to do so.

My wife and I saw that this place had some great reviews on yelp so we decided to try it out.

Yelp was right! Place was excellent! Burgers were great! The staff was very nice and friendly. The guy taking are order had asked if we had been here before and we said no, he then proceeded to go over the menu and answered any questions we had. We ordered and it only took about ten minutes to receive our food. Burgers and fries were delicious! I will definitely be returning to try more things!

One phrase, SLUSH PUPPY! I've been looking for Slush Puppy in Arizona since I moved here.  Rocket Burger has it!!. Also they feature an modest selection of eclectic bottled sodas; root beer, sarsaparilla, blue etc.  Friendly & fast service, very casual atmosphere and cheap.  Had a basic burger and a bag of chips (sweet Maui onion)  $3.50. The burger was well seasoned, bun was toasted, served with a thousand islandy sauce.

Was in Phoenix from Toronto for business conference. Drove about 25 minutes to get this burger based on reviews on Yelp. Got a Double Afterburner and a Single Chilli burger with onion rings. The guy at the counter, who I think is one of the owner's, was VERY nice and polite. If you are a fan of soda, they have a HUGE selection of about 300 different sodas to choose from. I grabbed a 4-pack of Jones Blue Cream Soda for about $7.50 (!).

NASTY!

The onion rings were coated in a VERY thin layer of disgusting batter. it was of a dark brown colour and not very good at all. Both of my burgers (I love food) had soggy buns and were not very good at all. I don't recommend this place at all. I would rather eat at In & Out.

we were here visiting from San Diego and this place popped up on our Google search. After reading the reviews we decided to try it out and we are soo glad we did! this place was absolutely delicious. Definitely recommend if you're in the area!

Wow!! We came here to eat after seeing the reviews. Well we came here from Utah for a concert and we will come back again next time we come down. The burgers are the bomb!! Five different burgers and they were all fantastic !! And the soda pop selection was second to none. Until next time.

Although their prices are a little steep for burgers they are worth it. I got the Philly cheese steak burger and it was to die for.... no for real I think I had a heart attack eating all that grease. but all jokes aside it was everything A burger should be! Can't wait to try some of the other menu items. I just wish they serve their cheese curds with marinara sauce

There's a reason why this place has 355 near perfect reviews. On our first visit, I had the Santa Fe and my wife had the Cali burger. Both were excellent. We shared a basket of fries that were cut in-house. This is the quintessential hole-in-the-wall spot. If you're in the area, this is a must try.

The serving sizes here were gigantic. The pricing is fair, and the menu is varied. I came with a group of 10 and everyone liked their order. The service wasn't incredibly fast, but it was reasonable. The people there were also really nice, and the soda selection might be the most at any restaurant in the state of Arizona. I look forward to returning.
I dare you to find a better selection of soda paired with awesome food. Great staff that strives to give you great service and food.

This place is amazing! Don't let this rough looking little shopping plaza scare you off because inside the shop is some of the tastiest food in this part of town.  The Chili Cheese Fries are a must!  The "Rocket Burger" is a steal, imagine 3 burger patties with cheese and all the fixin's on a sub roll for 6 bucks (makes the $6 burger at Carl's Jr. look like child's play).  If you want something spicy ask for the "Thunder Bird", a buffalo chicken sub with bacon, ranch or blue cheese, and the optional fresh jalapeños. And if all of that is not enough to make you want to go these guys stock an insane amount of rare sodas that you will not find just any where. I think they had about 12 kinds of root beer! This is defiantly not fine dining so please excuse the rough decor, this is straight up man fuel.

I know many people like this place but I am just telling my experience. 
I was not impressed at all.  We got the Afterburner burger and cali burger, fries and onion rings.   We were the only people in the place and all our food was luke warm or room temprature.  The patties were very thin and thinking I would get pickled jalapenos on my burger they were actually raw. Every burger place I have been has never had raw jalapenos - maybe I should have asked or maybe they shoul post they are raw.  The onion rings batter was not even batter it tasted more like cornmeal and they were room temperature - should be hot.  The buns were hard and not soft at all.  Our first time is our last time there. Sorry but very poor food quality.
The best burgers in this area! The bottled soda selection is like nothing you've seem before. The Santa Fe burger is my favorite

Simply put, one of the best burger shops in the city.  The meat is fresh, albeit a tad greasy, the cheese and bacon rock, and their crazy twist on 1000 island is awesome!  Only detractor is the grease as it destroys the bread.  But the main event?  The cooler packed with the 350 best soft drinks you never new existed!  Sprecher rootbeer at 1.89 a bottle all day!

I've been coming here off and on pretty much since the place opened, but took a break of about a year. Recently, however, I'm not sure if I can still think of it as 4-star, because of the inconsistency that appears to have woefully only happened to me based on these reviews.

The last burger I ordered looked and smelled wonderful until I picked it up and so much rocket sauce ran out that I considered hooking up my pool draining equipment to siphon some of it out. Rather overpowering. After scraping some off, I took a bite and holy black pepper! It was like an employee played a prank and unscrewed the top of the pepper shaker and instead of making a new burger thought "eh, they might like coughing and gasping for breath while army-crawling to the sink for water". After shoveling off the pepper, I enjoyed the burger. They have great buns and I know great buns, because I do daily squat thrusts.

Well, aside from the fact that half of the burger was medium-rareish (I like) and the other half well-done (nooo!). Not sure how that was managed.

Fries: completely inedible. The oil was obviously not hot enough. The only texture was soggy followed by waves of oil coating my mouth.

I'll keep occasionally going there, but probably never at nights again. The kitchen staff looked rather young. I recall that I used to stop by on school day afternoons, back when I would have easily given this pace 4-stars.

Was searching for a place to eat before a Halloween party. Saw rocket burger on the map and had heard someone mention them a week earlier.
Ordered the "Eddie Lopez" double burger, had pastrami on top.
Best damn burger.....not better than mine....but close :-D
Fries suck but i just wont order them again.
Service was good and the owner is there every time i go and is very friendly.
Which is probably the reason for 5 stars, i don't hand them out like candy....
(Edit: Changed to 4 star, gotta keep the 5 stars exclusive)
They have over 200 different sodas in the fridge which is pretty unique.

Ive been back 3 times and will keep going back.

I love this restaurant so much.....I'm from California and Austin Texas and whenever I'm in Phoenix it's a Must that I have to come here to eat. Great food and they have tons of soda's that I never even heard of before and it's hella cool trying those different drinks and the manager is a really nice person and great staff. I found out about this place one time I was in Phoenix with my friends we were looking for a good place to eat and I checked on my iPad for places to eat so I went on yelp and I found Rocket burger and subs and it got a good Rating so I told my friends for us to try it out and we all loved it so much....so if your visiting Phoenix You must come here to eat and taste all the different drinks.....wish they had a location is California and Texas
This place is a hidden gem! Awesome burgers, awesome fries, and the best selection of soda I have ever seen.  Ever I'm ever back on the west side, I will be back.
I ordered a Santa Fe burger it was delicious & the chili cheese fries were ridiculous lol very cute place, it was a little warm in there but other then that it was awesome. Defiantly will be back

This place is tucked away in my old stomping grounds. As a former "Rocket" I had to see what they hype was about. Took a drive into my ol' hood. And was shocked how the neighborhood had changed so much in 30 years! Rocket Burger is tucked behind Church's Chicken. It did not disappoint! I have been there twice now. I have tried the rueben sandwhich, California club, California burger, the NYer fries and onion rings. All of it was great and affordable. The subs are packed with meat and the sandwiches are big enough for two people to split. My least favorite was the burger. But for subs I would go back. The onion rings were crunchy, with a light coat of batter, and thinner which I like. The fries were just ok. But then, fries are not my thing. My kids liked that they could pick out any type of soda. I picked one that tasted like a mojito. My daughter had a pear soda, and my youngest had a delicious rootbeer that had butterscotch in it. The coleslaw on the NYer was great! It was fresh and crunchy! In fact all the vegetables were fresh! Even the avocado, it wasnt just a little bit that came on the burger, but it was enough to cover the entire bottom bun. The tomato was wasnt chintzy either, Yay! Great family business that I would support any day over the big guys. This place rocks. And all of us can find something to eat here. Score!

Have I got a place for you un-health conscious, frugal foodies out there!  Rocket Burger and Subs serves up huge sandwiches and fried delights for astonishingly low prices, and much of the food is home-made. There's also an enormous section of unusual soft drinks; for instance, there's over two dozen brands of root beer to choose from. Dennis, one of the owners worked for A&W for 8 years, so he probably has root beer running through his veins by now. 

     I saw Rocket Burger in a listing of new valley eateries, then did a little research. The reviews I saw were all stellar, so I knew we had to give it a try. It doesn't look like much, inside or out - it's in a little strip mall tucked behind Churches Chicken at 35th Ave. and Cactus. But it's clean, and everybody is helpful and pleasant. Ken gave a happy whoop when he saw Cheese Curds ($2.49/$4.49) on the menu. We decided to get an order while waiting for our friends Randy and Marty to join us. The curds came quickly out of the kitchen, piping hot, served with some tasty homemade marinara. They were a touch greasy, as they should be, and the oil was fresh. Marty and Randy arrived in time to save us from ourselves by helping to finish off the curds. Then we took a while trying to make our selections from the extensive menu. Eventually Randy and I both went for the New Yorker: pastrami with homemade slaw and thousand island dressing ($2.99, $3.99 or $4.99). Ken had a homemade-meatball  sub, with more of that good marinara and some provolone. It was the same price structure as our New Yorkers and all the rest of the entries under Classic Subs and Sandwiches. Marty went with a double burger ($3.89, the singles are $1 less). He could have opted for a Rocket Burger - !0 inch sub with three burgers and the fixings in either plain, cheese, bacon, teriyaki, or chili style ($4.99 to $5.99). Of course we had to try the fries and onion rings.

     Again our food arrived quickly, served in plastic baskets. It became very quiet, except for the occasional growl of pleasure. The onion rings ($1.99) had been dipped in a thin cornmeal batter which made them nice and crunchy.  The handcut fries ($1.49) were skinny, the way I like them. Randy thought they were undersalted, but I thought they were fine - our usual disagreement. At any rate, they disappeared quickly. Unlike the sandwiches. They were so big that we all ended up taking half of each sub home. The slaw on the New Yorkers was delicious, as was my whole wheat sub roll. The meat balls were nice and tender, and there was plenty of cheese on top. Randy had found a bottle of ginger beer imported from Australia that had a wonderfully refreshing true ginger taste. There seemed to be actual pieces of ginger in it - instructions on the label said to invert the bottle before opening. It never did tell you to turn it right side up again - the Aussies give us more credit than we deserve. 

     Other food items available: Hebrew National hot dogs in several styles ($2.49), Pizza  
Bread with various toppings, Gyros ($3.69), salads ($1.99 - $3.99), a fish sandwich ($2.49) served with homemade tartar sauce. And lots more. I don't know how Dennis and Steve manage to turn out food of this quality for so little money, but I surely do hope they continue and prosper!

We LOVE this place!! Excellent food at reasonable prices!!! It is clean and the service is outstanding. Worth a drive from anywhere in the valley. Goodbye Churches and hello Rocket Burger & Subs!!! May your stay be a long one!!!!!

Wow! So a friend introduced me to this place and I have to say, I'm quite impressed. 

My first time there, after perusing the menu, I got a single "gyro burger". It's as awesome as it sounds! My friend and I ordered two combos, a 6 pack of their awesome classic soda collection and some chili cheese fries. 

The portions will fill ya'. 

The owner is very friendly and quite helpful if you're new to the menu. 

I loved "Pop the Soda Shop" and it moved all around AZ until, I guess they closed. I don't know if they merged or something, but they have everything they had there. All the sodas! 

I'm introducing another friend of mine to the place next week! I can't recommend  it enough!
My husband and I been wanting to try this place and we finally did. Wasn't bad at all. The price is very reasonable and they have a great selection of root beers. Will come back again.
Great burger with many options for how'd you like it. Crazy amount of beverages, more than you could possibly imagine. Try it out, you won't be disappointed.

First time trying this place and Yelp did not disappoint!!!  This place looks a bit iffy from the outside but once you enter everyone is friendly and inviting!  Iffy only in the sense that you aren't sure if the business is open or closed, busy not busy, etc as the windows are tinted fairly dark.  Do not let the outside scare you away, give it a try!  The selection of beverages is amazing and the burger selections are vast!  Definitely coming back again!

I never noticed this place when I used to live on 35th and Greenway driving to work every day...man I missed out. Recently I decided to try it based on the good ratings/reviews. On the first visit I decided to try the Sante Fe burger (double) w/ habanero cheese that was nice and melted running down the sides of the patties, It was like biting into heaven. There is so much flavor packed into this thing its ridiculous...in a good way of course. First walking into this place was a little intimidating for me because I'm just weird like that. To the south wall  they have about a 24ft cooler of all kinds of sodas and to the west is where you order your food. The staff is VERY friendly and polite. If anyone is looking for a good ol local place to eat with a good variety of burgers, subs, sandwiches and drinks then give them a try, you will not be disappointed...and if you are then you are the one with the problem haha

Solid food and a large selection of vintage sodas.
It was worth the drive :) had a burger and it was very good.

Excellent. Truly excellent. Rocket Burger has a huge menu with very creative burger concoctions, subs, sides and more. Ive only had the burgers, becasue they're SOO GOOD and I cant get anything else (yet) however, the subs that ive seen others get are massive, and look delicious. They make everything fresh and its obvious. Workers are polite and quick. Place is clean, not very big but it works. Now, the soda selection. Holy moly. They have any soda you can think of, and theres more at the "Pop shop" right next door. Pepsi and another craft soda that im not familiar with on fountain, and EVERYTHING else in bottles. All in all, great experience. One of my favorite hole in the walls in phoenix. Would recommend to anyone and everyone who loves a good burger and a cold soda.

THIS IS MY FAVORITE PLACE TO EAT IN ARIZONA. Everything in the menu is amazing. They can make burgers into salads which is a plus for me. They're super friendly and will answer any and all questions. We go here like once a week.

Yes, I know, this is my 2nd update so I'll try to make it short & sweet. 

I bought a Groupon about a week ago & decided to use it this past Saturday when the hubs & I were trying to think of a place to have lunch. I got the chili cheese dog this time & it was delicious! Cheese burger & onion rings were freakin yum as usual & I have to say the fries were better this time around. We went a lil crazy & got 4 additional sodas, along with the 2 we had during lunch, 2 root beers, 2 cream sodas & 2 orange sodas. I also have to add, since this was our 1st time dining in, how clean it was! They had a girl at the register this time & she was super sweet.

We love this place!!

Was expecting a great burger after reading the reviews, but I honestly didn't even finish half of my burger because it was just disgusting. However, this was my first time here and I may have just ordered the wrong thing. Also, a warning for anyone who orders online they don't check the 'special instructions', as there were mushrooms all over my burger. It's a good thing that I'm not allergic. Overall, the burger wasn't made with quality ingredients and left the grossest feeling in my stomach and taste in my mouth. I feel bad saying that, but would have taken an in-n-out burger over that in a heart beat.

The coolest part of this place has to be the wall of the sodas. Bottled sodas that you've never heard of; I want to go back just to try more. I got two to take home: a Moxie for myself and this Japanese soda for my wife. The former was very old fashioned (I should have known by the Ted Williams poster they have displayed by the case) and not very good, at least to my taste. My wife's soda was a strawberry-flavored beverage with a really interesting bottle design and mechanism to open. It looked like a baby bottle and you use part of the top to open it...hard to explain.

As for the food, I had a chili cheese burger that was quite tasty. The burgers are served on large, soft buns perfect for their hefty burger creations. The chili was pretty sold, a firm B+ (nowhere can come close to the best chili cheeseburger in the world, which fyi, is at Tommy Burger in Los Angeles). The fries were just so so, not quite crispy enough.

I'll definitely be back and I'll come with an even bigger appetite, probably for the Philly Burger :)

Man this place is great! Good burgers and the soda selection is out of this world. Have a friend from Kentucky who is able to get a ginger ale that he has been searching for since he got here around 8 years ago!

Lots of sodas from everywhere.  Some from my childhood even! Good place to get a burger or even a rare  soda or something  new. Food is good could be better no matter  the location . My experience  was 5 star but this is a unique  place so I feel that  they should  be out of  the norm there are plenty  of burger joints near here but this one has all the desire to show here first. Maybe  they need to sponsor  a racecar or something  to say  hey we are here.  Great place love it
Great food and great service! I always struggle to decide amongst all of their yummy subs and countless drink choices. Their fries are delicious!

Awesome place with quality service.

They have an incredibly large variety of sodas. And management is perfect.

I appreciate places that show quality and care, not only in what they produce but also in how it's shown through customer service. I will definitely be coming back!

Was a good burger!  The soda selection is SO HUGE tried the root beer.  It's a lot of items to choose from my co worker got the hot dog said it was good with a milk shake.  I will be back to try more.

I found this burger joint on yelp, being from out of town yelp is a big help. We missed this restaurant the first time it's tucked in an unassuming strip mall right next to a church's fried chix.  We almost did not go in it was not impressive looking , but because of all the positive reviews we sucked it up and gave it a try . I had the double Teri burger ( lett, Tom , onion mayo,and pineapple) usually when I have a teri burger I omit the pineapple, what the heck does pineapple have to do with teriyaki? I did not omit the pineapple because they dip it in cornmeal and fry it, crazy,but good . The sauce was a little to thin. The burger was very good even with the runny sauce. The fries were made in house and very good , large portion. The owner or manager? Very friendly. We will be back

Best damn burger in town hands down they will make almost anything to order! Their topped burgers are dynamite the fries are super. The chili OMG is absolutely out of freaking sight. Oh and the soda selection is perfect compliment to wash down all the amazing food they have to offer. Thank you guys for the best quality beef,  best service,  and damn yummy food love this place..

Price for the quality.of food is excellent. I wasn't sure what to expect when I walked in. The floors were dingy and most of the tables still had food on them. 

The menu is packed full of interesting combos or you can build your own sandwich. I chose the beast. A hot roast beef sandwich with roasted red peppers, horseradish mayo and all the usual lettuce tomato fixins. It was a stellar sandwich. My son got a build your own and it came out with lots of meat and veggies piled high. No skimping here. 

I took off one star because the bathrooms and floors aren't clean. They really need to be redone. I always wonder about the cleanliness of the kitchen when I see dirty dinghy bathrooms.

This restaurant is one of Phoenix's best kept secrets behind the Church's Chicken. The service is topnotch, the food is amazing, and the drink selection is up there with the best of them. 

I went there for the first time two days ago with my Mom. I got the recommendation from a couple of friends who share the same love of this kind of food that I do. I ordered the Afterburner Burger and it exceeded my expectations. It had just the right amount of heat. I also ordered fries and onion rings and they did not disappoint. My mom ordered the reuben and it looked pretty good.  The food prices are cheap which made the food taste even better.

Not only is the food good, but they have a huge selection of vintage soda that would blow your mind. They receive extra points for having the Texas born "Dublin Dr. Pepper" in stock. 

The owner doesn't talk much but the service is amazing. The ambiance is a little dive-y but it adds to the experience. 

All in all, Rocket burger is a great restaurant to chow down on your favorite foods.

Been here twice both times were great. Just a simple burger and sandwich place nothing fancy and that's what I want. I miss the burgers you get in SoCal and this place does it's own twist not the same but good enough. I wish they would pay as much attention to the fountain soft drinks as they to the bottle soft drinks the fountain drinks are a bit flat boring. The burgers are on point and I haven't had a bad one yet.

I love supporting local businesses, ESPECIALLY when they're within walking distance!  With Dennis manning the register and Steve and Raquel puttin' the eats together, this team of good people makes Rocket Subs AND MORE! a very nice eating experience.

Stop by and check out their exceptional selection of bottled sodas!

Great little hole in the wall burger joint. The all beef hot dog was amazing. The pastrami burger was also fantastic. The bacon cheese burger is good, but not the best thing I've ever eaten. I think the sweetness of the rocket sauce takes away from the burger taste but overall is good. Amazing soda selection and I'll definitely be back. I would suggest a good scrub down and a fresh coat of paint for the place, but the food was great.
Amazing!! The New Yorker is addictive as well as the onion rings. The selection of soda is a blast. We'll be back!!
Fantastic food and a crazy soda selection. Always have great customer service and I recommend it to everyone

I stopped in for lunch, based on the reviews I was SO stoked for this burger and "best onion rings" and was disappointed. The burger was OK, like a whopper is ok. And the onion rings were some of the least flavorful I've tasted. I will not be returning for $12 burger, onion rings and drink meal. The soda selection is impressive but that's about it. Too bad I don't drink soda.  The girl at the counter was very pleasant though.
 I ordered the afterburner burger, and ate half of it; the sauce was very spicy and that was the highlight of the burger. Eh.
Great sandwiches! Skip the chains and get the REAL stuff here for less! HUGE selection of bottled sodas. Do not miss Rocket Burger & Subs!

This place is amazing.  The food is far and above any fast-food place you could go to.  Heck, you would probably pay less here and get superior food.  An Slush Puppie machine!? Crazy big bottled soda selection?! This place is a hidden jem that all should go to!

10% off with Yelp check in!!! There is an amazing selection if soda pop. It makes my GF crazy when I call it pop. Location is not the best, but I never felt like I was in immediate danger. Good staff. Clean. Yummy stuff. If you are loitering around 35th ave and Cactus, this is the place for you.

I'm not sure as to the reason behind the high rating for this organization, but IMHO, the food was fairly average. A letter grade of C-.  The fries had a sweet aftertaste, which for not being sweet potato fries was strange. The portion for the standard combo fries is rather large and would have been a plus if not for their sweetness. The burger itself was not particularly memorable, with its blending of flavors advertised (gyro double burger) into one creamy greesy taste. The soda choices however are large and encompassing so I'd your not a fan of Pepsi products, you've got choices. 

P. S. An item that did concern me was the cooks decision to take their smoke break at the kitchen door at front of the store. Eye contact was made along with a wiff of Tabacco when I walked in, followed by the uneasiness of watching the same cook enter the kitchen area while I was placing my order. I will not speculate if the cook had washed their hands or not, or whether they were the only cook on duty, but there was no sink in view of the front counter that was used upon their re-entry.
The burgers are really good, the staff is friendly, the soda fountain soda is delicious, and the variety of bottled sodas and drinks is on point!

My husband and I ate here today.  I saw it on check please so I wanted to check it out.  The service was absolutely awful.  The guy taking our order was rude, wasn't helpful and wouldn't fully answer our questions.  We ordered a Cali chicken sandwich that had no taste and the bacon was way over cooked, and I like crispy bacon!  My husbands burger was eh, alright.  We ordered our food to eat there but the guy that took our order, that was staring us down as we picked out our sodas, gave us our food to go.  It was pretty obvious he wanted us to leave, but we stayed anyway.  We ate some of the food and left the rest.  Will never go back and will tell our friends to never go in the first place.

I would like to call this a burger review but that does not quite convey how different this place is. You know that friend who prides himself on his grilling skills? Combine that with a substantial bun and toppings not supplied by the lowest bidder and you have Rocket Burger. I scolded my kid thinking she was eating daddy's double. Nope just the single is huge! Super fast too!

We want there for the first time 7 weeks ago.  We have been back weekly since even though it's a 20 minute drive for us.  My wife and I simply cannot stay away from the Afterburner burger.  The kids love the place with the great soda selection and the mini corn dogs.  Great place.

My head was spinning from the gourmet soda selection. It sort of overshadowed the food in this, my first trip. I had the Chicago style burger...the accoutrements were perfect, down to the last pickled relish drop. My only complaint is that the bun was sub-par...a nice, soft sesame seed bun would have made the burger more memorable. Burger to bun ratio was a little bit off. I will definitely return, and suggest you do the same!

Delicious food and a good value! 

I've been going to Rocket Burger for years now and I can't get enough of it every time I pop in. Their Teriyaki burger is sublime, among the best I've had (including "gourmet" burgers) and the fries are the perfect balance between crunchy and fluffy. 

The selection of sodas are to die for, there's something for everyone. 

Though the price is more expensive than a meal at In-N-Out, the difference is well worth it. I spend around $8-10 every time I eat there for a burger, fries, and a bottled drink or two. 

This is definitely a must-have for anybody in the Phoenix area.
Great soda selection, delicious food...I love their chocolate ice cream cone, but they are almost always out of chocolate. The garlic chicken makes up for it though!!!

Outstanding! Gets a bump for being a friendly, family owned establishment on the Northwest side. Will be back. 

1) Afterburner fried chicken sandwich- Considering I don't eat beef or pork, I've had my fair share of fried chicken sandwiches. I would have to put this is the top 5 I've ever had- the breading was perfect, the veggies were fresh, but the rocket relish makes the sandwich unique and memorable. A legitimate "spicy" chicken sandwich.  

2) New York Burger- my wife decided to go for an extra meaty option, and she loved it. It comes with a burger patty, pastrami, and her husbands bacon from the chicken sandwich. Also cole slaw. She also said the fries were well seasoned. 

3) SO MANY SODAS- I'm not a huge soda drinker, but the sheer volume and variety is pretty amazing. Chocolate, bacon, and more root beer flavors than you can imagine are all options.
This place was unexpectedly good. Love their buns. Their was a ton of flavor. I had the philly and it was yummy. Their onion rings are good too. Lightly breaded and crispy.

Best SODA selection ever!!! Not opinion it's FACT

Solid sides and food, nice atmosphere.

Maybe I went in on the wrong night. I did takeout for my family last night. The staff was friendly, the service was prompt and the atmosphere was definitely unique in a good way. But, the food was not what we expected. The bread tasted sour, the meat was dry and the fries were nothing special. Rocket burger has been on my list of places to try for a while, and now that I had a chance to go I'm sadly disappointed.
Oh my goodness, this place is the best especially all of the sodas they have. Every flavor, the burgers and fries are great with the special sauce. I would love to go back in the near future.
Best Chicago dog I've had in a long time. Tons of fancy sodas to choose from and even though I'm not a shoestring fry person the were seasoned perfectly.

Staff was super friendly and helpful.  Portion size was perfect.  Fries were tasty.  Had a New Yorker as recommended by the staff and was not disappointed.  The soda selection is amazing and worth the trip on its own.

The only weirdness is the restroom.  It's shared male/female and the door won't lock.  Hmmmm.......

All in all .... OUTSTANDING!

Eh..maybe I went on an off day. Or maybe I shouldn't have ordered a hotdog. I got the Chicago, my wife, a regular. It was decent but not worth the drive for me. Should of stuck with regular fries... the chili cheese fries were pretty gross... and I'm a huge fan of chili cheese fries. However, their soda wall is impressive! Tons of great choices. $1.99 per bottle. I guess that's the going price, but wish it was less... Pretty gross location and the inside was clean but smelled of grease. I guess I should of assumed that walking in.

It's not terrible, but not great. Prices were decent overall and the service was fast and friendly. I'd only go back if I was in the area which I doubt I'll be any time soon.

Best Burger I have ever had. My friends and I finished our burgers in less than 15 mins because of how good each one was. The fries were crispy and tasty. The meat itself was cooked to perfection and it all tasted great and left a smile on all our faces. Definitely try it out! You won't be disappointed!

Rocket burger has the best milkshakes in town. My lactose intolerance was cured. (Not cured by the milkshakes it was some godly miracle if you're lactose intolerant wait until you get help) good burgers

This place is AWESOME!! I have been going here for years and they never dissapoint..their New Yorker sandwich is the best!! And they have really good burgers too..I moved to downtown Phoenix but I go back there because I can't get that sandwich anywhere else...I wish they had another location close to me

I can not believe that I have not reviewed this place yet with as much as I go there! 

I have been  going to Rocket Burger for a couple of years now and on a regular basis... maybe 2-3 times per month. I have NEVER been disappointed. 

I get the Cali Burger which has bacon (which is always crispy) and avocado (which is always perfectly ripe).  It also has rocket sauce  on it which is like no other "secret" sauce I have had before. You just have to try it.  The amazing bun that the hamburger comes with is more like a crusty roll type bread rather than the standard seeded bun. 

The fries are good, but overshadowed by how amazing their burgers are. 

The soda selection is like nothing I have ever seen before. Hundreds of choices. Bottled sodas from across the nation and soda I have not seen in years! 

Oh and the service - they are great! They actually thank you for coming in and say by when you leave. They know who I am (as they should since I go there so often), but they really give it a personal touch! 

This is my#1 burger joint - hands down! So glad I work so close to this place!

You would be a fool not to give this place a try!

This place has AMAZING BURGERS!!!! The owner is just about the nicest man alive! I always go for the spicy ghost pepper burger!!!! The soda selection is out of this world you can find anything from grape to pickle and even bacon soda! This is a cool landmark spot to bring your buddies or yourself to!

Dave was craving a cheeseburger sub, which I thought were nonexistent out here; however, after a quick search on yelp we found this place and it wasn't too far, only about 10 miles. I was hoping to find that little gem, but unfortunately I didn't. I had a single cheeseburger, I liked everything except the rocket sauce...no matter what you call it, it's 1000 island on all these burgers (In/Out, McD's and every other burger place with special sauce is either straight up 1000 island or some variant of it), and normally I like it; however, I did not care for this particular version. It was watery.  I did like the actual burger.

Again, I'm a lover of onion rings and I was super excited to see all the great reviews, until I actually tried them. I didn't care for them at all. The breading was horrible, I ate them because I was hungry...the breading did not grow on me! 

The selection of sodas was amazing, they have an extensive menu, the prices are extremely reasonable, the service friendly, the customers eclectic, but the overall quality of the meal was just 3 stars for me.

I wish I would have found this place must sooner!! Rocket Burger & Subs, where have you been?  This place is amazing!  Their food is fresh ~ cooked after it's ordered.  They have several burger and sandwich options to chooses from with different sides.  They have the LARGEST cola in a bottle selection I've ever seen and they have super service!

Food~ Rocket burger was awesome! burger patties cooked to perfection and trimmed to fit on a sub role.  The role was fresh and my burger came with lots of veggies and dressing.  The fries were awesome ~ cooked fresh like mom makes them.  We also had their onion rings based on the Yelp reviews, YUM!  The cola selection is mind blowing! I'm going to keep coming back until I've tried each one : -)

I must say, I was impressed by how savory and delicious the food was! I got the new york burger: one of the best burgers I ever had. It was to die for! All the ingredients were well balanced. The pastrami in the burger was so tender and juicy. The coleslaw had a lot of great flavor to it, along with the tasty sauce. 

I really enjoyed the French fries. Some of my favorite french fries. 

My husband had the Cali burger. The cheese in it looked so luscious on top of the patties, bacon, and avocado that I had to try it. I definitely recommend the Cali and new york burger. The bread, ingredients, and protein were all incredibly delicious and my taste buds can concur! ;)

Our first time here and it was fantastic!! The staff were friendly and our burgers were made to perfection. I get a "bunless" type and wasn't disappointed with the generous lettuce and tomato under the delicious meat. 
My hubby got the "after burner" and it was definitely spicy and delicious!!
The fries were a little on the salty side but still yummy. 
Would definitely come back!!

Bomb ass hamburger.  No hamburger extraordinaire could go unsatisfied.  The burgers come on sesame submarine buns so they are quite bigger than most. The fries are a tad sloppy and they have the largest selection of craft soda I've ever seen.  If you ate everyday you'd be the biggest man on the planet, but a satisfied one at that.

Went here with the family and it was delicious! Really love their selection of glass bottled sodas too! Picked up a few cases for a birthday party. We're definitely going to go back to eat and have a soda. BUT the ONLY thing we didn't like is the sticky floor.
Love to see local businesses like this! The food was so good and the service was awesome! Loved all the unique sodas they had available to try and buy! I will definitely go back!

Delicious food with a wide variety of choices...burgers, subs, hot dogs, deli sandwiches.  The sides are amazing...cheese curds to die for, fried zucchini that tastes straight from the garden, battered onion rings that melt on your tongue.  Fun array of designer sodas.  Ordering online speeds up the process during lunch rushes.  The people are extremely helpful and friendly.  I ordered a large amount of food for a football gathering and they even carried my food to my car for me.  Forget fast food.....I was out of there in 4 minutes.  My bucket list now includes everything on their menu.

A few months ago I set out to find the best burger in town. I tried The Grind, Wineburger, and a couple of others but none can top Rocket Burger.  It was the best cheeseburger I have ever had, by a mile! I ordered a double cheeseburger with everything. The bun was toasty yet soft, the veggies were fresh, the meat was perfect, and the thousand island sauce was the icing on the cake. I had the fries and the onion rings as well. Both were just mediocre in my opinion. The beverage selection was huge and beyond awesome! If you are looking for a great burger at a great price look no further. No other burgers  can compare! I am going to have to work out harder because I plan on going back to eat there very often!

Went back today just to make sure it was going to be as good as the first time. I honestly could not believe a burger could be this good. Guess what? It was just as amazing the second time!!!

First time there. So I wanted to play it safe, not go for any wild things. Just try standard fare and work up to others later. I figured if they can't get the basics right, maybe I don't go back.

My wife had a single cheeseburger, I had the double regular. We ordered these as combos, expecting regular French fries. We were quite surprised at the fries that arrived - scrawny, over-cooked, oily, not good flavor, and a strange orange tint to them. The burgers were better than the fries, however, I believe they put too much sauce on them - it was dripping everywhere, making it a difficult eat. (I prefer a burger that stays together and keep a fairly dry bun, not soggy like ours.) Also, the meat was still pink in the middle. If I get a big, fat patty like at Fuddruckers, a medium burger is OK, but on these thin little patties at Rocket Burger, pink inside is just not appealing.

Despite all this, I did enjoy the flavor of the burger, and could have actually eaten another (if I ordered with very easy sauce).

The big plus for this place that saved the experience for me was the management. I guess I was chatting with one of the owners when I was there, and he was very polite and cordial. I mentioned the name of the guy who recommended this place to me, and barely started to describe him, when he knew who I was talking about and where I know him from.

I will go back based entirely on the friendliness I experienced there. Only thing is, this time, I'll order some real kind of sandwich, and go for a different side item than their "standard" fries.

Driven by several times never knew they were here.  Good flavor, lots of variety.  Good portions.  Lots on menu i will try soon.   Clean for an older strip mall shop.  Great variety of bottled sodas. Good seasoned fries. . Onion. Rings looked good will try those next time.  Always great to give a non big chain shop a good review, these guys earned it!

We were in Phoenix for one day while on a big road trip. Being from out of town, we got lost trying to get there, but it was totally worth it. 

The soda selection alone was worth the trip, but the sandwiches were really top-notch too. The fries were thin-cut and really tasted like potato. They were fried fairly dark, and some of them were limp by the time we got them back to the hotel, but I've never had fries that stayed crispy after being transported in Styrofoam, so it's hard to say what they would have been like fresh from the fryer. I thought they were delicious. 

 The Teriyaki burger featured Teriyaki sauce that was flavorful (not super salty) and, most importantly, DEEP FRIED PINEAPPLE RINGS. I ordered the Italian sub and sort of regretted not getting something more unique, but the sandwich was probably the best I've had since moving away from the Philadelphia area. The lunchmeat seemed high quality and the bread tasted fresh.

We ate at a lot of great places during our road trip and this was definitely a highlight.

This place rocks!!! My brother informed me of this place some time ago and I have been there several times. Each and every visit is a delight :) I had just stopped in yesterday for the first time in a while (a bit too long for my liking) and was pleased to see the same wall of soda, menu I craved, simple friendly service and all around good vibe that I have come to pursue. If you have never been, go try it and enjoy!
This place has some great deals on great food. The burgers are wonderful and the soda selection is amazing.

New Yorker Pastrami Sandwich! Amaze-balls! Yum! Awesome cut of pastrami with fine cut cole slaw and an amazing sauce that could possibly contain a spicy mustard. Not sure. I just know the combo worked quite well.

Hub got a bacon cheeseburger and liked it very much. French fries were like shoe string type.

We also got some Dads Red Cream Soda and Orange Cream Soda from their vast array of sodas. Very good!

The counter dudes were very nice and helpful and probably deserve raises because they actually care about providing good customer service! Good job guys! I'll will definitely be visiting this place more often.

I saw all the great reviews for this place and decided to try them. The New York burger was terrible. Thin flavorless  patty and the bun was not fresh. The only good part of the order were the onion rings and fries. For the money Five Guy's or even In and Out Burger are so much better. Don't  waste your time or money. What a shame!

Definitely good food.  However, I wouldn't get the Santa-Fe burger next time as the fried chillies were really big, not what I expected, and dominated the burger.  I ended up taking them off.

Everyone in party had good things to say about the food.

10% off for checking in on Yelp, just can't beat it!

This place is great.  I am a faithful customer and I even recommend it to people I work with in the East Valley all of the time.  Items I have had (and enjoyed) as well probably should have made more than one meal out of:
-Rocket Burger
-New York Burger
-Cali Burger
-Santa Fe Burger
-Philly Burger
-Gyro Burger
-Western Burger
-Red White & Blue Burger
-California Club Sub
-Country Club Sub
-New Yorker Sub
-Gyro
-Pescado de Cohete
 I still have quite a bit of items I want to try but hands down this is the best burger and sub place I have EVER been to in Arizona and I am an AZ native.  I always try to give tips as well due to the fact that 1) I support local business 2) The owners and staff are very professional and cordial 3) the food is always well prepared not just slapped together like a typical fast food business
Holy !##=. What a great local sandwich place. My wife and I had a French dip and Italian. Reminds me of little family owned joints in Philly. We finished it off with chili cheese fries, awesome.

Great burger! Eddie Lopez is delicious. So flavorful & juicy. The fries are so incredible. Skin on. Seasoning salt on. Mmmm. The rocket sauce is so bomb. Ask for some on the side to dip your fries in. California club is a little simple, but nice real turkey (not sandwich meat). Loved the bottled soda selection!
Laid back, very clean but simple break room-style tables.

The fish is to die for.  Breaded on site, not processed crap.  Large portioned and delicious!!!  Friendly people and a LARGE selection of drinks.  Well known for their burgers, but I will be back for the fish!!
Best burger, fried zucchini, chicken sandwich , onion rings & most variety of vintage sodas in Arizona!  We come here as often as possible! Inexpensive, fresh, casual & delicious.

This place was an epic burger joint!  Small but don't let that fool you, the food is super good.  As soon as I walked in the joint, the smell of food was a hit.  I had the double bacon cheese burger with cheese curds and was pretty darn tasty. Definitely a return will be in the works.  The house Rocket sauce in burger is a nice twist.

Fries were good. Burger so so hot dog was inedible.
Disappointed for sure. 
Just stay away from the jerky dog and your probably ok.
Never let's me down, this place rocks!!  The food is great and just for kicks all the soda pop you can think of in the coolers. Keep up the great food.

We have eaten here a few times and tonight just kinda ruined it for me. I do want to add that they are always super nice when we come in. Customer service is always good! To start on my visit tonight, I got a chili cheese dog and this was probably my first mistake seeing that they closed in about an hour. The chili was cold so I asked nicely to have them to throw it in the microwave to just heat it up. It wasn't that big of a deal, although it did suck because who wants cold food?? When he brought it back it sadly was still barely warm but I didn't wanna ask again so just dealt with it. Once I started eating it I now noticed that the dog was probably sitting on a rotator for half the day. It was super dry/crusted almost half way throughout. If this makes any sense. Just imagine the hot dogs that have been over cooked at a gas station, that's what I got. I've worked in the food industry and I know limits, but at some point you just have to accept it and make fresh food. Now to put the cherry on the top, we were getting a refill to take to-go and I noticed while putting the lid on that something had fallen from the drink nozzle and I'm pretty sure it was mold. There was a large black piece floating in my cup (I was drinking lemonade). So I just threw it away. I wanna give them the benefit of the doubt because the burgers are pretty good! But I don't recommend eating there before they close, nor getting a hot dog and lastly drinking from the fountain. They have plenty of bottled drinks, spend a few more cents and get mold free sodas! I don't know if we will be back. But if I do I will be avoiding all those things!

Ummmmm wait a minute... there's one in CHANDLER too???  Oh boy... One close to home annnnnnd one close to work... HAPPY DANCE... usually a sequel suxs, unless you're Francis Ford or ROCKET BURGER & SUBS... nice job guys.  Keep up the good work...

This place has the best cheeseburger I have ever eaten. And they have great prices for a burger combo too. The selection of bottle sodas is huge too. I will definitely come back here time and time again. Thank you! GO TIGERS!
Burgers suck, thin and dried meat, expensive as my four year old put it in and out has better burgers. The Great soda selection is the only saving grace.

Best pulled pork i have found in Phoenix!! And love the drink selection found a huckleberry cream soda I drove 1200 miles to get last time!! New favorite!
Can't wait to go back for another sandwich and after reading other reviews onion rings I think. Ugh but Which of the bagillion sodas to choose from??!? and def trying The ice cream..... Tomorrow for real.

My bacon cheeseburger was unpleasant. The bacon was burnt way past the point of overdone. It left the worse after taste. After I picked off the bacon, I then had the pleasure of digging a black hair out of my cheese. I tried to ignore this as I was starving but the burger itself was drowning in the sauce they use which tasted like it belongs on a salad. The meat didn't have much flavor. The table I sat at was dirty and the walls are crusty. It was not memorable. The fries were good but I also got tons of ends and not the usual full sized fries. Probably won't be back because I just left so disappointed even though I was initially looking forward to just a good burger locally.

The only thing i can review is the cheesecurds. The ones that had cheese inside were pretty good. Unfortunately half my order was tiny pea sized crispy things.  And I paid an extra $1 for a tiny ranch and bbq sauce. I wouldn't have gotten had I known,  since there's sauce in my fridge. But hey,  this place specializes in burgers which I did not try. They do look yummy though
Totally satisfied my craving for that super delicious sloppy heart attack hole in the wall dive joint burger and fries!
Great food, huge selection of sodas. The best thing though was the ranch dressing!  Awesome service as well.
They have a huge variety of sodas available, but their food is sub par. Kind of greasy and overpriced.

Three different burgers for our family and all winners!  I highly recommend the Santa Fe burger as the best I have ever had.  Green chili peppers smashed and fried with a light cornmeal batter and added to the cheeseburger. Note that a "single" is definitely a lot of food, so only the big eaters will go for the next size up. Fried cheese curds are a treat and a basket is more than plenty for three.  Finding out that the Pop Shop has become part of Rocket Burger & Subs is a wonderful bonus:  imagine choosing from over 200 soft drinks for a memorable meal.  Staff were terrific and perhaps think about going early in the dinner hour.  We noticed as it got closer to 6 pm, more and more customers came in. We'll be back on a regular basis.
We love going here for the soda selection.  The food is good but not amazing.   The chill cheese fries are to grease but the portions are very good.

Everyone enjoyed their meals today! We got burgers, chicken salad with grilled green chilies, chicken nuggets, fries and all kinds of crazy pops! The nuggets are homemade. Felt like my Granny was cooking in the back! Delicious!
It's a little hole in the wall place. The hamburger buns are the best I have ever had. They have a wall full of bottled sodas to choose from.  The food is great.

So glad I found this place on Yelp. I've passed it for years unaware it was there. Had Chicago burger, it was amazing!  Cheese curds were great! Yes, salty.. but that is how they should be. I'll absolutely be back!

My friend's daughter had been here before and the online menu looked interesting.  We had four burgers total, 2 Cali, 1 Bacon Cheeseburger and 1 Garlic Melt.  All were excellent.  We also ordered cheese curds (delicious!), onion rings & mushrooms.  I liked that the batter was very light for the fried items. Again, everything was tasty.  We ordered pick-up through Yelp and GrubHub and our order was ready on time.  I don't live in the area, but will definitely go back if I'm in the neighborhood.

My first time here.....I have not even eaten the food and I will already come back.  The people working here are amazing!!! They will help toy customize anything you want!   Also such a huge selection of soda!  

The food was very good.   Juicy burgers, perfectly made.  Cheese curds were good and fries were nice and crispy.   

We will come back here for sure!

Wow! This place is awesome. The Mexican hot dog is to die for. They make their own salsa and it tasted like they make their own bread too. The fries were fresh. And my husband and I both ate lunch for less than 8 bucks. I ate here on a Sunday and walked in at 1030. I didn't notice that they don't normally open until 11 but the guy was super cool and warned me it would take an extra few minutes, but had no problem serving me. It was well worth the wait!

Landed in this little sweet-spot accidentally today, just looking for a kid-friendly burger place that could accommodate a vegetarian. I'm SO impressed! I took an employee up on his recommendation for the cole-slaw Mexican fish sandwich, and was not disappointed. The owner even came out and introduced himself and asked how our food was personally! I'll be coming back any time I'm in the area for sure. Thanks for the great meal, guys! (PS this place has beer too!)
Ordered their Philly burger, and it was so flavorful and juicy. They had the biggest selection of soda I've ever seen. Such friendly staff, too!

If you're looking for an A+ burger, amazing side and a one of a kind soda with no muss or fuss, THIS is the place to go! This is a small little joint but great cooks service and a wide selection of subs, sides, sodas and burgers. 10/10 will be back

Everyone who is a foodie knows that the best places to eat are A) Not a chain and B) Are located in "a hole in the wall."
Being wheat intolerant, I can't give any place 5 stars that doesn't have a gluten-free bun option. That said, EVERYTHING else was very good. 
Food is flavorful through and through. I ended up risking on a Rueben. I figure if I have an allergic reaction I'm going to make it worth it. And it was 100% worth it. I scarfed all of it down! No looking back 
Drinks are FABULOUS! I have seen soooo many varieties of soda! I had a ginger beer from a "microbrew" in New Hampshire. Its recipe boasts of being 152 years old. 
If you are near 35th Ave and Cactus stop by here!

Food was great! My husband loved the teriyaki burger. I got the Santa Fe Burger with avocado which was really good as well.  I really liked how the owner came out and talked with all of the customers. Will be returning.
