First time coming here and we weren't disappointed. One of the best Rubens I've have in Arizona, everyone else in my party had burgers. The California, Bacon & cheese, and a cheese burger. Everyone was very happy with they're orders. Also tried the onion rings and cheese curds. Both were great. Great people behind the counter and very friendly. Can't wait to keep trying  more of the menu.

What can I say that hasn't already been said?  I got the Afterburner with onion rings and both were excellent!  There were so many sodas it was impossible to decide on one, so I just picked a category (Root Beer) and grabbed one -- quite tasty as well.

Small and very hidden behind Church's Chicken but food is EXCELLENT but....... kind of pricey. LOVE the idea of every glass soda/drink you can think of displayed in the dining area for you to easily browse and select....SERIOUSLY, SO MANY OPTION. Super super cool also you can pay to take home a little six pack of a variety of different drinks you want! Awesome little joint!

The hype was not hype. Great concept, original menu items and great food. The staff was awesome as well. Do yourself a favor and order the Santa Fe burger and enjoy a great bottle of soda. Today, like right now. Tell them Aaron sent you.
There prices are a little high but they make up for it in taste and selection. If your in the mood for a good burger then you must try this place

The reviewers on "Check Please" were right.  This funky little place that I never would have walked into if I hadn't heard about it prior, is really good!  I had the New Yorker, which is as close as I can get to a Miracle Mile New Yorker in NW Phoenix, which was pretty darned good.  My husband had the New York Burger which the same thing with a hamburger patty added to the pastrami and he loved it also.  The only reason I didn't give it five stars is that they serve the string type French fries which I'm not a fan of and wouldn't order next time.  Good luck trying to decide which soda you'll have - they surround the room.
Amazing burger, fantastic cheese curds, and soda, soda, and more soda. Fun place to come and try new flavors of soda.
Great little place with cheap, good food. Ruben sandwich with chili cheese fries - great lunch!

If only I could give this place 50 stars...  They really do force me to grade every other eatery on a curve..  I've been coming here about twice a week for a year now and it just keeps getting better.  The staff is welcoming and eager to please, the selection approaches infinity, the value is absolutely unbeatable, and the food... OH MY GOD THE FOOD!!!

I've had so many amazing experiences here.  Like how we mentioned to the owners how cool it would be if they offered ice cream, only to find a whole slew of ice cream treats we never would've dreamed of a month later.  Like how I mentioned that I missed the Flathead Lake Blueberry Pomegranate soda (I wanted to try it in a float now that they had ice cream), and I came in 2 days later to find new ones in the freezer and a full case on the rack.  Or the time my girlfriend and I just stopped and stared at each other after our first bites of our Red, White and Blue Special burgers on the 4th of July.  Or my feeble attempt to finish a 3-patty-on-a-sub-roll Rocket Burger by myself on my first visit...

I've tried just about everything on the menu and have yet to be disappointed.  All of the burgers are incredible, but my personal favorites are the Philly Burger, The Afterburner, Teriyaki Burger, Steak Burger, and the Red,White & Blue Burger.  The Pescado de Cohete, a zesty spicy citrus fish sandwich, is a must try, as is the chicken (sandwich or nuggets).  And don't get me started on the subs...  I'm halfway through trying them all and picking a favorite just depends on my mood, none have disappointed me.  Same goes for the hot dogs.

The sides are perfect as well.  Aside from the MOST ADDICTIVE FRIES AND RANCH IN THE WORLD, they also have cheese curds, pizza bread, OVER 300 SODAS, SLUSH PUPPIES, and one-of-a-kind treats like PECAN PIE SHAKES!!!  On top of all of this, they're the best value ANYWHERE.  Where else can you get a $4 burger combo this epic???  I challenge anyone to leave hungry!

Every time I come here I think it just doesn't get any better.  But then I come back and they prove me wrong.  Long live Rocket Burger!!!

I like to try a lot of different burger places. I run across a lot of places that I really want to like, and don't. This was the exception. Excellent burgers and sandwiches, and friendly staff. We will most certainly be back!

Most amazing burgers ever. And I am picky. My family loves it here and the prices are not bad at all. Subs are great too! And the fries with ranch are my daughters favorite. You have to try this place. Thank me later ;)

We found this place thru Yelp... My son and I were longing for a good new place to try. 

It's located about a mile away East  from the Chandler Fashion Mall. 
We walked in and were immediately Wow'd by ALL the unique soda choices. Like Soooo many unique bottles and flavors. 
Now to the food..... 
It took me literally 15 min to decide on a burger. 
I ended up getting one that had like a garlic mayo, bacon, cheese forgot the name. I got the double. Good size and delicious. 
My son got the Cali burger, Rocket Size which means it's 3 patties and served side by side on a toasted sub roll. Sooo big and I liked his burger more than mine. 
We shared chili cheese fries, good but I've had better chili. 

They serve a weird brand fountain soda. It's made with cane sugar. It was yummy actually, just don't try the ginger flavor. Yuck!!! Burned my throat!! 

Staff was friendly. Small restaurant, counter service with a couple outside tables. 

We will be back!!

Friendly management, excellent service, high quality food at an extremely reasonable price, what's not to love? In the city of Chandler it just doesn't get better than Rocket Burger! I consider myself very fortunate to live so close to this awesome new addition to the east valley.

I go there about once a week or week and a half. They have good burgers and a decent selection. Much prefer it over standard burger joints. Not that it matters to me, but they also seem to have about 1000 different brands (or more) of items to drink for anyone looking for that special soda they cannot find anywhere.

The food was great and so was the service. I ordered the Newyork Burger and orders a soda from the wall of unique flavors and brands, I definitely recommend it. The food came quickly,  the only thing I could say wrong was the trash area needed some cleaning.
Super Yummy!! Got the NY burger,  Gyros Burger,  fries and onion rings!  BAMM! ! All home runs... don't get the brain wash soda.  Heheheeeehe

I've been here before and I have to say I wasn't that impressed. This time I decided to be a bit more adventurous and went for the NY Burger. Oh man! Rocket Burger is now on my radar screen! Wow! I never would have put that burger together in a million years... and I would have been missing out. EXCELLENT burger. I will be back.

I would have never probably stopped at this place driving by but it is worth it. I got a chilli chesse dog, burger, and fries. The burger was really good not the best ever but still really tasty and the bun was amazing. The chilli chesse dog was one of the best ive had deffinatly a trip worth going back to but this is my first review so take it or leave it but i will be reviewing more
Food was fresh and delicious, the Soda Wall was intense.

My husband decided it was a no cook day and that he wanted a burger (a romantic at heart). We stumbled upon this little gem while searching for non-dumpster restaurants in the area. We love local spots with great reviews. We decided to give Rocket Burger a try. Upon arriving, a fairly tall gentleman with an impressive midsection was stepping out of the restaurant and exclaimed to no one in particular "Damn! That was the best burger I've had" surely he's had many before this one. My husband and I looked at each other and smiled while entering the restaurant. We were immediately greeted by the cashier, cook, and owner(?) who all took great interest in ensuring we got exactly what we wanted. All the staff were very friendly and took pride in what they do. And the food, oh my! The food is amazing. Husband got the Teri and I chose something? with mushrooms and swiss cheese (my default). The craft sodas definitely kept us busy while they prepared our food, there are so many it was difficult to choose our favorite. We have visited several times, and continue to experience the same greatness, in fact we are on our way now. Come join us!

I just tried Rocket Burger for the first time after reading some great things on here, but it didn't quite match my expectations.

The main reason that I think this place is rated too high is that the food is just average. The sauce on the burger is nice, but there is nothing else really special about the burger and the fries are kind of lousy.

The service however is pretty good. The guys working here are certainly friendly, so I am all for supporting an independent location like this. The various sodas they have here are cool to look at, but a little overwhelming. I couldn't figure out what to get or what was supposed to be good, so I just stuck with a regular fountain Pepsi.

The location of the place is not very good and it looks more like a convenient store than a restaurant. That was one thing I didn't like about eating here. It was an alright experience on the whole though.
Lived here a long time. One of the best burger joints in town. Insane soda selection. Gotta try it. Love this place.

Great food, I definitely recommend the fried mushrooms. We ordered online and our order did not register in their system when we showed up 30 min later to pick it up. They were really apologetic about it though, and it wasn't a big deal as it only took about 10 minutes to make our order. A free soda or something would have been appreciated for the wait though!

First time here and half mile out of our way but worth the trip! I came here with my parents who are in their 80's. They too enjoyed it. We had the Cali chicken combo special. It's grilled chicken with bacon, avocado, lettuce & tomato. Delicious! We did drive past it at first. It's not obvious. It's next to the Church's chicken. It's small & quaint.

This is one of our favorite places to go for some cornmeal crusted zucchini and pretty much all of their sandwiches! They also sell a lot of old fashioned cola in various flavors (hundreds of them) - non of them with high fructose syrup either! Delicious and a real novelty experience. Plus the owners are super nice. : )
This place was great, probably one of the best fast food burgers I have had in Arizona.  Can't wait to go back.

AMAZING!! The burgers were perfectly cooked. We had the Cali Burger and the New Yorker. We shared half of each and neither one of us could decide which we liked better. Loved them both! Daughters had kids chicken fingers and they were actual chicken, not just mostly fried breading with little chicken. Girls also had milkshakes that were thick and full of flavor! The staff was extremely nice, helpful and had wonderful suggestions. Will come back many, many more times! Thank you Rocket Burger for a great dining experience!

Wonderful place. Best Burgers in town. Can't go wrong with anything u order. Owner is so nice and the handcrafted drinks are a must have experience. I ordered the chicken sandwich with avacado and bacon. First bite, fell in love. The cheese curds and zucchini are also amazing.  The owner was so welcoming and made us feel right at home. Must visit place for the perfect burger!

Meh..the chili on the cheese dog had a weird flavor and their seating area is super cramped. The service was good, soda selection was nice and the burger was average to slightly above...I wouldn't make a special trip, but if you are in the area, give them a try. :)

I go here several times every month.  For lunch and dinner.  I have never been disappointed.   Burgers, sandwiches, hot dogs and fries.  It is all good.  

My favorite is the Mexi-burger.  Fresh salsa, avocado, bacon, pepper jack and much more.  A great burger.

And then there is the great collection of soda.  My wife loves the fact that they carry her favorite "Rock n Rye" Faygo pop.  Straight from MI.

This place is definitely worth checking out.

My wife and I drove down to Chandler from Tempe  to try this place.  We really enjoyed the burgers and sides.  Excellent quality and creative.  Huge pop selection.  Met Steve the owner - nice guy, great concept of sub/burger joint.  We will be  bacK for more!

All I know is. The Hubs and I were hungry so I yelped a burger joint in PHX. I was all Bae this place has 254 reviews .. Let's go there ! We were in PHX from Prescott for the day. Got the Teriyaki Burger Rocket size and fries ! delishioursh ! Hit The Spot ! The owner even chased us to the parking lot to make sure we enjoyed our Food  Yay!!!!!

First time coming today after reading their reviews.  I had the Philly Cheese Steak Burger, and it did not disappoint.  Decent sized patty covered with thin slices of steak, peppers, onions, and a gooey slice of cheese melted on top and all inside a toasty bun...DELISH!!  Also ordered a side of fried zucchini, which I thought was really good, but a little on the greasy side.  If you like a good greasy burger, then this may be your place.  The decor isn't very fancy, but they have a huge soda selection, and several different burger choices.
Hands down best burger I've had in a long time.  Ordered a garlic melt, very tasty! The service was great;  love the Soda selection too.
Amazing! The fish sandwich is SO good, fries are amazing and soda selection is fun!
Holy crap! Can't believe I have never been to this place before. A must go place in PHX. Had the philly burger and country club sandwich on wheat, and both were on point.

Good customer service.  Clean dinning area.  Knowledgeable staff.

I had the large New Yorker pastrami sub and fried zucchini , my wife had a large turkey bacon avocado sub on wheat and fries.

The food was tasty and very large portion wise.  
You definitely get you money's worth in food.

Their soda collection is vast, eclectic and nostalgic.

I will definitely go back again.
Love this place, you cannot find a better burger. Wish they had an east valley location!

This place is Legit! Had such a good meal and the soda selection really is awesome! A whole wall dedicated to different sodas in glass bottles! My Gorlfriend had pumpkin pie soda and I had butterscotch root beer and it was delicious!! 

Definitely a win for local restaurants!

A hidden gem.  Came here today for the first time. We weren't sure what to order and the young man behind the counter recommended the NY Burger which is what we order. Also we ordered the fries and the fried zucchini. The burger was cooked perfectly and it had a wonderful flavor. The fries were good and the zucchini was outstanding! The service was quick and friendly. Will go back. The drawback is a small parking lot and seating is limited.
WOW ~ CRAZY - A pepperoni pizza burger ! This is one of the best. The crispy pepperoni was the star of the show. After I was done, I picked out some great sodas to take home. Rocket Burger ROCKS

Definitely a hidden food gem in the heart of Chandler worth exploring!

I got a Gyro Burger with fries on the side and a bottle of ginger ale.  This place lives up to its name; that burger exploded in my mouth with beefy lamb flavor when I flew it in!  It also wasn't too overwhelming because the burger included tomatoes and cucumbers to cut back on the rich, savory explosion from the beef patties and gyro meat.  

Just when I thought the food in this restaurant is great, I also learned the atmosphere is friendly, too.  Steve, the owner, approached my friend and me while we were chowing down.  We had a really pleasant conversation, and apparently Rocket Burger has been open for only 4 months now.  Yet this place was the first result when I simply Yelped for 'Food in Chandler, AZ'.  If you ask me, that's a pretty impressive feat, to say the least.

When I come back, I'm getting the Green Chile Burger.  I gotta get me that extra crunchy, yet still juicy experience from the fried chili inside.  Maybe I'll even get it Rocket-sized.

Big fan! Reminds us of the mom 'n pop burger joints back in Michigan. Plus they have 8 refrigerators full of every type soda pop you can imagine! Stuff you've never heard of! And their ice cream is the yummiest & creamiest I've ever had.
Really good burger and fries, lots of tasty grub for the money.  Custom sodas and the girl who took our order was very friendly. We'll be back!
Awesome! Delicious Bacon cheese burger. Great fries. Clean and friendly. Not a fancy place but I will be taking mom here.

My experience was meh honestly...but that is probably because I didn't order a burger. Being more of a sandwich guy myself I figured I should try a sub first...mistake. I ordered the New Yorker, and it is a good thing I only got a small because anything more would have been a complete waste of money, because I didn't want to eat any more than the half I ate. 

Bread is a big deal to me, it's what sets a good sandwich apart from the greats...and it can make a sandwich go from good to just meh in just 1 bite...unfortunately their bread is basically just an overgrown hotdogs bun...WAY too soft...the bread was so soft it basically started to disintegrate after the first bite. Maybe their burger buns and regular bread are better but the sub rolls...no go.

Meat and cheese was ok...but there definitely was not enough meat that is for dang sure. And I'm not sure if it was the pastrami or the rocket sauce but something tasted like roasted red peppers, not a bad thing..must very unexpected. 

Coleslaw was the best part of the sandwich but weirdly the slaw and slaw dressing were not mixed...like it was just cabbage and then dressing on top...weird. Good balanced flavor though. 

Lastly the cheese curds...were sad. Over Salted and weirdly dusty? Like the batter or dredge was too much flour and it didn't get fully cooked because it honestly tasted like cheesy salty wallpaper paste. Strange. 

Side note the Ginger Beer from the fountain was meh as well. 

I would be willing to come back for a burger but I won't order a sub again.

Another soon to be favorite hole in the wall places! Great food. Showed up 10 mins before close and they were super patient as we were first timers. Looks clean, ordered to go but would be happy to dine in and stare at their huge wall of drinks. Happy to have found the place, will be going back for sure! Food the place on yelp so I'm just doing my part, good suggestion. Enjoy
Freshly made buns. Great burgers, and dogs. Also any kind of soda under the sun. Literally. You have the choice of hundreds of brands from around the world.

This place is a little hole in the wall. Tucked in to a small strip behind Church's Chicken. Worth looking for! Juicy, flavorful burgers. Cheese curds were light and crispy. Just a little salty for my taste (and I like salty). But definitely good quality. They have a ridiculous selection of bottled sodas but I stuck with a fountain drink. Saw about 10 things in the menu I want to try so I will have to come back. Friendly staff, service with a genuine smile. Check it out, you'll be glad you did!
Their rocket sauce is what makes their burgers delicious! I love supporting local businesses, I definitely recommend!

Honestly the best place to eat. I know I will die eventually because heart disease runs in my family but the chili dogs were so juicy with the red chili dripping off the sides. My wife is filing divorce papers this Tuesday so I decided to also get the old fashioned sodas. I had the cherry jolt cola that reminded of the time when I looked good and wasn't with my wife.

Tried this place for the first time today after reading the Yelp reviews on burgers and I think it was even better than I had expected. The California burger was awesome and I loved the fries. To top it all off I had a Dublin Dr. Pepper to was it down.  Was the best burger shop hamburger I have had in years. 

The have a soda shop also where you can pick out gourmet sodas with a really big selection. 

Service was fast and very friendly. I will definitely be back again when I am in the area.

There is no real way to say this but........ROCKET BURGER IS ONE OF THE BEST BURGER PLACES IN AZ! Hands down the best burger there has to be the New Yorker! It has a patty, pastrami, cole slaw, and rocket sauce! I didn't even know a burger could be that good! The fries and onion rings are great too, i would not  call them the best but they are enjoyable! If you like to try different kinds of soda this is the place to go! They have any kind of bottled soda you can think of! Every time i have gone i have gotten a new soda i have never heard of before! The management there is great! A friend of mine got a bottled soda and didn't like it, they saw him about to throw it away and they said just to grab another soda free of charge! The workers there are really cool! I recommend this place to any one that is a burger lover! i live in Mesa and anytime i am out by Rocket Burger i will go out of my way to stop in! I highly recommend it!

There is a big hype about this place, but...my gf and I ordered each of us a burger, after moving. Was looking forward to the delicious food. We watched a video review about them on "Check Please, Arizona" great reviews. Ugh. I would easily say I'm a foodie, and know what food should taste like. I got my "burger" the New Yorker, which was highly recommended by the show and by the cashier. The pastrami was fresh, their coleslaw was okay, the burger wasn't even cooked and it wasn't 
2 cm thick. And it was worse than a few fast food burgers. Ugh!! Then, when you walk into the place, it looks like a grocery store. Not real inviting. The wall of different soda pops was cool, but way over rated! I will never go back to this place. Not good enough food to retry! Sorry, just my opinion.

The ambiance of this place is second to none. Old fashioned bottled sodas that you've never heard of making choosing just one almost impossible. Once you decide on a burger you won't be disappointed regardless of your choice.

Pretty good, two single burgers a fry and a large drink came to 22$. Very casual place, they have a huge variety of different flavored bottled soda. The "rocket sauce" on the burgers was actually kinda gross. Tasted like horseradish mixed with thousand island sauce.
Amazing! The food is great and they have a tremendous selection of unique soft drinks.

Our first visit wasn't so good when we found a hair in my sons ranch followed by a bug in our Frys.  The two employees were apologetic and offered a free drink, but not enough to make us go back plus it was expensive an disappointing cheese curds

This place is crazy good! The New Yorker and the chili burger were AMAZING! I come here all the time, they have this wall full of  unique soda that is pretty cool, fries are good until they get cold, onion rings are amazing and fresh, california burger is awesome too!! Great place!!

It deserves 5 stars. All of my return visits have been amazing. You can get pastrami on your burger. Did you hear what I just said. Pastrami on the burger. I'm not joking here folks. Pastrami on the burger. An entirely different meet (Pastrami) on top of a completely seperate meat (hamburger).  I'm not sure it's the leanest cut of pastrami, in fact it's fatty as hell, but it is pastrami on the burger. Need I say more.
One more time....
Pastrami on the burger.
Ergo.... Five Stars.

This place is great! They have some of the best burgers in town. The guy who brought my food out wouldn't even let me get up to get my own ketchup. He said he could never let that happen even though the ketchup is at a self serve location.
Best burgers in town! Tha garlic melt is amazing! I love this place so much I've eaten there twice in the same day!

Good value for the price. it was 10$ for a double california burger and fries. I thought the burger was pretty good (yes i went to phoenix from LA to have a california burger..).

Parking is a little tight since it has a shared lot.

Very Cool restaurant and a Must Try!!!  The Menu is out of this world with all different types of unique burgers topped with pastrami, a philly cheesesteak burger, one had a breaded and then deep fried green chili on it (Who does that :) MUST TRY!  Another burger experience I recommend trying, if feeling daring is the Gyro burger, this thing is about the size of 4 burgers in one and is topped with homemade tzatziki sauce.  Now for the endless soda pop flavors, whatever you can think of they pretty much have it.  I recommend trying the So Duh! Liquid Fire flavor, tastes just like you're sucking on an atomic fireball candy (Crazy, but fun).  Place looks a lil rough on the outside, but don't let that fool you as I recommend any  Burger Fanatic to try!
One of the best burgers I've ever had.   The service was spectacular as well.  Very well trained and genuine staff.

Food was fantastic! Service was just as fabulous, very kind and courteous staff. If you love different varieties of bottled soda, they have a great selection to choose from. We tried a cheeseburger, make your own sub & mini corn dogs. Everything was scrumptious, especially the corn dogs! Worth a visit (or ten+ visits!).

I just saw this place as I was passing by to pick up my contacts. I was hungry and always up to try a new burger place. I'm glad I stopped. I got the Double Bacon Cheeseburger with a side of cheese curds. The cheese curds were amazing. The burger was one of the best I've had ever! I intend on being a regular here.

This Place is pretty cool. The Vintage sodas are Awesome and they have the Biggest selections of Sodas I have ever seen. The Cali Burger I got ways Tasty and Delish!! Found it by reading Yelp. Came up for conference from Tucson. Food and People are Great!!!!

I ordered a regular New York sub online and was charged $7... what I got was half a sandwich with barely any meat... no sides or drink.  The sandwich was very good!  But i couldn't help but feel a little taken advantage of.

This place is excellent! I had the gyro burger and it was amazing. Tasted exactly like a gyro. My husband got the cheese fries and  needless to say that is a real cheese on the fries. He said his burger was the perfect ratio of burger to bun and Is one of the best burgers he's had. I consider him a burger connoisseur  as he is a  meat & potato kind of man.  Definitely worth the drive to come here.  Could not leave without a four pack of root beer to enjoy later.

I recommend getting anything they have on special, never disappointed. Everything is hand made, and fresh. I think they no longer make their own bread tho, which leads to me giving 4, rather than 5 stars. Love this place regardless
Delicious and fresh, my 2 favorite things when I'm trying a new restaurant. Friendly staff and we got our food pretty fast. Will definitely be coming back.

Burgers were great, service was great, cheese fries great, onion rings were great too. Burgers are probably better than 90% of the burger joints around here! Only item that was disappointing is the cheese curds, they weren't to good, might want to stay away from those.

2nd time here I ordered the turkey club! Amazing with veggies piled high and tons of meat!(accidentally deleted photo) I had a meal was about $12 which is a little more than I would pay for but it was worth it. I had fries with my meal, UH-mazing! I would definitely come back...

Let me start by saying I had been meaning to come to Rocket Burger for a month or so..

The place makes you feel like a kid again with ridiculous amounts of flavored sodas from super rare brands. They even have Jolt....

So the places drink selection is off the charts..The burger and fries could have been a bit better..

Staff was friendly, however I was not asked how I wanted my burger cooked, granted it came out good.

But the special sauce they use I could have done without..and the fries were average.

All in all its a must try and a nice little experience.

We decided to try this location after our favorite burger place was closed for the day.  I had a chicken sandwich and my husband had a burger.  The flavor of the sandwich was good, but I was disappointed that they didn't tell me it was a fried chicken breast.  My husband didn't care for the size of the bun compared to the size of hte patty.  The atmosphere was fun and service was quick.

I ate here twice in this last week. I went there because I was wanting a good hot dog. I had searched yelp for a good place. I read the reviews and thought I would try it out. Plus it had been on check please. I actually got the chicken bites and fries both times. The chicken bites were crispy and had some taste. They tasted great and had a garlic taste. Best dipped in some ranch of course! I'm a French fries fanatic . These were just right and were homemade and fresh.  The second time my boyfriends 10 year old was with me and he got the Shirley temple drink in the bottle . He liked it so much I bought him a six pack to go. M They had the burgers and enjoyed the burger. I can't wait to go back!

Excellent food. Beef hot dog grilled to perfection. Bun toasted just right. Hand cut fries with just the right amount of everything. Staff seems to like the customers as well as what they do! Extensive and delightfully surprising range of craft sodas. Will definitely return.

I LOVE TO EAT... Every burger I get is rocket sized. Remember that when ordering. for you Juggalos... they have Faygo. Send yo momma!! fries are ok, onion rings is where its at, and the cheese curds are awesome. i sat there and ate a 12 patty rocket burger and rings. I'll never forget this; the cook came over to my table and the guy stands 6'2 and shakes my hand and says i am his hero. LOL! great food great guys.

Excellent burgers; I had the Eddie Lopez which has pastrami and my wife had the garlic mushroom. Tasty with fresh buns. But the star of the show are the onion rings which are the best I have ever had. They use a cornmeal batter. Flaky and tender with excellent flavor. The selection of bottled soda is amazing.
Terrific burgers, good service, and an awesome selection of bottled sodas.  This place is the bee's knees!

Like food? Me too....Like great food?! Me too!

Rocket Burger is conveniently located 5 minutes from my house, and fits the budget like the 50 stars on our beautiful flag! 

In my opinion it's under priced, fresh food, great people, amazing cooks! But it all starts with a great owner. We got the opportunity to speak to the owner/head chef, and it explained the godly burgers that come from the kitchen. This place is great, innovative, and EASY on the bank account.

Santa Fe Burger, to die for...

amazing burgers and sandwhichs and drinks here best hidden gem in az i highly recommend the garlic chicken burger just everything they have is made with high quality amazing taste just cant get another of it i want to try to come here at least once a. week and everyone should to!!

Every year i travel to Phoenix to visit my family and this is the one place I make it a point to come and visit. Their burgers are delicious and the chili cheese fries are super scrumptious,  their soda selection is incredible never have i seen so many selections. Hopefully i can visit more often and visit this place as well.

Heard this place through the grapevine and was impressed. Greasiness, brioche buns, craft soda. The menu caught me off guard with its simplicity look (but many unique and staple choices) but the Rueburger and craft soda amazed me by far. Rueburger included not only the burger patty but grilled onions, sauerkraut, sauce and the pastrami and pickle. I'm not a soda person by any means but the craft soda paired well with the burger and even on its own. I kept sipping and sipping for more. There are a wide selection of soda to choose from so you won't be disappointed. Rocket Burger has launched in the right place and is worth it. I would love to come back to try the rest of the menu.
Sandwiches and subs not what I expected. The place is dirty.  All the tables were dirty. Fountain drinks were out of order.
Me and the hubby have been here twice now and everything was great! Service is very friendly, very mom and pop hamburger shop, very cool and great food!

Best local burgers in town in taste and price. Top quality ingredients all cooked to perfection in combination with the variety of burger, hot dog options and drinks makes this place a must place to eat.

Awesome selection of sodas!!! I don't think I've ever seen so many in one place... the burger was very very tasty :D 

They were also accommodating with remaking a burger for my husband due to kosher restrictions.

Good food, fair prices.  If you are getting an order to go make sure you check your order before you leave.  They have forgotten to put things in my bag on 3 separate occasions.  Other then that I enjoy this place.
Very glad to have found this place. Great food. Everything was fresh and delicious. We drove 9 miles to get here to try it out and are very glad we did. Highly recommended!

Ok, here I go again.
 Rocket Burger ROCKS!!!! Great food....great owners.....great staff. Went in there yesterday, and walked out very content. Food is very very good.
And Ruth....No....I am not going back in today....I gotta work! LOL!
How did I not know about this place?!!  Food is fantastic and a huge wall of vintage sodas with your meal??
Excellent burger and chicken sandwich. Cute little place that has seating outside. The soda bar is awesome too! Root and Ginger Beer!! The cheese curds are good too!

The burgers here are ok - not amazing, but good.  Toppings/varieties seem pretty average as well.  Nothing to write home about, but nothing negative either.

This place would get a solid 3-star review, but the soda selection gives it another star.  They have several refrigerated cases of soda by the bottle, different varieties from all over.  One entire case is just different kinds of root beer, including one I can hardly find out in AZ, "Dang! That's good!" butterscotch root beer.  This place is worth a visit for the soda selection alone.
We're back! Love this place! Try the Santa Fe burger. Hubby loves the Philly cheese steak. Lots and lots of sodas to choose from. Fried zucchini is yummy too!
My husband I love coming to rocket burger. The afterburner chicken sandwich is so yummy! The service is fantastic & the sodas never let us down!

We had high expectations for this place based on the reviews and I'm happy to say they delivered!. I was first of all so excited to see all the cream sodas..I'm seeing one after ages. I had the cali burger..this one i suppose is the spicy one..I'm loved it! The crispy bacon and avocado combination was lovely! My husband had the Sante fe burger and that went down quite quickly..the fried chilly was the highlight of that burger. Another point I must mention is the fact that the burgers arrived super quick.. this made me a very happy diner.

This place is great.  You really can't get much better.  They have unbelievable food at great prices.  I love the hole in the wall joints that make themselves big just because they're that good, they work hard, and they aim to please.
Anytime we've come in, the owners have been very nice, and the staff do their jobs.  The food comes out fresh and hot and I have never bitten into anything from there and said to myself, "Self, this is not out of this world." Everything is above and beyond what you'd expect walking into this place.
My husband LOVES the New Yorker on the sub.  It is unreal.  The pastrami and coleslaw with the sauce... Heavenly.  The Rocket Burger is HUGE and uncomparable to the likes of culvers, in and out, ect.  My kids loved the corn dogs.
And to top off the ridiculously delicious food, you get your choice of 200+ kinds of bottled pop.  You will never feel like a penny was wasted after coming here.  So go.

My boyfriend and I stopped in for lunch today before taking our boys to the water park. Rocket Burger is one of our favorite places to stop in to eat or just grab a couple of the MANY bottle sodas they sell. Upon walking in we immediately noticed they did a little re-model and moved the kitchen area back so it opens up the dining area a little. I also noticed it was a lot quieter & cooler inside. They also put a wall up that they are going to be selling some of their sodas by the 4 or 6 pack. My BF was excited to hear that so now we can stock up on some of his favorites at home. 
Like I said, we have been here many times but this time I tried the Afterburner Burger & OMG was it good! It had just the right amount of hot flavor but not too much to where you couldn't eat & enjoy it. He got a Bacon Rocket Burger that was good as well. We always get the chili cheese fries with the chili on the side & like always they were delicious! 
Don't be discouraged by the location or outside appearance of Rocket Burger, it's a small family business ran by nice people who serve good food!

This review is a little late...I went here a few months ago and unfortunately can't go back cause I no longer am in Arizona so this review is based off my one and only experience. I normally like to give a place 2 trys before making any kind of judgement...... When I went it wasn't busy at all which is odd cause even after they saw me instead of welcoming me the guy behind the register screamed for his co-worker a few times before saying hi and what would I like. I looked over the menu and I can't remember what I ordered but know it was the garlic something and my wife ordered just a normal cheese burger. Both tables were dirty and had trash all over them which again there was nobody there so why were both tables dirty? The burgers weren't anything special in my opinion they weren't bad but weren't the best. The fries were easily my favorite thing about everything i wanna say they're cut and made when you order but I really don't know. They also have a amazing drink selection which I thought was really awesome. I would of loved to have gone a 2nd time to try something else but unfortunately never got to happen.
Great place to satisfy teenager's craving for burgers and fries, the staff was nice also.

Do not even consider another burger joint. This place is better than THE BOMB. The burgers, oh the burgers, are so delicious. The toppings are even on point like Stacy Adams. I had the New York burger. Unbelievable!!! It's topped with pastrami, coleslaw, and rocket sauce. The pastrami was easily way better than any deli has here in Phoenix and the coleslaw mixed with the rocket sauce which made the burger BEST IN PHOENIX. Hands down. And speaking of hands, the hand cut fries are so delicious. Near perfect. And the snozzberries taste like scnozzberries. Haha!! Yes, this place is also a Soda Shop!! Are you kidding me?!?! I was a 39 year old kid in a candy store with their amazing selection of bottled pop...yes pop...and fountain pop. I ended up with a Snozzberry fountain drink. You MUST try this. Thank me later. Beyond refreshing. Finally, the customer service was even better than the food and that is saying something. So don't even consider another choice. Get yourself to the intersection of 35th Ave and Cactus and devour Rocket Burger. I promise you will be a repeat customer. Well done and thank you Rocket Burger!!!! Customer now for life. Sincerely, Cory Pierce

I was excited to try this place based off of the reviews but in the end I was disappointed. It has a convenient store feel with a fast food place inside of it. The food was ok at best, but the soda/drink options is the only reason to go. There are over 315 soda options, they also have fountain drinks, juices, Powerade and bottled water as well. If I go back it will only be to get drinks because of all the unique drink options that you can't find most place.

Food is nice service is very poor. 
If in a hurry go someplace else. 
We would no go to this place again.
Great selection of bottled Soda. The hamburger was huge and delicious. Will definitely be coming back!

Awesome burger and they followed up on how we were doing, even though it is not your traditional sit down restaurant. I believe it was the owner who took the time to see how we liked it and to invite us back. I will say there is very limited seating, but other than that it's a great meal.

I love the variety of burgers, they are to die for , and they give you a yelp discount.The service is fast, and lots of drinks to choose from.I  went there one time on a friday, and some garage band was playing in the background. Not only did they suck, they were so loud, it was hard to even talk... Fortunately that has never happened again, or I swear, no matter how good the food I wouldn't go back....And I love rock a billy music.

I don't see what all the fuss is about this place wasn't all that great . I had the new York Burger it was pretty much Cole slaw, cheese, pastrami and the Patty but all I tasted was the bread it was a thick bun,  the Burger was tasteless and soggy from the Cole slaw and I just couldnt finish it.  Trash!

I had the California burger it was ok 
It wasn't the best burger in the world but it was decent my son had the bacon cheeseburger rocket style which comes in a sub. He liked it the only thing we both agreed on was the rocket sauce is a little too sweet and makes the bread a little soggy. The fries were very good nice me crispy. The best part is the drink selection you have. You can get a bottle drink with ur meal which makes it an enjoyable experience. Overall good place not sure if we would come back for the burgers but for sure for some drinks

This place has a lot of options to choose from. They are pretty expensive but the food is decent. I like the selection they have of drinks. They have like 50 different root beers from all over the world. I've been here 3 times and have been satisfied.

Beverage mecca. 

Rocket Burgers is a new addition to the NW side of Phoenix. It is tucked away behind Church's Chicken on the SW corner of 35th Ave and Cactus. I would have never seen it had it not been for Yelp. I'm not sure what was there before it but it is set up like a 7-11. It's nothing fancy but clean. It is decorated in red, white, and blue and has a painting of a rocket shooting over the desert on the far wall. A tribute to the Moon Valley Rockets down the street. There are a few booths and some tables and chairs. There is a convenient store size glass cooler on the largest wall. Inside contains just about any kind of drink you can think of. I'm talking every Gatorade invented and several sizes, bottle waters of every variety, Yoohoo, V8, Jarritos, Jolt, Coke products, Pepsi products, craft brewed root beers of about 20 different varieties, craft brewed ginger ales, crush in every flavor, any kind of juice you can think of, the list goes on. I'm not a big soda drinker and I wanted to try them all. I must have looked at all of them for about 10 minutes before making my decision. 

I ordered a chili cheese dog and onion rings. My wife ordered a single cheeseburger with fries. The guys/owners behind the counter are very cool. Anyone who wears a Fitz t-shirt deserves a shot at my business. My wife mentioned I had heard about them on Yelp and the gentleman was very happy to hear it. He smiled and said he had never heard of Yelp until recently and he has got a lot of business from it and its really working out well for them. 

So I settled on a Maine Root Beer that was gluten free and caffeine free and delicious. After about 5 minutes or so our order comes out. My wife's burger was very good. It had a huge round top bun and some very fresh veggies on it. The fries were homemade, thin and very fresh. The burger tasted great. It reminded me of Lenny's but with fresher toppings and a much higher quality bun. The chili dog had what appeared to be homemade chili on it. They put cheese slices and mustard on the bun first and then the National Hebrew huge dog and smothered it with chili then put more mustard and onions on the top. Just like I make it at home and it was very tasty. The bun was sesame seeded and toasted. The onion rings were battered lightly with corn meal. They were good and different. I'm really not a big fan of onion rings so I wasn't in love with them but that's not saying they weren't good. The amount of food was very generous. It was hard to finish it and I ended up giving up rather than over filling myself. 

I really enjoyed the beverage options these guys are serving up. The food wasn't out of this world but they did go the extra mile in everything they served. I appreciated that very much.  Another value was our huge meals with cool drinks came out to 12 bucks before a tip.  Plus they seem like they are a couple of great guys who started a business and who doesn't like to support that? We will definitely be going back to try out the subs and some other gourmet sodas.

YEOW, BABY!  I love this place.  I don't know how I got there the very first time, but I sure am glad I got there.  Went there tonight, and as always, was greeted like I was a long lost friend.  I love the smell of this place, as well as the taste of the food.  And I even stop there, sometimes, just for a bottle of red, cream soda.  I even ordered a root beer float, and there was so much ice cream in it, that I was miserable, when I left.  What can I say, I'm a glutton, when I eat, here.  Thank you, guys, for doing such a great job, with this little place.  I tell everyone about you.

I have no idea where to start on this review.. This place is just phenomenal.. Right when I walked in I knew i was at the right place, with all the sodas everywhere and the place was packed with people. When I looked at the menu I was lost because it had so many things. I saw the New Yorker Burger and I said this has to be amazing with some fries and a nice creme soda! I also added a side of mini corn dogs because who wouldn't???.. The girl helped me out also on if my choice was good and she said yes that's one of the popular items. She was nice and kept saying thank you. After I ordered I went to the fridges with all the sodas and I was literally lost.. I had no idea on what to get so many choices and so many things I didn't know about. I wanted to try one of everything to be honest. I grabbed creme soda and sat down. Waited about 5 minutes and the food came out, so the service was excellent too. The burger was fantastic the coleslaw with the pastrami that just melts into your mouth so juicy so good. The fries are seasoned so perfect not having a lot of salt like most seasonings. The corn dogs were as expected so amazing.. This place is just incredible and I can't wait to come back to try other things!! Just wish it had more room and not one bathroom.. But it's okay I like the old feel to it! If you want good food this is your place!
Burger pretty good the actual hamburger itself nothing special but bun sauce and trimmings all really good.

Editing my review for this place. Originally gave them 4/5 stars after my first visit because you need to buy two of their hotdogs to fill up and now having gone there many times, I feel stupid for ever giving such a place only 4 stars when it clearly deserves 5. The hotdogs, while delicious, are the least interesting thing on the menu (although I recommend this place if you're in the mood for a gourmet hotdog). 

Their burgers however, are PHENOMENAL! In n' Out has NOTHING on this place (and I love In n' Out). There are a bunch to choose from, reasonably priced and so full of flavor they can only be described as MIND BLOWING. The fries are the best I've ever had as well, seasoned to perfection and cooked just right, just like their burgers. Definitely the best burger place I've ever been too in my entire life. 

Also, they have a gigantic wall full of designer soda's from all around the world, I believe they are only $2 a pop (no pun intended) or $1 upgrade onto a combo meal.

All in all, if you live in Phoenix you are blessed to be able to eat here on a regular basis, if you are passing through or here temporarily it is an experience you'll never forget.

What can't I say about this place? Extremely friendly staff, amazing selection of sodas both on tap and in bottles, and the burgers are something special too! I love burgers but my taste for them has evolved into something more defined as I've gotten older. Rocket Burger has an impressive menu with varying tastes where anyone can find something that suits them. I tried the New York and the Garlic burger. Wow. Those were extremely different and delicious! Made fresh to order and quicker than I thought it should take. The only drawback? It's in Phoenix and I live in Mesa... My poor gas tank. Can't wait to come back!

So I arrived at Rocket at noon totally in the mood for a greasy spoon type lunch and this place hit the mark.  I've passed by a number of times with the promise of the Latina Meat Market which never opened or closed before I had the chance to go in.
Anyhoo, I ordered a double cheeseburger with fries and a can of Diet Coke.  It took a little bit even though I was one of four patrons in the restaurant, but I'll accept that in that it means they cook your meal to order.  Good thin patty burger and thin natural cut fries, though the bun was a bit large.  I'm not a big exotic soda pop fan, but as previously noted if you are they've got probably 6-8 big coolers worth of everything from cream soda to energy drinks to regional colas.
The only issue I had with this place hit about 12:15 when a swarm of teenagers descended upon the restaurant and all of a sudden it's completely packed and noisy as all hell.  Guess the adjacent Moon Valley High isn't a closed campus...
Get the garlic melt! It's amazing. The regular single is great too. The buttery buns really make the burgers.

Really cool Mom and Pop restaurant with the largest selection of refrigerated soda pop I've ever seen. They also serve up some very affordable and tasty food as well.

Inside is very simple with a rocket theme going on here and there. Outside looks pretty old and withered. Could have probably been a convenience store at one time or another. Parking lot is a bit small but achievable. Beep beep!

Ordered way too much food the first time and could barely finish it. They have Hot Dogs, Cheeseburgers, and a large selection of every type of Sandwich known to man. Very large portions. You can even choose Rocket size if you are feeling really hungry.

My favorite so far is going to be the NY Hot Dog which comes with Pastrami, Swiss, Coleslaw and Rocket sauce. Also have enjoyed the spicy Afterburner Chicken Sandwich, the Philly Burger, Mexican Dog, Chili Dog, and Chicago Dog.

Everything comes out fresh and ready to jam in your mouth. Their Fries and Onion Rings are also very delicious. Your meal is not complete without an Ice Cold Soda Pop from the cooler or a nice soothing Homemade Milkshake.

Place can get pretty busy during peak hours. They do have some additional seating next door. Great place to bring the kids and family. Be good and treat yourself to something fun. As Jackie Gleason used to say ... TO THE MOON!

4 STARS

this place is right around the corner from my house. the guys who run it are nice guys. the food is great and the bread is local. i'm glad to see everyone else likes this place as much as i do. let's hope they stick around.

This review is based on a recent, first time visit to Rocket Burger.

Pros 
- Friendly Service
- Amazing Cola Selection
- Hole in the Wall vibe

Cons
- the Rocket Burger

On recommendation from the staff, I ordered their flagship burger the Rocket New York which is three patties on a 12 in sub with pastrami, cheese, and cole slaw. No fries (too much food already) and a root beer. I believe I paid about $14 bucks.

So the burger was huge and I was exited to get into it. However, I was disappointed with the quality of the meats. The pastrami was super salty and chewy, and I had to take it off the sandwitch after two bites. The burger meat was low grade, fatty, thin, and had an awful brown-granular texture too it. Fresh meat should have a reddish glow to it. This tasted it like was frozen, defrosted, cooked, refrozen, and reheated. The slaw was drown in mayo sauce. The bread was the best part. Nice sub roll with just enough crust on it. I eat half and had to stop. Not because I was full, but because I was getting an ulcer. I took the other half to go, and toss it. Felt bad tossing it in the store because the staff was friendly. 

I will most likely return because of the service and potiental I saw on the menu. Get a single or double burger, on a roll, simple toppings, and a fancy root beer. Hopefully it will be better and I can update this review to a 5!!!!!
Food was good, not great but I loved that they had so many different types of bottled soda. Would come back, if not for just a soda!

Excellent selection of custom burgers made to order .. Been here many times .. The one thing you'll definitely come back for aside from the eats is the soda selection... Any flavor soda you can think of .. They have ... From root beer  cream to cherry to bacon maple and banana .. The mushrooms are phenomenal as well and again made to order.. Piping hot .. My favorite burger is the afterburner single.. Altogether for one person with a bottled soda base price is about 10$ as a combination ( ie fries, mushrooms etc) so I'd give this place 5 stars ..

The wall of soda is damn impressive. and so are the burgers, but they are only 1/3 pound each. Still. obviously you can get a double, but actually the smaller weight almost guarantees that they make the burger well done. The bun was nice and squishy and fresh toppings were included along with the secret thousand island sauce which turned out to add a good flavor to the food. Of course, the highlight is the soda factory and if you get the combo, make sure to add 2 more bucks to have it include one of the beverages in the case. I ended up going radical with the pumpkin pie soda and yes it did taste like a lighter version of the pie and it was all natural as well. Fries were pretty addicting too.

Lemme tell y'all something right now.  Check my profile.  Yelp Elite 10, Yelp Elite 11.  What this means to you is, I aint no bitch.  I eat good food mother fackers.  GOOD FOOD.  Rocket Burger did not disappoint.

I've got 2 words for you.  Rocket sauce.  I'm not going to act like I know whats in, I do not.  I do know that Rocket sauce rocks the body that rocks the party.  I dont even care whats in it.  I only know that it is good and thats all I need.

I was extremely disappointed to find they had no Dublin DeePee.  Which is a staple in any specialty soda shop.  Too many rules and restrictions it seems.  

Its pretty easy to make an average burger but something completely different to make a great one.

ROCKET BURGER MAKES A GREAT BURGER.

I put my 2, count them 2, Yelp Elite Badges on the line here and declare that the In and Outs and 5 Guys of the world better watch their back.  Its obvious the guys running rocket burger are developing a rabid following by just being cool dudes serving high level food.

NONE CAN DEFEND!


ps This review is pretty much a 5 star.  I've just started being more stingy with my Stars.

So is this a burger sandwich shop or a fantastic specialty soda / pop store? This place is SO COOL!  I honestly never knew there were so many kinds of soda pop and the flavors are just as cool as the design and names on some of the bottles.

Anyway I can't express enough how impressed I was witht their soda selection but my reviews are more about a restaurant and their food and this review will not become an exception.

I ordered three burgers to go. Two double cheeseburgers a chili burger two orders of fries and one order of onion rings. My 21 year old grandson had their chili burger and an order of fries. My wife and I had the double cheeseburger. She had the fries I had the onion rings.

My grandson said he liked his burger and that it was OK but nothing to write home about. He said the fries were about the same.

My wife commented that her cheeseburger was a little spicy and ate half of it because she just didn't care for it.  Her fries were OK.

My first impression was this: Right from my first bite there was something about the burger I didn't like. It tatsed OK, Their sauce is great but it does have a bit of a kick to it.  so what was it? I finally determined that the combination of their "sauce" and the way their lettuce is cut so thin it appeared there was coleslaw on the sandwich instead of lettuce. In fact if there wasn't it sure seemed like there was and I just didn't care for it at all. But everything else about the burger was fine.  The burger was good, the bun was different than you normally get a burger on, it tasted good and was hot. I agreed with my grandson though it was noting to write home about. My wife and grandson also commented on how they weren't really impressed with their fries, but I have to say my onion rings were deeeeeelicious!!! 

Bottom line: Better than Rocket Burger is better than any fast food place. I guess I just expected a little more especially after reading the reviews. 

                   So I will have to give them another try 

FOOD: NO wow factor or anything, however they are  better than any fast food place. PRICE: The prices are reasonable. SERVICE: The guy at the counter was nice and polite. AMBIENCE:  Looked more like a convenient store than a restaurant. CONCLUSION: Two Words: SODA SHOP The selection is intense. Best I've seen in years. Great selection of small batch brews. I love mom & pop establishments so stop by and support this really friendly neighborhood shop.
Absolutely love Rocket Burger! Dont forget to add a scoop of ice cream to make anyone of those amazing sodas a FLOAT! There chicken tender bites are to die for.

I heard about this place by watching Check Please. We finally got to get there, today.
It's such a cute little place. Almost, back in time. I would not have guessed that there is that many flavors of sodas made, much less sold in one place. If you aren't into bottled soda they have a soda fountain.  I ordered the single Cali burger, it had bacon, avocado cheese and the usually fixings. It was good but way too greasy for my stomach to consume. The onion rings were so-so.  Greasy and a little over fried. The service was exceptional. The gals were so friendly. I wouldn't return, but I think one should give it a try, maybe your stomach is stronger than mine!

Rocket Burger is surely one of the best burger restaurants in Phoenix! The restaurant was small and quaint, it offered an extensive selection of burgers, hot dogs, sandwiches, sodas and much more! The walls were lined with quirky bottles of craft soda, sure to please any taste. On a Saturday afternoon, we experienced both friendly and fast service. As for the food... it was astronomically tasty! One of the most delicious and unique burgers was the Gyro burger, which unfortunately, we weren't able to photograph because it was eaten so fast! The burgers were topped with a mouth-watering rocket sauce and the fries were seasoned to perfection! We will definitely be back because coming to Rocket Burger was a blast! Our new favorite burger place!!! It will not disappoint!

Amazing food, great friendly staff, TONS of soda to choose from (about 300 at this location and about 5000 at the other location.  I'm told) I think I spent more time deciding my drink than my burger.  I got the California Burger single as is and a Black Cherry Cream.  Highly recommend.

Great service. Menu is huge. Got a bacon cheeseburger single. Definitely recommend getting onion rings. Best I've ever had. French fries reminded me of what my dad would make when I was a kid. Even the brownie was delicious. Just all around great place to eat.

Buzzing place at lunch on Friday. The burgers are perfectly seasoned, nice glazed bun. The New York burger had a great combination of slaw with the burger and bacon. The avocado addled freshness to my burger. The thin fries were nicely seasoned. Tip: Yelp check-in is 10 percent off your whole order.
A hidden gem. Awesome place. Best selection of drinks ever. Great subs, and kind workers. Don't let the exterior scare you off, great place to eat.

Don't miss this place!!! My wife and I tried this place the other night and Im so glad we did. The burgers taste amazing and the chili cheese fries are to die for. The guys who run this place honestly care about their customers and want to make sure you leave absolutely happy. Prices are great and the food is even better. LOVE IT!!!

Surprisingly pretty damn good. Nice bun on the burger, well cooked and seasoned....a trained chef or someone with attention to detail has got some knife skills on the veggie prep.

Had mex burger and onion rings....big portions. I liked that the onion rings came with ranch....finally someone who knows what the customer will request ahead of time.

Their cold case of a million sodas and drink options is cool...next time I will investigate.

Two thumbs up for sure.

Went here for lunch with my husband and mother-in-law. My husband had the garlic burger and my mother-in-law had the chili burger. I had the Mexican burger no bun because I am GF. At this time the do not offer GF buns instead they put my on a bed of lettuce. We also had their fries and onion rings. Even though I am GF I tried the onion rings. They are very good. They batter the onion rings there. Everyone was satisfied with their selection. I think I would have liked mine better with a bun. The girl behind the counter was very friendly and polite. The place is small inside but there are picnic tables outside so it is a good place to go while the weather is nice.
Decent burgers, but messy. The soda selection is interesting. Huge wall of antique sodas.

delicious burgers!  I was visiting from San Diego and found this place near my sis's house. The sandwiches, burgers, and fries were all a hit with the family. Oh, and don't forget to add an order of fried cheese curds!

I was really impressed. Went to Paradise Valley Burger yesterday and this definitely compares. The price is very right, was 1/2 the cost of PVB and I think the quality of beef was on par. I really enjoyed the fries too. This is a really good classic burger.

The place was okay. My expectations might have been a little too high because of all the awesome reviews, but I know that I won't be coming back here again. There's very limited seating (which is fine because you can just get your food to go), but it can definitely get hot if you're just sitting outside in the sun. Anyhow, this really wasn't a big deal. I came here for the burgers, and I was fine hanging next to a few flies outside. 

We waited about 20 minutes to get our food, and the place wasn't even really packed. They initially gave our food to someone else - I get that accidents happen, but there's a reason that each customer is given a number for their to be delivered, right? They even asked if we'd be okay taking the food that they set in front of the other people. Yeah, I don't want to eat food that someone else was just touching. The burgers themselves were fine, but nothing to really write home about. I had a bacon burger, and it was pretty good. Their fries aren't the best, but their onion rings were probably the best part of everything.

Their prices are decent and they do have a nice selection of craft sodas. I might have been salty about the whole experience because of the whole food mix-up, but either way, I probably wouldn't recommend this place unless you're already in the area and looking to try something new.

I came here one day with my father and the first thing I loved was the massive variety of sodas. I spent a good 10 minutes looking at them all. I ordered a burger which was alright. My father said his was ok as well. It was not anything to talk about afterwards. The service was average but not bad. I'll be back to give this place another chance. We all have off days.

This place pretty much rocks! Our friends introduced us to the place last night. Our experience was so exciting that we went again today for lunch. The first meal was a philly burger, amazing, and a gyro burger, an another amazing! Both burgers were spot on with big flavor! The burgers are great, but the other thing that made the place pop for me was the selection of artisan sodas. The place has a giant selection of sodas that are so rare to find. I'm from Maine and they had Moxie. I can't get Moxie soda anywhere here in the valley, that is except at Rocket Burger! This review isn't for the soda Moxie, it is definitely an acquired taste. Rocket Burger on the other hand is not a place that has to grow on you. You'll fall in love with it right away.

Awesome!!Came in the other week for the first time in about a year. Had no clue what to order but the super friendly cashier (jesse I think) gave me a a run down of the full menu by memory. I was impressed and also very pleased with this customer service. He helped me decide what I wanted and ordered my food very well. I got a ghost burger and I pick a random drink from their huge wall of choices. My meal and entire experience was awesome and I'm very happy to have visited this restaurant.
Me and my friends from GCU come here all the time. It's our favorite burger joint. Keep up the good work!

Cute concept place with a huge selection of sodas. I ordered my lunch for pick up today. Cheeseburger with decent amount of fries. Both were very good and reasonably priced. Will be back for sure. Oh, and thanks for the 10% check-in coupon, Yelp! 

Next time, I'll be trying something else, like the New Yorker, which looks and sounds amazing. May add the ghost pepper cheese too ;)

Eh, I ordered the crispy chicken sandwich and fried zucchini combo. It was just over $12, good amount of food for the price. The chicken was pretty big and I got plenty of fried zucchini. The chicken breading was a bit salty and slightly over cooked which made the edges just taste burnt. The zucchini was good but super hot when I bit into it, doi  I'm disappointed because I read such good reviews on the place, but overall for the price and quality I probably won't return. Also the owner asked most of the customers how they heard about the place and if it was their first time there but he never said anything to me so that was a bit of a kicker, nbd just tops the experience.
Small restaurant, super friendly, fresh ingredients, amazing food all for a fair price. What more could you ask for? Five stars, will eat here again!

Service outstanding all around, just great people working there.  Many solid options.  Been a few times, burgers fresh. Buns are a bit dry and too much bread, not my taste. Best chili cheese dogs and fries in town I've had. Enjoy the incredible amount of soda options, although I'm not a huge soda guy.  Old school burger booths.  Good humble spot.

Went to this place with some friends and really enjoyed it.  They have a pretty good menu. It's fun to see the combination of a burger and subs place. There is an old school vib in the place.One of the first things I noticed was the craft sodas. I went straight for the root beer! Then I tried the black cherry. This place gets high marks for the craft sodas. My friends and I all loved the burgers and fries as well.

There employee were very helpful. They helped me out with the menu and answered all of the questions I had. The menu has a good selection of items and it was my first time. I liked that the restaurant was clean and well maintained.

This is a great place and I recommend people to come and check it out. Great food, good menu and awesome crafted soda.
Absolutely awesome old school place. Soda selection is massive and simply delicious hand crafted food. You gotta eat here!
First time here, tried their philly burger... omg! Talk about amazing flavor, fresh meat, fries and zucchini were bomb!!!! Keep up the great work!

Fantastic, fantastic experience.  I finished my double bacon burger faster than my son finished half his single - and I usually eat sensibly.  Furthermore, they have a VAST selection of sodas that are unique.  Price was decent, and the people were very friendly and helpful.  I will be looking for an excuse to go visit them again, VERY soon!
Always a great spot to grab lunch. Never disappointed! I love the Mexican dog . And when you see all of the bottles of soda you will be amazed. So come and check this place out.

I went here with a buddy for lunch and was pretty satisfied with my experience.  It's not fancy or much to look at, but they definitely focus on the food, and that's all one can ask for.  The Philly Cheesesteak was great and so was the extensive selection of sodas.  Definitely worth checking out if you're in the area and looking for something quick and cheap.

Love this place, food is very well portioned, and yummy.  I really love the endless selection of bottled drinks offered.  Must try if your craving a soda different from the normal selections offered.  But, they do have the standby soda selections available as well.  Stop in, burgers have some crazy combinations to try.

I have been in so many times since the time of my initial review that I had to write an update. It has been awesome every time. The fries, still deep fried awesomeness!

There soda selection is always growing and if you get a chance you have to try; The Flying Cauldron "non-alcoholic" Butterscotch Beer.. If you tell other people that you 'like' butterscotch so they don't think you're weird, this is your dream soda. Whenever I go I buy two because the 1st one I inhale and the 2nd one I actually drink slow enough to enjoy..;-)

I realize that I have never mentioned the service which has always been the "no-brainer" part of deciding if I want to eat at Rocket Burger. There are those places you love to eat, but wish you could get someone to go get it for you "You know 'cause the food's great but.." and the 'but' is not wanting to have to actually go there. 

This is not one of those places..I swear on my bones. :-)
If you are looking for a place to get a great burger, this is that place.The burgers, fries, and customer service was excellent. Definitely will be coming back.

Just had their latest creation - the chicken tender bites salad. http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/-ZBfr1BHvArFp1d6XH8jOQ?select=VQg07pVUi7ZiSTao92KkRg  It was mega-flavorful! I love that this is not a chain eatery; it frees them to be creative, so they keep coming up with delightful new things to offer.

Found this place by accident. Was skeptical but once I tried the food I was hooked. Back for the second tome
In 2 weeks. Worth the drive. Yum!!!

Ordered their Fuego Pollo Burger! I found this place on Yelp and I recommend dine in orders as we ordered to go and by the time we got back to our hotel room my food was at food temperature but still delicious!

Messy, delicious burgers.  Go for the double.  The single is probably fine, but it's only a little bit more for the double.  They do triples as well, but only go there if you want to embarrass yourself.  The double makes for a nice two-handed burger.  They have a bunch of choices.  When my Mr. and I hit up this joint a few days ago we tried the gyro double burger and the ol reliable, bacon double cheeseburger.  I ordered the fries because the pictures looked delicious, and he ordered the o rings.  Everything was fantastic.  The onion rings are interesting with what tastes like corn meal mixed in the breading.  They had a nice crunch and were not greasy.

Loved both of the burgers.  They gyro burger was a bit of a monster because we got a double and it has gryo meat on top of it too, but we managed to take most of it down.  I ate the rest of it at 3 in the morning.  Still great.  We had them load the burgers up with all the toppings and everything was fresh and provided a nice mix of flavors.  The seasoned fries are even better than they look in the pictures.

It was fun to choose a soda from the dozens of choices they have.  I haven't had a grape soda in years and I think I was on a sugar high for most of the afternoon.  They also have sandwiches, mini corn dogs, fried zucchini, hot dogs, and a few other of my favorite things.  This place is tucked back on the north side of Chandler Blvd in the strip mall attached to Safelite.   The employees were friendly and patient, and the prices were reasonable.  We'll be back for sure!

Very nice burger selection (toppings not patty type), I've been here several time for lunch and enjoyed it every time.  Huge selection of soda, more then I have ever seen.  If you don't want a burger try the buffalo Chicken and the fried mushrooms...very good.  Beware, this is not a light meal, better for the younger crowd.

I had gone once before and didn't like my burger because it was all soggy and falling apart, gave this place a second chance and we'll the burger was pretty bomb and cream sodas are a must try, take the fam you'll all enjoy it!

Love this place! Burgers are great and you get a ridiculous amount of food with your combo meal! Plus you can't beat the selection of old fashioned sodas they have! A little hole in the wall but the place is very clean and the staff is always friendly. Burgers are to die for!! Definitely give it a shot!
Pretty good change form the usual. Will come again. Great Zucchini onion rings NY Burger.
I'm from California and this place reminds me so much of La like the cheeseburgers are just like La! Hard to find a place like this in Az !

This is an easy to miss/pass up local...which I stopped to check out a few years ago and am so glad I did. It is locally owned and operated. They have a standard menu and a rotated special.  The most obvious thing they sport is the vast selection of boutique sodas.

The food is fresh, ex, the fish is hand battered--in their own kitchen. The buns are very good, solid enough to hold up under all the marvelous stuff they put in their burger/sandwiches but soft with a nice bite/texture.

Back to the sodas...I think that it would be a very fun thing for a group of friends to gather and have a soda tasting event. It could event be a MeetUp. I do not want to even start listing the selection--just visit and take a look for yourself.

Finally, I have always been served by the same pleasant gentleman all the years I've been going there. Consistency, is something I value.

I love the soda selection, I love the tie in to the Moon Valley Rockets  referencing the nearby high school.  Clubs, burgers, sandwiches, salads, all have been fantastic.  I don't drink soda, but it's fun seeing so many options, it's like a living soda museum!  It's worth stopping in.

Saw this place on 'Check Please Arizona' and what a delight it is!  Just a hole in the wall with the best burgers and fries you could hope for. The bottle sodas is unbelievable,something for everyone. If your looking for fancy place,stay away. If your looking for great food and all around fun --this is the place for you

This place is a gem. You would not notice it from the outside. But if you give it a chance, you will be impressed by the burgers this place create. The place looks like a convenient store, but much nicer. It has a huge wall of refrigerated soda of all kinds, in glass bottles. I haven't checked, but I wouldn't doubt if someone said that they have every flavor of soda known to man. 

Couple of suggestions: I would order double patty burgers. The patties are a bit thin, so the single patty burgers tend to be cold due to the vegetables on top. Also, I would break out of the norm and order a burger out of the ordinary cheeseburger. They have some great "out of the box" burgers. This place is worth trying at least once.

Much like Google search words, Hot, Spicy, Jalapeño, Habanero, "Don't do it", on a menu make me salivate like Pavlov's dog.  Most of the time I'm mildly amused or deeply unsatisfied with the level of heat and flavor from whatever it is I've ordered.

Enter the Afterburner burger from Rocket Burger.  Pepper jack cheese, horseradish mayo, fresh jalapenos, rocket relish, lettuce, tomato, pickle, onions.  Your stomach, not you, should be required to sign off on this before consumption begins.  The horseradish mayo was atomic horseradish, I know because I use it in my cocktail sauce at home.  This is not for young children or those that eat like them.  As powerful as the burger was, it wasn't that memorable or something I would want to go back for.  The bun was a little oversized for a single burger, I think they must sell a lot of doubles or bigger so the buns are probably completely right-sized for those, but both me and The Princess thought the buns were a little large.  The P had a basic burger, no cheese,  just tomato, mustard, catsup and she thought the burger was passable.  She loved the fries, I thought they were ok.

As it's been well documented on Yelp, the soda collection is legendary, you name it or want a certain flavor of soda, it's probably there, cold and ready to enjoy.  It's most likely the largest collection of bottle soda pop in the state.


This is my second time here and I feel like I'm missing something for a joint that has 4.5 stars.  I'd much rather enjoy a great burger from Lenny's or Five Guys (the Five Guys little burger with everything and jalapenos is one of my all-time favorite burgers).  I'll come back one last time and try a dog (thanks for the tip Mark R!).

Until then, a solid three stars.

I really wanted to love this place, great service as well. Unfortunately the gyro rocket burger just wasn't very good, the bun too small and the gyro meat tasted very processed. I did enjoy the recommended root beer though! The fries are also pretty good. All in all; I think their prices are too high ($11 specialty rocket burger w/o side), but for somebody that appreciates rare sodas this is a good spot.

This place is awesome!!  ended up here after searching yelp for a good burger place and rocket burger came right up! The service was quick and friendly and the food was hot and fresh and absolutely delicious!! Definitely will be back again!

Who doesn't love a good neighborhood burger joint?  I will emphasize the "good" and "joint" on this one because chances are even this little hole-in-the-wall will surprise you.

I had seen the great reviews on Yelp as well as the Phoenix New Times about this place, so I decided to take a chance on grabbing lunch here on a Friday.  I was a little apprehensive about coming just because of the proximity to Moon Valley High School (it's literally next door).  Lunch + Friday + high school conjures up images of when I and hoards of classmates used to go to our favorite lunch spots with friends during high school.  Worse yet, the place is in a tiny old strip mall with almost no parking.

Shockingly, the place wasn't busy at all and I easily got a parking spot.  When you walk in you almost feel like you've stumbled upon an old convenience store as you immediately notice the soda machines, the large refrigerator area full of soda, and even the soda six packs on the shelves.
