Notice a theme here?  Yeah, they've got A LOT of soda.  In fact they claim to have the widest variety of sodas to choose from in the state.  As in the entire state of Arizona!  I have no way of verifying this claim, but I did indeed see many soda brands and flavors I had never seen before from chocolate to watermelon, to lemon, and on and on.  If you're a soda junkie, you'll be in heaven here.

But I came for one reason, the burgers.  They actually have a variety of hot dogs, gyros, and submarine sandwiches as well, but its Rocket "Burger".  I saw one person eating a Rocket sized burger which is insanely huge (basically a submarine burger sandwich with at least 4 patties by my count).  I wasn't feeling that bold so I went with a bacon double cheeseburger instead and got a side of fries.  The burger was excellent.  Hearty portion with plenty of cheese and bacon and their special sauce (basically a rendition of thousand island from what I could tell).  The fries were pretty average so nothing special there.  All totaled, the burger, fries and a drink were $8.  The dining area is pretty small with tables, chairs and a couple of booth.  But like I said, it wasn't crowded and I was easily able to get a seat.  I was in and out in about 20 minutes

Overall, a pretty cool place and certainly unique to the west side of town.  The fries were really the only big negative of this place.  Burger was great, prices are right, and the soda selection will blow your mind.

Awesome burgers, great variety. You pay sit-down prices for fast-casual service, but the food is so good and the portions are generous; it's still a value! I literally have not tried anything on the menu I haven't liked. The soda selection is awesome, from crafts on drafts to rare bottles, and the staff is friendly. Great hole in the wall place.

I was skeptical of this place when my coworkers told me about it, but when I walked in for the first time and saw the wall of bottled sodas, I changed my mind.  They didn't even mention that!

Seriously, though, they have a lot of sodas.  A whole refrigerator full of root beers.  A row of birch beers, a couple rows of colas, a row of Faygo sodas, a couple rows of ginger ales/beers... Really, every soda you can think of besides spruce beer (I guess I'll still have to go to California to stock up on spruce beer).

Of course, this is also a burger place.  The burgers are fantastic, as long as you're not expecting a gourmet, 95% lean, thick patty $12 burger.  It is better than the Five Guys and Smashburgers of the world.

Try the New York burger (Pastrami, slaw, rocket sauce), the Santa Fe burger (bacon, fried green chili, rocket sauce), or the Baja burger (pico de gallo, bacon, rocket sauce I think).  Those are my personal favorites.

I have also had the gyro burger - pass on that one; the tzatziki sauce is great, but the gyro meat is probably the frozen variety.  They don't specialize in gyros here.

I pay this place a visit every week now.  The fact that their A/C doesn't seem to work well in the summer doesn't even dissuade me.

My biggest complaint is that they have a soda fountain.  People who prefer carbonated sugar water over delicious specialty sodas are simply not worthy - they're casting their pearls before swine.

This was a fun place to try.  Our kids ordered off the pretty typical kids menu, but I absolutely loved the afterburner burger!  My husband and I got it rocket style and split it. That's on a large hoagie roll with three or four hamburger patties spread across it. The horseradish mayo was fantastic and all the ingredients were very fresh including fresh jalapeños. After eating there we went next door to The Pop Shop, which they also own, and bought some unique sodas to take home. Overall, great food and a fun experience!

I was craving a good burger but didn't want to get a $14 one. I found this gem on Yelp and went with my husband on a Saturday night. There were a couple people in the small restaurant. You walk up and order. We did the cheeseburger and double bacon burger. Both were great! I loved the big bun that was grilled and had just enough of their rocket sauce. We split cheese fries which were cut fresh that day with melted real cheese. We dipped them in a side of ranch which they didn't charge us for and they were amazing and plenty to share. Also if you want to try a fun soda this is the place!

Glad my kiddos and I found this spot! Spontaneous cravings for a tasty burger and this place did not disappoint! My boys love the not so heavy buns and perfect size of burger. I, on the other hand devoured the amazing Eddie Lopez Burger and all I can say is that I am a happy camper! Highly recommend this spot for the variety of burgers on the menu and alternative choices as well. Come check out the huge selection of bottled soft drinks as well! Definitely guaranteed to satisfy your eclectic tastes especially if you're a Rootbeer fan!

I had the Cali Burger on the owners recommendation and it was GREAT!  I didn't love the skinny fries, but the burger more than made up for it. Excellent soda selection, fast service and very filling. The place was full but didn't feel busy.

Definitely not somewhere to go if you are looking to eat healthy!  But it was so good!  I ordered the chicken teriyaki sandwich-and although it looked difficult to eat, I scarfed it down without a problem and without a mess!  Have some fun and try to find the craziest sodas amongst their giant selection!

A '94 Rocket myself, I heard a good buzz about this place from folks in the old 'hood.  I brought my two little burger critics with me as well (ages 10 and 12).  Lots of soda to choose from, great hamburgers, and delicious fries.  It beats the heck out of a chain burger place in quality and character.  I even ordered the "Rocket Burger" which is a ridiculous three-patty monstrosity on a 10-inch sub roll.  I was embarrassed in front of my kids because I couldn't even finish my fries.  Rocket Burger has the makings to be a classic joint, legendary if they can match Capin' Bills longevity!

This is definitely the best burger joint in town! All bottled soda you could ever dream of, in fact the largest selection in Phoenix I believe. Portion sizes are great too! I would recommend everything on the menu as I have tried most of it.

Prices are good but burgers were not by the time we got home buns were soggy I didn't like their sauce they put in the burger. We ordered a burger with double meat one just regular and ended up with both just regular. The only thing I liked was their drinks.
They have a HUGE choice of all kinds of bottled sodas and delicious homemade chili sauce. Their rocket sauce is outta this world and the shakes are bomb too. Definitely come here!

Let me say this clearly and succinctly, Rocket Burger is simply the best!

Sitting at home, convalescing from a neck operation, I noticed Karen W, Joyce W and Kate M reviews, that Rocket Burger had a new Chandler outpost. Well I hit the BM'd (Bookmark in Yelp-speak) and made a note to come here when I returned to work. Done!

This past Friday, I ordered their delicious Double Burger & Pastrami (see photo) sandwich, only $7.49. Look at the receipt and look at those pictures, it doesn't get any better. And for all my Chicago relatives and friends, yes they carry Berghoff's Root Beer.  Nice!

I was introduced to Rocket Burger nearly seven years ago by King Scott D when he invited me to lunch.  I had the Philly Burger that day and have since made several trips on my own. Thank you, Scott D!

One of the most cool and impressive things about Rocket Burger is their assortment of soft drinks bottles in the refrigerated case behind where you sit. They have Dad's Cream Soda, Grape Nehi, Green River, Royal Crown and yes the afore mentioned Berghoff Root Beer

In his review of Rocket Burger's other location, my friends Arlin B writes: "It was a mouth watering double burger that came with Hot Pastrami stacked on top of the two patties covered in melty-cheesy goodness, toppings and their thousand island dressing.  It was FANTASTIC!!"  Like d'ah, I agree. LOL

The only down side here is their limited seating, they have only three inside booths and two more outside. When I was here, I doubled up with a guy from Little Rock, AR who now works in Gilbert.  His friend told him he had to make the trek and come here. 

I agree, why are you wasting your time reading this review.  Get in your car already!

Enjoy

It may not be health food but it sure is tasty! The burgers are yummy and the fries are plentiful but the best part of this place is the soda selection. There is a whole wall of bottled sodas from classics to crazy. We always try 4 or 6 different ones when we go.

I always get the teriyaki chicken sandwich. It is incredibly messy but so good. I usually go through 10 or 12 napkins trying to finish it. My husband has tried many of the burgers and said they are all great. Be warned, the servings are huge so you will leave full.

Seating it limited in this small place, as is parking, so we try in go in off hours so we don't have to wait for a table after we place our order at the counter.
Enjoyed my Italian sub so much while visiting AZ for the first time that we went back for lunch back-to-back days instead of trying out other places! Highlight of my trip.

Try the teriyaki burger! The fried pineapple sends it over the top. All those flavors work so well together.

Today I had the New Yorker sandwich on marbled rye. Oh my! That is not a good sandwich, that is a great sandwich!

If you have a favorite soda from your home town that you can't find here in town, you will be able to find it here at Rocket Burgers.

I love this place! It's two guys living out their dream. They get to know their customers and they cook for you as if you're family.
We absolutely LOVE Rocket Burger as you will tell from our review on the original location.  Just the best burger in the valley!!  The owner is a rock star too.  Definitely check them out.

Items Ordered:  Double Bacon Cheeseburger; Crispy Fish Sandwich w/Coleslaw; Pick 2 sides

Total Bill:  Under $25

Quick Tips:
     - Take a look at the soda wall before you order...there are hundreds of choices.
     -  Buy yourself a four pack of soda when you leave.  They have a separate soda shop next to the restaurant.

Ok so this is our place for burgers and we drive all the way from the East Valley to get them.  Hands down, the best.  And not only the burgers.  We have had the hot dogs = great; the crispy fish = delicious; and the pastrami w/ coleslaw = AMAZING!  Everything they fry is awesome.  

The one thing I would say could be improved is the onion rings.  The batter is not very thick and tends too be very crumbly when eating.  Still tastey though!

And the owners/cooks are awesome!  Always have a friendly word to share.
Food was good. Service was nice. It was a bit out of our way but worth the small deviated drive

The burgers were very fresh and tasty. I had the bacon cheeseburger, it was the perfect tonic after a very stressful week. We also loved the cheese curds and the multiple options for drinks. Being a water drinker, I had water in a box. Service was friendly and prompt. My husband didn't enjoy the sandwich as much as the burger.

No fancy schmancy interior.
Just clean and cost effective.
Best cheese curds I've had in Phoenix.
Not fast food style with homemade breading, not frozen varieties like others.
Had a hot dog as well. 
Not a big fan of their sauerkraut, but I am picky being Polish and German. 
Good dog and a good bun. 
Staff was friendly too.
I will definitely be back for my cheese curds and dog fix...and to try a burger.
So many options to choose from. So many drinks, burgers and sandwiches. Can't remember what I ordered I just remember being full and totally satisfied.

We ordered the steak burger, Reuburger, Little ones had kids meals.   We also ordered take out at the same time and they were kind enough not to start until we were closen to leaving so it would be hot and fresh.  Everyone was beyond super nice, food was great.  Would definitely come back.

We had the Santa Fe burger that included a fried green chile pepper, it was good but not hot.  My son had a regular hamburger and loved it.  I think next time we might not get the Rocket sauce bc it was a little sweet.  There are tons of bottles of soda and the fountain soda is delicious, had Snozzberry so good!

Was looking for a good hamburger so reviewed Yelp and saw Rocket Burger. Went in on Saturday and I see why they get the great reviews. Great fresh burger and good bun. Service was great as I was asked twice by whom I assume was owner or manager how food was and if I needed anything else. My wife and I loved this place and will be back next weekend.

In 1 word, TREMENDOUS!! Delicious medium well juicy burger with crispy bacon, griilled onions & grilled mushrooms and garlic mayo. Absolute HEAVEN baby.  Topped it off with a Banana soda. Servers were polite and efficient. Clean restrooms. Do yourself a favor and ride the ROCKET  to taste bud HEAVEN.

Everything about this place is great. The other day I was driving and saw a man spinning a sign advertising Rocket Burger so I looked it up. Based on the reviews, I decided to give it a try. It was a GREAT decision. After the very friendly cashier gave us the run down, I decided to order the Santa Fe Burger and a side of cheese curds with a ginger beer from the fountain. I can't decide which I enjoyed the most. Everyone in our group ordered something different and we were all equally satisfied. The food here is delicious and very fresh. Apparently, the produce is purchased locally and daily. I can't wait to go back and try something else. My only recommendation other than you must try this place is to wear elastic waist pants. The portions are huge.
This place was amazing & very friendly we will definitely be eating here again!!! Thank you for the delicious food...very filling

Okay food, good service, reasonable prices. Lots of soda choices, a whole lot. I tried a sub sandwich, kraut dog, cheeseburger, and cheese fries. Perhaps we didn't order the "good" versions of those things, but although what we did get was edible, just nothing special at all. It was ok.

I got the rocket burger which was $12.99 but it's a great deal considering it has three 1/4 pound hamburger patties hidden below a chunk of roast beef and peppers and onions.

What an amazing burger/sandwich!!! 

It had mouthwatering incredible flavors and the meat and bell peppers were extremely tender and delicious.   They make their own roast beef and its layered on on top of your burger along with grilled onions, bell peppers, and melted cheese.  

What was crazy is that I could smell the burger on my fingers several hours after lunch.  It was soooo good!   Can't wait to go back again!

The food is really good, and was served to me in a mostly timely manner for how busy they were. The selection of sodas is amazing! The only reason I wouldn't give this place all 5 stars is because the lobby was pretty dirty coming in. All of the tables were well used and that doesn't appeal to me. Otherwise, good place!

Rocket Burger is a fun place to go for lunch and the food is excellent!

My favorite so far is their Philly Burger.  The double size is only $6.99 and is very filling. It's topped with grilled green peppers and onions, along with provolone cheese and mayonnaise. Another good sandwich is their California Club.  It comes with Turkey breast, tomato, avocado, sprouts, cheese and mayonnaise.  It's on whole wheat sub that only costs $6.69. Both are great!

I've also had their roast beef sub.  It has roasted peppers, provolone, and yummy horseradish mayonnaise, along with lettuce and tomatoes for $6.69.  If you are seeing a trend on prices here, that's because all of their medium sandwich or double hamburgers are $6.69. But, they do have smaller sizes which start at $4.49.

One of the most cool and impressive things about Rocket Burger is their assortment soft drinks bottles in their refrigerated case behind where you sit. They say it's over three hundred. Have you ever had a Judge Wapner root beer? How about a Dad's Cream Soda, maybe Grape Nehi, Royal Crown? It's impressive that's for sure.

My friends, Arlin B and Rand H have written glowingly about their sandwiches. But the best line comes from Arlin regarding their double burger pastrami.  He says: "It was a mouth watering double burger that came with Hot Pastrami stacked on top of the two patties covered in melty-cheesy goodness, toppings and their thousand island dressing.  It was FANTASTIC!!" 

Got the visual image? Good. Enjoy!

Good verifying of burgers... Tons of different ways to make a burger just the way you want it...tons and tons of soda options.. The place isn't all that ..it looks a little stand off ish but all's good.....a definite must

Came here because it's in my area. Mostly positive Yelp reviews.  Withhold judgement on negative reviews till I tried it myself. With that. Had a truly great experience.  Ordered a double bacon cheeseburger.  Opted to go without the Rocket sauce (house made 1000 thousand island). The patties were not overly large,  but cooked perfectly. Juicy. On par with 5 guys.  Along with the fries. Loved em. The local is a tad beat up, but not ghetto. The kicker is there is more choices of soda than you could drink in a year. Was a trip down childhood memory lane, seeing some of those sodas. Will be back to try the subs.

Delicious chili burger, I was impressed by the soft bun and the tender burger. Over all a great experience, they were fast at getting the food out to us and the experience of looking at all the sodas they have out was a great part of the lunch we had there. Very family friendly

Big-ass tasty burgers! I have no complaints with this place other than their $2 bottled sodas. That's kinda ridiculous if you ask me. I would definitely recommend this place but it's just not worth 5 stars.

Service was great. My husband had a burger & I had a chicken sandwich. Only thing that saved my meal was the fries. I didn't finish my sandwich, it was just eh. I wanted to take more time to look at all the  different sodas but it was pretty busy so I felt like I was in the way. If I'm in the area I will probably be back for some of their neat sodas but not for the food.
Tasty burgers overall.  Their basic cheeseburger is just okay.  If you're into soda they have a ridiculously large selection from the soda pop store next door.

Ahhhhhmmmmaaazziing! I had the mexi-burger and it was probably the single best burger I have ever had. Perfectly juicy and crisp. The fries were also very good. and oh my the soda selection. I did the math and there is about 500 different sodas. A must go in my opinion.
My favorite go to burger place! I've been here a few times now, and each time the burger was great. They have a lot of different styles of burgers and offer other types of sandwiches as well.

Okay so I've said before that I'm a big fan of owner operated businesses, and small local businesses. This place is one of them. You walk in the door and to your left are six refrigerator doors chocked full of about 250 different specialty sodas. All priced at a $1.89 and to your right there are the two owners and two helpers. One of the owners is at the cash register and handling the customer service and the other is that the sandwich table whipping up delicious hamburgers subs and the like. Very friendly and helpful!!!!! 

While I was there I asked a couple questions of the owners. One was do they weigh the meat before they load it into the sandwich? The guy at the sandwich making table shook his head no and said we want to make it good. Indicating they just cut a lot in there until it looks right. Needless to say my sandwich was well portioned. Rand H. and I both got a Large Ruben on Sourdough and split an order of fries. I really like this place for a lot of reasons, some of which I noted in my review. While we were eating I saw a few more orders roll by and they were all generous servings that looked delish.

Came here for a late lunch with my friend and tried the New York burger and fries and my friend had the Santa Fe burger. Everything was so good! We also had some mushrooms and they were delicious! 
They have sooooo many sodas to choose from!! I tried a cucumber drink and my friend tried a butterscotch one. The girl at the register was so friendly and the guy who brought us our food was very kind as well. The young lady even came out to ask us how everything was. Very happy with the food and the service. Will definitely be back soon!!

My roommate and I went to Rocket Burger all the way from Scottsdale to look for a particular soda only sold in the midwest. We were surprised they had that one and a huge selection of other ones to boot! Including a chocolate maple bacon one, and some weird flavors we couldn't help but snap chat.

We had the burger (I think santa fe??) with cole slaw, salsa, and avocado. The service was quick, and the burger was to die for! Along with it, we had the cajun fries. We will certainly be coming back for more!!

The area is pretty sketchy, but the burger was great.

There were tons of interesting menu items and I wish I could try each one, but I went with the standard cheese burger.  Of course I had to get it "Rocket" style though.  The burger plus an order of fries could have easily been a challenge on Man vs. Food.  With that said I couldn't finish the fries and burger which is a rarity for me.  For about ten bucks it was a pretty good value and well worth it.  The burger was well seasoned, cooked perfectly and wasn't greasy.  The bun held up great so I didn't make a mess of my shirt as is almost always the case when I have a burger.

I will definitely return because the Eddie Lopez burger has my name all over it!

I've been here a few times and have to say it has been a great experience every time. I've primarily had their rocket sized cheeseburgers with bacon and everything has a home cooked taste to it. It is obvious the food is made with love here, and it is always reassuring to see the owner hard at work in the restaurant serving customers, not to mention cooking.

Probably the only disappointing thing is that the last time we went their cheese curds were overly salty. Note I have a HIGH tolerance for salt, and this was even too much for me, it was extremely over the top. Let them know about it through email and they never did respond which is disappointing, but considering how good everything else is here I'll let it slide.

The burgers are great, a little greasy but delicious. Their's a great list of burgers to choose from. I try a new one every time I go and have never had one that I didn't like. If your new try the New Yorker or the Teriyaki Burger (be advised both are extremely messy but delicious). If you never have been here you should try it out. O yea, I forgot to mention their is like 500 different sodas to choose from!!!
First time coming here the burgers we're really good.  I order the cali burger and i liked it alot also they have lots of drinks you can choose from and employees were nice.

My husband proclaimed the Afterburner chicken sandwich to be the best sandwich he has ever had, but warns that it is not for the faint of heart. I enjoyed a Garlic Melt with grilled chicken and our son scarfed down his kid's cheeseburger. Great sandwiches! Great buns! Great fries and sauce! Great drinks! And, the owner was incredibly kind and warm. We'll definitely return next time we're in the area.

Rocket Burger's teriyaki burger was 12 inches of messy, drippy, delicious madness. I probably used at least 10 napkins while eating that thing, but looking like a socially unacceptable slob was so worth it. It was huge, tasty, and took me from "hungry" to "omgwhydididothat" in no time. Rocket Burger is America.

In addition to selling ludicrously sized burgers, Rocket Burger also sports an impressive collection of specialty sodas. The vast walls of varied sodas more closely resembles the beer selection of a very-good liquor store, which alludes to the restaurants previous life as a bodega. 

If you've got a 12 inch burger and a soda, then you most likely don't need a side dish, but for fellow Yelpers with monstrous appetites, their fresh-cut fries are wonderful. I haven't tried the onion rings or cheese curds yet, but I don't know if my body is ready just yet. 

If you're suffering from an extreme calorie deficit or just wanna stuff your face like no one's looking, make Rocket Burger a priority.

Yikes. 

Lady that answered sounded confused and didn't seem to speak English that well. Completely messed up our order. I repeated and confirmed my order with her and everything seemed okay, but everything ended up being wrong. All sandwiches were incorrect and gave us three extra orders of fries (four total)...I told her "ONE order of chilli cheese fries."

I like the kraut dog... Haven't had one like it since I lived in GA. ... I had one of the fountain ginger beer... Again hadn't had one since GA. ... Their onion rings, fried zucchini,and their cheese curds are great...
I will also recommend their Chicago dog... Just like back east... They have many great sodas from all around the world...  Love, Love, Love them...

You walk in and see so many different kinds of soda. That's really cool. Cashier dude didn't really act like he wanted to be there, wasn't really excited to try it because of that to be honest. I got the Philly burger with mushrooms and it came out quickly! It was so damn good. The fries were a bit under done but still good enough to eat! I definitely recommend this place.

Holy smokes! This place is FANTASTIC! 
I was super starving this afternoon and was craving a good burger. I remember going to this joint about a year ago with some co-workers and decided to head on over again.
The place seems to have grown since I was there a year ago. The counter seems to be back more than before but maybe I'm just going crazy.

Anyway, on to the experience! I was quickly helped at the counter by a very nice guy who took my order. 
I ended up getting the Eddie Lopez Burger which had a SUPER tasty burger,  pastrami and is topped with lettuce, tomato, onion, pickle, swiss, and rocket dressing!  The only bad part was the part when it was all gone!

I also ordered the Onion Rings. I am not even a fan of onion rings but I had to give them a try since everyone suggested them. Wow! There was a pile of them and they were so good!

Next time I'm getting a double! 
Forget going to any of those franchise burger places, hit this place up and be prepared to drool!

Great mom and pop hole in the wall kind of place.  Food is great--everything we've ever ordered was tasty.  It's not the most amazing burger in the world but it beats fast food, and at a similar price point.  Also delicious are the deep fried sides (zucchini, mushrooms, pickles, etc), and they have an amazing selection of glass bottled sodas.  One area of concern is the strip mall it's in needs renovation, the parking lot is too small/confusing, and Church's Chicken is awkwardly placed.  Oh well, what can you do, it's 35th avenue.

I have never been disappointed here. Amazing food, tons of cool sodas to choose from if you want to pick some up on the way out. Every time I have been there the owner has too, he is in the back cooking and is a really great guy.

I had the flamethrower.  OMG spicy ghost pepper cheese. Too spicy.. and I LOVE spice. So spicy I couldnt taste the burger. I know how hot ghost pepper is. I just didnt think they would put that much into the cheese.  I peeled half of the cheese off. I couldve benefit from a glass of milk. I dont like the diced onions they use.  Otherwise perfect little joint! Awesome place. I want to go back just to try more sodas. Super cool and unique.

I have to say that this place serves some absolutely delicious burgers. Let me start with the Garlic Melt, this was no hint of garlic burger but one exploding with garlic cheesy goodness, just the way it should be served with a name like that! Then comes the Santa Fe, it comes with a scrumptious huge piece of corn meal battered deep fried green chili...that's all I have to really say about that!  Check out my pics and God bless you in Jesus name!

The burgers here aren't bad, but they aren't the best I've ever had either. The staff here is friendly and the service is pretty fast. It is a small place and it can get hot during the summer. The big bonus here is their gigantic selection of sodas. They have all kinds of flavored sodas from root beers, ginger beers and creme sodas and even energy drinks. So if you're looking to quench your thirst with a hard to find soda, this is the place to try!
The Baja Burger and Teriyaki Burger are absolutely amazing. Huge selection of unique sodas. Try Snozzberry at the fountain. Huge menu great prices. Delicious!

Looking for a great burger joint with never ending variety of sodas?  Then you found your place.  Rocket Burger is another one of those diamonds in the rough.  A classic no frills burger place with plenty of flavor and a vast selection of sodas to wash it down.  
     For my visit I had the Eddie Lopez burger which is your standard burger topped with pastrami and some of their rocket sauce.  The pastrami was excellent with just the right amount of caramelizing and not too crazy with the sauce.  The burger was well seasoned and bursting with juicy flavor.  You gotta love when a place seasons their burgers correctly.  The included fries were also seasoned quite heavy, but I feel this is a classic burger place style, especially when you're piling them down with plenty of ketchup.  
     You can't have a proper greasy spoon burger with out a good soda to wash it down.  Luckily Rocket Burger offers over 1,000 sodas, juices, and teas.  They have everything from obscure energy drinks to classic Mexican Cokes, it would take years to taste every soda in this place.  Even if you're not a burger fan you can easily find something you like in the cooler.
     Overall Rocket Burger was fantastic, and I will be going back to enjoy another delicious meal.

Where has this place been my whole life? FOR REAL! This place is incredible! If your reading this, stop debating where your going to go eat and get your booty over to Rocket Burger & Subs. 
We've been there two times now and both times we've been floored. The owner/operator is a burger genius and has created an incredible menu. 

Quick run down:
-500 different craft sodas... at least
-Delicious burgers (Best in town by far, no joke)
-Huge portions 
-No regrets

Love this place, go check it out!

Stopped in based on reviews. Had the Santa Fe burger with onion rings. Both good and definitely the rings were worth the stop. Family members had rocket burgers which were filling but I think the burgers are fine. Small location with sparse seating... Minimal ac so it was tough to sit and enjoy the meal.
This place was great.  The soda selection is obviously amazing- over 400 different bottles.  The people were nice and the food was good.  I would go back anytime I an in the valley.

This place made a quick, great burger. They have enough variety to satiate any tastes (if that taste is for something burgerlike) and their wall of unconventional soda and NA beverages is worth the trip on its own.  In one trip it has been a staple of the area.

Good food
Great atmosphere
Great customer service
Brought back childhood memories with the sodas from the past

I will be back

Rocket burger is one of those hard to find restaurants that once you do find it not only are you locked in for life but you are full the rest of the day. I took the family after reading some reviews from my friends on rocket burger as I'm sure many can attest there aren't many good burger places in phoenix that aren't part of some fancy restaurant.  My kids ate every bite without whining and the hamburgers are big and scrumptious.  I got the rocket chili cheese burger, every bite was heaven. Here I am 6 hours later still full. Oh and it's pretty inexpensive too. Definitely recommend trying the bacon cheeseburger, cooked to perfection I couldn't stop taking bites out of my wife's burger.

My wife finally caved in today and went to Rocket Burger & Subs after hearing great things about it.  As for me personally, Eek ! Methinks not.

The burger patty was big but thin.  The fries were bascially the frozen in a bag type at your local grocery store.  Seriously !

Are you kidding me ?  Everybody knows that the fries compliment the burger and if your fries are weak that kills the burger.

My wife brags along with the other reviewers that they have 300 sodas to choose from.  To me that is just 300 ways to get diabetes.

Look, the burger was whack, the fries are the frozen variety and I could care less about 300 sodas.

Rocket Burger & Subs Eek! Methinks not.

Amazing food, amazing service. I'm a regular there, and they are always awesome. Large quantities of food for a cheap price and definitely have something on the menu for everyone. Not to mention all the sodas they have. Its one of the very very few places that have Faygo.

Gone to this place a few times and its been good. ( see past review ) decided to go tonight to try the rocket burger... Well lets just say I was highly disappointed tonight. I ordered online and my large burger was supposed to be nice and long sub style. Well instead the chopped it in half and threw it in a box. So much philly cheese steak cheese and peppers that i couldnt even taste the actual burger. It was flowing off the sides. I couldnt even pick it up with my hands. Literally. That gets me to the next point. It was so covered in junk that the bottom bread was literally soaking wet. Mostly grease from what I can tell. Absolutely not edible. Presentation on this burger was literally 0. I mean... I had to use a fork. Greasy toppings with hardly any bun. So our next item was a large cheese curd. It came in tinfoil in a to go box and was extremely greasy. The top looked presentable but the bottom was covered in grease. Let it sit hanging in the fryer longer next time! Disgusting. After just a half of my burger and 3 cheese curds I was feeling quite ill. Not food poisoning type sickness but certainly queasy probably from all the grease I just ingested. Honestly, I don't think ill be back. What a shame.  Pictures posted. There is actually a burger and some bun somewhere under all those toppings.

Try the New Yorker just the way they recommend it and you won't be disappointed.  It may be the best New Yorker, I've had.  Also, try the brownie with homemade whip cream, hot out of the oven, mmmm so delicious.

My girlfriend loved the veggie sub, and while she normally stays away from shoestring fries, these shoestrings were mouth popping.  Also, there were sooo many different novelty sodas in the bottle to choose from, I can see the quest beginning here to try, but not succeed at tasting them all.

The food was great, but what really put this place over the top for us, was the friendly service.  You could tell they really wanted our business.

Darn good burger n skinny fries!  Too bad and lucky so far for me. Driving friend to her car n found this place craving a burger....cool old time feel, great service...cheap!   If I'm ever on this side of town again.... I'll be back!
One of the best burgers in Chandler. Super friendly owners. We have dined in and ordered to go. They don't disappoint.

Was not at all impressed with this place. I ordered the double cheese and fries...their burgers are not good at all. Very salty the sauce was the thing that ruined it. It had such a peculiar taste to it. The girl at the counter said it was thousand island..but it had a bad tangy taste to it, my bread was soggy from the pickles. I tried working my way around it took some stuff out got rid of the top bun and just couldn't finish it. The meat doesn't seem to be fresh either. They look like those round frozen patties yuck! Was pretty upset I was expecting an awesome burger  :(

We were in the area so we stopped in for lunch on Saturday. I had a regular cheeseburger and the BF had a regular chili cheeseburger. We shared a side of chili cheese fries and onion rings. That and two can sodas came out to about $14. Sweet deal! Food was good. The burger buns were good... (I think they make their own?), the meat was nicely cooked and it was tasty. The burgers come with shredded lettuce... normally I'm not a fan, but in this burger I didn't mind so much. The onion rings were coated with cornmeal and was nice and crispy. Not overcooked or undercooked, they were just right. The chili cheese fries was huge. That could be a meal on it's own and then some. Also, I liked the fact that they had gingerale =)

So, basically... it's a place to consider if you're in the area but I wouldn't make any special trips from Chandler for it. But I might just find excuses to go out this way just so I can eat here again ;) Oh and the people there were super nice and friendly!

Pretty good burger for on the cheap.  

Fries are soggy but ...

The bun needs to be moister.  Pretty dry

But it's unique and fun for a visit every now and then.

Picked up Waialua Hawaiian soda for my restrnt, and decided to have lunch there also. Previously had the double cheeseburger w/ bacon and fries was at least a five napkin lunch!!! Decided to try the New York burger today! What can I say but another winner!!! The pastrami was flavorful and the burger juicy! Cole slaw was spot on also. The owner was from Hawaii also Filipino descent very nice lady. Think this going to be my to go burger place. Prices are very reasonable for the high quality you are getting. Thank you Rocket Burger!!! Two thumbs up!

Tried the Afterurner Burger with smoky ghost pepper jack cheese (Amazing), and my wife had the Chicago Burger with homemade onion rings (Delish)! Awesome burgers. Fantastic variety of sodas. We'll be back!

I stopped here with my four year old yesterday with a Groupon.  We had lunch here.  I had a gyro with fries; he had a hotdog and fries.  The fries were simply amazing!  Perfectly prepared and delicious.  The gyro was done perfectly - not burnt or dry.  

The interior is nothing special - a tv, some chairs and tables.  The people behind the counter are terrific.  

If you like soda, this is the place for you.  They even had my home town favorite - FAYGO!  Plenty of great energy drinks.

The prices are reasonable.

Stop by.........

So awesome. I ordered the philly cheese sub and it was perfect. Cheesy. Thin, tender steak. Not dry but not too juicy. The fries were also seasoned well. They had so many portions of soda to choose from but as it was my first time, I ordered a fountain drink. I will def be returning when I'm in The Phoenix area.

I stop in every chance I get, usually for lunch when I head out of town to Vegas or Sedona.
10 visits ... plus , always fast, always tasty.

Check it out!
Great food.  Great prices.  Hundreds of different kinds of sodas!  Had turkey, roast beef sandwiches - good.  Sandwiches are better toasted.  Chicago dog - yum!  Cheeseburger - ok

First of all the food was sooo good! We got subs and they were awesome! The rocket sauce is so yummy! The reason I knocked them down one star is because they are so slow!!! It took us 30min to get our food!!! I guess next time I will be calling it in first before I show up!

Hubby and I tried this place in search of a delish burger. Omg. When I say this place by the spot, that's an understatement. I kinda wish they had beer, but that's not a big deal. We got the garlic Swiss and the southwest burgers. Both were so good. The buns are soft and fresh, taste like brioche. One order of fries is plenty for two people. The owner (I think) was super nice and helpful. The southwest burger has a deep fried green chile on it! We will for sure be back.

Excellent food! And yes if you are going to splurge this IS the place to do it! I especially like the Breaded Cheese Curds. The menu is outrageous. The employees I think are a family. I'll tell all my coworkers to try it!

This is one of my favorite burger joints. I don't  like the chain restaurants with there frozen burgers. Rocket burger uses fresh beef and you can tell. The side items are just as good, you must try the cheese curds. The beverage choice are endless with there soda wall, you name they probably have it. I always get one to go, as i am addicted to the snozzberry in the fountain drink selection. It's a little out of my way, but worth the drive.

Much better than smash burger. 
The bread they use on their burgers are wonderful, the bacon crunchy 
Highly recommend

A friend recommended this place while we were in town for a baseball tournament last week and goodness we are so grateful! The best burgers, good fries, beyond delicious  chicken tenders and a housemade rocket sauce that you will want to drink!! Also a plethora of sodas from around the world!! The fountain ginger beer was my fave!! Will definitely return everytime we are in town!!

Found this place on Yelp today.  Can't believe I've never heard of it!  

Crazy selection of sodas, (picture Rocket Fizz + some).  Old school burgers and sandwiches abound here.  My friend ordered the Cali Burger and loved it.  I ordered the Afterburner Chicken sandwich and loved it, except the bun fell appart and was a little big for the sandwich.  The fries were really good, but the onion rings were exceptional.  I am very picky about onion rings and usually stay from them.  These only have a thin batter coating, and it's very flavorful.  

I'll go back to try several of the other menu items, and the onion rings again!

Fun!
Went on a frivolous date night w/my boyfriend, and this was the beginning. 
Soda pop heaven! I was laughing at all the varieties. You have a craving for an unusual soda, this is the place to go. 
We ordered chili cheese dogs and french fries. Everything was really tasty, hot, and the staff was extremely nice.  The only thing that kept it from getting that 5th star was the tables all needed cleaning.  Bits of food on all of them. 
Will absolutely go back!

I wont be suprised if the account mgr w yelp that handles this restaurant takes this review down. Looked at reviews and got excited, sped down here bc they closed in a few minutes. Was amazed by the huge selection of bottles soda. It was quite impressive. Liked the simple, easy to order recipe. The food on the other hand stinked. The chilli dog was bland. The Chicago dog was good. And the onion ring and fries were prob the worst I've had at a quick svc restaurant. This is my 5th
bad yelp rec, and it's sad. No one likes to eat bad food. Well in this case, I ate a few bites :(

I found me a new burger joint! This place was absolutely fantastic! I got the Santa Fe burger and the green chile was what I was hoping for, nice and spicy. I also had the chili cheese fries, which were huge, I should not have eaten so much but it was too good to stop. I will definitely make this a regular stop when I'm in the area.

I stopped in after reading about it here.... Ordered the Eddie Lopez Burger (Double)... First of all, the burger is huge... a single would have been fine, but hey, who's counting calories?
I really enjoyed this burger...every bite of it...
Next time I will venture to try either the bacon burger or the Cali burger.
Great service...And the coolest thing I have seen in a long time is their bottle soda fridges..must have been 8 of them... They had every kind of soda you can imagine... I'm talking about sodas from way back when...Ones I didn't think were out there any more..
Can't wait to bring my family back for dinner.
I was looking for an alternative to 5 guys.  I'll stick with 5 guys.  They have better tasting burgers and are about the same price.

OMGGGGG sooooo good I love this place!!!! Just moved from Chicago and haven't found a great place to eat like this in months! I love it service is great. The atmosphere and decor is so different I recommend this to anyone
Absolutely the best food hands down!!!!!!!  Have amazing burgers and subs both. The fried mushrooms and zucchini are the bomb!!!!
Burgers were good. The sides are great. Skip the fries and get the zucchini or mushrooms. Next time I'm going to have to dig into their selection of Root Beers... Can't wait!

There's a reason this place has 4.5 stars. I am so glad Yelp let me find this place and am sure there are many places all around the Valley which I am also missing but have the hope of finding now that I use Yelp! This is the perfect little mom & pop burger and sub shop! The burgers are out of this world and my wife likes their subs. If you check in on Facebook or Yelp you get a 10% discount as well. So far of the 2 times I have gone I haven't spent more than $13 for me and my wife both! And I'm talking about stuff like a double cheeseburger and fries for me and a large sub for her, good stuff! Here is my first review of little places I found using Yelp, I'm sure there will be more!

NY Burger, fries and a soda. Drank the craft root beer on tap.

The soda was stellar, loved it.

The sandwich was ok. Not balanced well, pastrami was very light... if I didnt see it I wouldnt know it was even there.

Fries were old school shoe string. Nothing great.

The building itself is run down and beat up. Not a lot of work having been put into it at all.

Staff is excellent. Great people and great service.

Four stars for the soda selection and originality of menu. Will probably go back for one more pass at it but only because the reputation is good, first experience wasnt positive enough on its own.

I must apologize to Norm , Daren and Iain for not listening to my favorite 
No Pho friends sooner.. Because I made a BIG mistake waiting to go here!! I will promptly make up for it by going as many times as possible this week!! 

I love this place , yup local owned with a sense of mom and pop goodness. Reminds you of back east...The soda selection is phenomenal and looks great on display as you eat. 

The Ruben is my new favorite , rye bread , juicy well seasoned pastrami, sauerkraut and light toasty goodness. 
Plus one had the Cheese steak that was really good except he opted for extra heat and I couldn't handle it .. but still great. 
Fries are fresh and plentiful ....one basket will serve 2-3 people . 

Go here Go here now ....and take a friend , let's not waste another moment.

I nearly cheated on you Rocket. The siren calls of the uber super deal of the restaurant next door was calling my name. I resisted the temptation of cheap chicken and ordered the California Club sandwich, fries and a diet Dr. Pepper for $6.54 (it's $2 dollars cheaper if you remember to bring the coupon).

The California Club has generous portions of avocado, and perfectly cooked crispy well done bacon with tomatoes and turkey. It also comes with lettuce and sprouts if you're into that sort of thing. I had my sandwich on toasted rye bread. The fries are served in a separate basket from the sandwich, outstanding, the cook(owner) didn't put any salt on these fries since he remembered I'm not into salt. And they even serve the fries with ketchup already in one of those ketchup tubs; now that's what I call service. Oh, the California Club was outstanding as usual.

I have had the burgers before, and all I can say is they rock as well. I'm not a big fan of the onion rings, but others seem to enjoy them.

This place delivers affordable food that will keep you returning for more, and with the spirit of the political ad season, I APPROVE THIS MESSAGE.

Rocket Burger & Subs is a very casual and divey. You won't get the most high end burger in the valley but you'll get 100% angus flat patties that are prepared to your likening  and are delicious with several choices of sizes and toppings. Besides burgers they offer sandwiches, subs, beef hot dogs, soft serve, floats and the biggest selection of bottled sodas I've ever seen. Portions are very large and prices aren't much more than fast food. You are getting food that's MUCH Better than fast food.

After watching RB&S on Check Please Arizona I went with what everyone else tried the popular NY Double Burger with fries. I liked that they carefully toasted the buns and the burgers were prepared medium just like I asked for and were juicy and tasty. A generous amount of tasty grilled pastrami and house made slaw and rocket sauce topped the burger. It was all good tasty and humungous and a giant amount of fresh cut fried potatoes were yummy too. 

Check out Rocket Burger!

It's a Blast!

Seriously don't know how this place has almost 5 stars. Ordered the mexi burger and it had so much condiments on it I couldn't see the meat. Bun was so big I threw half of it away. My patty was cold from all the salsa and stuff that was on it. Also, I don't know how you can mess up bacon, but they did. It was fried so bad I thought it was metal. Only reason it gets a star is for the drink selection. That was awesome

Great new find! We had the burgers & fries but I will definitely be back for the subs, especially a roast beef! 

The gal running the counter was perfect for the job! Bubbly, informative and put a great sell job on the roast beef sandwiches. 

The fried onion rings, mushrooms and zucchini are calling me back as well. I'll be back Rocket!

If your not into tangy sauce skip the rocket sauce and go for the traditional ketchup mustard. 

Prices were very reasonable and the beef was delicious. Don't expect a big seating area. Maybe 4 tables inside and a few out. 
Give'em a try!
Pretty cool and interesting place for burgers and more.   The more is their soda selection which is unbelievable!  Kids will love it!  Parents will enjoy a good burger there too!

Not bad, but did not live up to the hype.  I've been told about this place by many people and that I, "have to try it".  So I tried it, a few times.  The burgers are not bad, the meat patties themselves are not good but the cheese, bacon and toppings were good.  The meat patties did not have a good flavor to them, and I mainly went to this place for the burgers!  The fries were soggy and had a burnt look to them but they were not burnt, they tasted decent.  The Chicago dog is bomb, great fresh toppings and the fried zucchini isn't bad.  Overall, not a bad spot, but would prefer other local burger joints.

Just moved to Phoenix about a month ago and got around to trying this place earlier this week. I've already been back!! The first time I got a bacon cheeseburger, which was delicious and today I got the New Yorker sandwich (pastrami, cole slaw, Swiss and rocket sauce) which was even more tasty!! I could swim in the rocket sauce they put on everything!! Will be back very soon.
One of the best burger joints in the area. Their afterburner sandwich is amazing! Everything is freshly made.

Went here a few weeks  ago actually just moved to the neighborhood kind of looking for a hole in the wall restaurant and we saw this because there is awesome pop shop next-door that carry pops that I believe is also connected to the rocket Burger shop. Was really good the interior was really cool to be that I had a whole bunch of old authentic sign and it looks like it was probably family run probably still is , good food, price was great, they had all sorts of different pops along the back wall very clean so definitely would go back there again.

We stopped into the soda shop next door which is also owned by the same people. There selection of soda was very extensive. We saw different sodas from all over the country and the world. After purchasing a few bottles we went next door to grab lunch. We had just a regular burger and a gyro. Both were delicious and very well cooked. The service was very friendly and help explain some of the items on the menu. The only reason it didn't get five stars from me is because the place looks pretty ran down. Someone consider it a hole in the wall. It's really just preference. The food is totally worth it.

Great food! 
Was in the mood for a burger, heard about this place for awhile. Packed the family up and had a great lunch here.
I had the bacon cheeseburger and chili cheese fries. Burger was great, Bun, cheese, bacon, ground beef. It's a little big, and messy but worth it. Kids loved the hot dogs, and fries. Wife enjoyed her burger also. There were other options on the menu I would love to try next time. 
Parking is not the best, but thats the way it goes. Not a lot of seating, however there are some. When we where there, they were have an issue with their soda fridge leaking water. Watch your step.
Over all we had a great time, this is a place with great food!
Very cool place. Right when you walk in a huge fridge of all kinds of different Sodas. 20-30 different kinds of Root Beer, Cream Soda, Etc. Burgers even better. Very unique place.

The Soda Pop Shop is the star of the show here.  The selection is very good.  Plus, I've heard if they  don't have it, they can order it for you.  The food was ok, but not the standout I hoped for.  French fries were served hot, but the burger was not.  Service was fast and friendly.

I'm sitting at Rocket Burger as I write this. No need to mull anything over today. This is my first, my inaugural visit. I can say workout a doubt, without equivocation, I just enjoyed the best burger I've ever had!

Mine, the Philly Burger, was a flavor explosion cooked perfectly and accompanied with awesome fries. 

They offer a wonderful selection of fountain and bottle sodas I've never seen before. Dead World Zombie Orange Soda? They have it. They have it all. 

I'm so full. It was so good! !

Was looking for a good burger joint and this is it! Had the double Chicago burger and fries and it was outstanding! Place has a huge selection of soft drinks and pretty good fries. It's a little divy, but I prefer that. Highly recommended.

We had never heard of Rocket Burger & Subs until our neighbor told us how good the food is.  Last night my husband and I tried it.  He had the Bacon Cheeseburger and I had the Philly Cheesesteak sandwich with fries and a drink. We both really liked the food.  I don't usually like fries but these were very good.  Never saw so many different kinds of soda.  We will be back.

Did we order the wrong burgers? We just were not impressed with Rocket Burger & Subs.

Two of us ordered burgers and the other ordered a chicken sandwich. I opted for the Cali burger and the main flavors I could glean were the special sauce, avocado, and lettuce. The thin slab of beef was smothered by the sauce and veggies it had no chance of being savored unless eaten alone. Maybe I needed to make it a double but the single was already large. I think the focus of the burger was put toward the additives and not the patty. At least my friend enjoyed her special crispy garlic chicken sandwich.

The fries were our favorite side and the cooler after cooler of a gazillion different types of sodas was impressive. Service was fast and friendly but right now the next visit to Phoenix will not include Rocket Burgers, unless it's for fries and their unique selection of soda.

I have to admit, the burger disappointed me.  I had high hopes after reading reviews, but I didn't feel it lived up to the hype.  I got the $3.99 cheeseburger deal.  The saving grace of my lunch, besides the price, were the fries.  Skinny, salty, and just crispy enough, they truly made my day.  I enjoyed my In-N-Out burger far more, but Rocket fries are superior.

Excellent burgers and most original burger menu I've seen.  Try the Chicago burger and make it a double.  Fries are great too and Rocket Burger offers the best selection of soda in any restaurant in Phoenix. 
Locations in Phoenix on 35th Ave & Cactus and Chandler too.  Privately owned by a couple of guys who love the craft and have truly created burgers that are works of art!

I loved there Baja burger! The slaw and salse in that burger went extremely well. The workers here are nice as well to always ask how our food was and if we enjoyed it. I had a smile on my face the first bite of that burger. The zuchini and onion rings were huge portions, so that was a plus. They overcooked them alil bit, but i still enjoyed them with the dipping ranch sauce!

I have been trying to find an amazing sub spot here in the east valley ever since I moved to AZ approximately 10 years ago!  And I think Rocket Burgers & Subs may be my spot! ;) 

I was first drawn here after reviewing several great 5 star yelp reviews, so of course I could not resist testing this establishment out and determining if it's worthy of a nearly 5 star yelp review ... 

DRUM ROLL please .... And, so here are my findings:

Location/Customer Service wise:  it was a little hard to find since it's located in a fairly large sized plaza and you can't see the sign from the road, but when I called in to ask for specific directions the staff was very helpful guiding me in ... Similarly, when I called my take out order in, the staff was friendly and helpful and there were no issues with my order, so customer service wise this place passed with flying colors... 

The atmosphere:  it's cool - it's a small mom and pops type feel, pretty simple, nothing extravagant; it seemed simple and clean ...

THE FOOD:  the Philly cheesesteak sub itself was ABSOLUTELY DELICIOUS... Probably the best I have had since living in AZ;  it's definitely good quality beef ... Many cheesesteak places utilize fake/imitation types of beef in their cheese steaks and there is a monumental difference, and I appreciate this business for providing its customers with a top notch quality product!!  

The price:  the only reason I was not able to give this business a 5 star yelp review is because I think a large cheesesteak sub should definitely come with at least one side for $9.49 ... At least throw in some fries or a bag of chips (it's inexpensive and it will help you sell more product at the end of the day).  I can't say the price point is insanely horrible, but I believe throwing in a side item @ 9.49 will help this business attain a more loyal following of regulars, because I will still hungry after finishing the large, and if there was just a little something more I would have been completely satisfied... and not only would Rocket have earned a 5 star review, but it would have immediately gained a several times a week regular/loyal customer ...

Overall, I was pleased for the most part... The price point issue is an easy fix, and I would absolutely recommend Rocket Burgers & Subs to friends/family!!

Nothing Fancy but Oh So Good.

You couldn't tell by looking at the outside.  However, as the old adage goes " You can't judge a book by its cover."  The same can be said about Rocket Burgers and Subs. Nothing fancy here but the food is oh so good.

The food at Rocket Burgers and Subs   doesn't cost much more than the average fast food establishments around town.  However, you would be challenged to find a burger that compares to the quality and taste of the food  served at Rocket Burgers and Subs.

Rocket Burgers and Subs serves up various styles of burgers, beef hot dogs, sandwiches, and of course subs.  On this visit I went with the Lunch Special ($4.99).  The lunch special consisted of a burger, fresh cut fries, and a soft drink.

The lunch special was a great price and the food was delicious.  The hamburger roll was perfectly grilled, hamburger  grilled to medium, and the fries which were made from fresh cut potatoes with skins  were seasoned perfectly and so tasty.

In addition to great food, Rocket Burgers has the largest selection of bottled sodas I have ever seen. Every soda combination you can imagine and even those you can't is served at Rocket Burger.

The  dining is casual. You order at the counter and seat yourself. The prices are more then reasonable, staff is friendly, portion sizes are large, and the food is delicious.  What more could you ask for.

What a friendly and clean place!  Burgers are big, juicy, good toppings but the meat had little taste to it.  Wish they served it better wrapped so it could be eaten without all that fallout.  Very unique collection of soft drinks from all over the U.S. and Canada.  They claim 300 different brands, WOW and all in the fridge by the front door and in 6 packs on a shelf near the back.  The fries they serve are the best I've tasted, no, not tasted, but eaten.  Impossible to not finish their big "small portion" fried right to the brink of burning but not burnt!!!  Tasty, Crispy, Pretty!
I would have given them 5 stars with just a touch of beefy flavor in the burgers.  I will try them again and so should you.

Not going to write an elaborate review because I dont have tons to say. 

Maybe i got the wrong items, but my burger was alright. The shredded lettuce paired with their house sauce made me feel like I was eating coleslaw. Maybe thats what they were going for? If so- congrats. If not- fix it. 

The fries were nothing special either. Greasy and not overly flavorful. Sometimes you get those greasy fries that you can feel how hard you will have to workout to get rid of them, but it is soooo worth it. These not so much. Drenched in grease and blah in flavor. 

The soda selection is cool, but I don't drink soda. Maybe just not my kind of place.

The food was really good. I like the fries so much!!! I wasn't a fan of the craft soda, but I haven't been a fan of it at all. I really liked the vibe in there. I just wish they had some more inside seating.
This is probably my favorite burger spot. I legit come here multiple times a month. You cannot beat their burgers, fries, and incredible amounts of beverage options. 12/10 would recommend!
No A/C, sketchy area, ok food, filthy dining room, but damn, that's one impressive soda wall!

Back again. Got the chili burger and fries.  Plus the soda (combo).

The chili burger was good.  The fries came out cold.  I suspect they were sitting around a while before my burger was ready.  Which really shouldn't happen.  However, when I commented on that they gave me a fresh batch of fries (VERY hot!).  So give them credit on that.

It's a greasy burger joint, but the greasy burgers and greasy fries are good!  And I really like that their soda fountain features craft sodas made with real sugar, not the usual Coke/Pepsi products.  That is truly awesome.

Awesome visit!  The Philly burger I had was perfect. Quality meat and bun. Awesome hand cut fries and craft sodas. The topper was meeting Steve, the owner. Great guy who truly has it all coming together right at this place.

This is a great burger place. Not your regular burger, but rather fresh unique tastes. I had the Eddie Lopez and it was full of flavor. Pastrami on the burger with veggies, Swiss cheese and Rocket sauce. Great selection of bottled soda. Owner and staff is super friendly and helpful. We will be back!!

OMG I  in & out but this place really has an awesome burger. We got an Italian sub as well that was just amazing. Family owned friendly & endless supply of soda. I'm not a big fan of soda but did have a root beer on tap. Would of like a beer to go with the burger.

Thank you Yelp. Another amazing find. In a world so dominated by fast drive thrus and cheap junk to take the edge off its nice to still walk into that hole in the wall that doesn't care how nice the new tile looks. This place is all about solid food. Bring your patience and your appetite. Both will be tested. Well worth the wait. This place re invigorates the reality that your burger doesn't need to be seen with cardboard.
Wowzas!  Yummy yummy to my tummy!  Best burger in town to date!  Selection of bottled sodas is un beatable!  Highly recommend!

Thank you Yelp, for another great find in the ASU West area!

Hand breaded onion rings, homemade chili, and a wall full of sodas--I hope I sold you already. If not, try cheap. Like ridiculously cheap for every menu option.

Not much ambiance, but for a great burger, who's complaining? I like the bare bones decor, and I'm sure the high school kids would destroy anything more than that. Speaking of high school kids, if you want to avoid those heathens try to make to Rocket Burger before 2:30pm!

After reading tons of reviews on this place, and considering its right up the street, I decided to give it a try. The soda selection was awesome but the food was just ok. The burger bun was twice the size of my double burger patties, although the bread was yummy. The sauce was way too sweet for my liking and tasted exactly like coleslaw dressing, and the bacon, instead of being nice crisp strips, it was chopped up burnt little scraps. The cheese fries were just ok too. I usually am a big fan of thin cut extra browned french fries but these had very little flavor, and zero salt. Fries should be salted as soon as they come out of the fryer while they are still wet or else the salt will never stick... Lastly, the older gentleman who took my order kind of seemed inconvenienced by having to take my order, which is a very uncomfortable feeing.  None of the food I ordered today was bad, it just wasnt all that great. I will probably be back to try a sub and some onion rings. Maybe I can give them a better review next time.

Best damn burger ever had. When you eat a burger, you want a greasy, cheesy, flavorful burger that melts in your mouth but doesn't break apart when you pick it up, and that's exactly what I got at rocket burger and subs. The place look very small and outdated but don't let that "full" you. I got the garlic mushroom burger, and it reminded of two creamy slices of mushroom cheese pizza with a juicy beef patty in between. It took me back through time and damn, I would 100% go back again next time I visit here cause this place is better than in n out and all the other main stream stuff you will find.

My first visit was last week. Good food and good prices. Had the burger and the wife had a sub. Both were very good. Good fries and rings as well.   If you order a "combo" you will get a HUGE basket of fries. Even my family (who loves to eat fries!) could share one order between two of us.

The interior needs a bit of TLC but these guys are just starting out and they are independent (which you have to love in our chain saturated restaurant).  The location is a bit ghetto but you don't need to pack heat. You do leave smelling like grease...so bring an extra shirt. :)

I really liked the huge selection of unique soda. The kids loved it too.  This was a really cool touch.

The owners are really friendly and nice and you just feel good supporting a local business. We need more restaurants like Rocket Burgers.  Keep up the good work guys!

I work rarely close to this spot and decided I'd have lunch here.. So the food had no taste. The fries were bland along with the burger. The way the burger was loaded; I swear it'd have some great taste but looks can be deceiving! The bun was one I never had before but the inner burger itself was falling out while I tried to grip the burger and get to chowing down. Roughly $9.00+tax; but they had a special for $6.99 for a basic combo (surprisingly the guy didn't offer me that but whatevs!) The customer service was welcoming and nice. The cook just needs to be wary where he places his hands because he had almost touch every surface area while preparing my food but luckily my eye was on his hands like a hawk! Service was good, food was just lacking the taste&presentation; did not owe up to the $$

We love this place- great food a massive menu selection. The cheeseburger kids meal is huge- so you can definitely get away with ordering that for a light eater. Also, fried zucchini is delicious. Wish I knew about this place when I was pregnant!

This place is great! I ordered a burger combo with something they called the ghost pepper burger. Had some spicy cheese, bacon, and a few other things I don't really remember. Came with a large side of fries and a drink. The burger was great. I don't agree with other reviewers who said there is too much sauce. The sauce definitely dripped out, but the bun kept everything in place. The fries were cooked perfectly but could have used a bit more seasoning. Food came out very quickly.

The only thing I wasn't a huge fan of was the craft sodas. I didn't try any of the bottled sodas, but the craft fountain sodas were not my favorite. Still they also have standard sodas as well. So no worries there.

Will definitely be back. Used both the 10% off check in promotion and also got 10% cashback from yelp. After those, the meal is almost free!

This has to be the best burger place in Arizona. I have been to the original and this is as good if not better than the original. The burgers are juicy and flavorful. The onion rings are crispy and have a lot of flavor. The fries are perfect. And don't forget those buttered buns, toasted on the griddle. Perfection!

I love the assortment of different bottles soda too! They also have hand made sodas on tap, no Coke or Pepsi here that I could find although I did see a bottle of cane sugar Mountain Dew. 

The owner was there too and we had a great chat. Super nice guy. We can't wait to go back for more!

Being over on this side of town I was looking at places to eat this caught my eye on yelp. The burger was great, the bacon hot and crunchy and above all the fries were amazing. If I lived on this side of town I would eat there often. The selection sodas is overwhelming because they were so many. I had a cream soda. It was really good.
Teriyaki burger is my favorite, it's the best, the soda variety is huge! Highly recommended!

Ate here yesterday for the first time with my husband. We just got a cheeseburger and fries and  it was pretty tasty. They have a huge menu to choose from and their bottled drinks are so much fun! Not to mention the staff is super nice and goes out of their way to accommodate you. Good service is hard to come by these days.

This is quite literally the best burger I have ever eaten. The rocket bacon cheeseburger with 3 patties of meat on a 10 in. sesame sub roll and is nothing short of amazing. It could easily be shared. The cheese fries and onion rings are homemade. We love the casual environment and the huge selection of glass bottled soda. To top it off the prices are amazing! This is our first time here but we are hooked. We would love to see this place on Diners, Drive-In's and Dives, DDDinfo@mac.com, so if you love it here, nominate it!

I've heard good things about Rocket Burger and I was excited to finally try it. I like to support smaller local businesses.  Unfortunately it was a let down for me and my daughter, and did not live up to my expectations.  

On a positive note, the teriyaki burger I ordered was tasty and the fries were good.  It appears that the owner or manager haven't visited or represented the store in the while based the interior condition.  My daughter wanted a hot dog and was told we are out of hot dogs (there is a Bashas 600 feet away). She settled for a burger which she did not finish.  They were out of ketchup in the pump container.  When I asked the worker for more, he left for 5 minutes and never returned (think it was the end of his shift and he just left).  Another employee assisted (thanks).  The huge refrigerator that holds all the specialty soda pops was broken so no cold ones for you.  Plus the wood around it looked unfinished and hanging off.  Some items on the floor next to it as well (bottles and boxes).  One soda selection on the vend was out of order.  The Slush Puppy choices was out of order as well.  The booths had tears in the seating portion.

I really had high hopes for this burger joint but it fell short in my mind.  I think a good thorough cleaning of the store and a few repairs would help.

My Favorite place to enjoy a Burger and Soda!  Fries are delicious too, just the right amount of salty.  California Burger is my Favorite.  Just tried the Onion rings too, they are a salty, crunchy delight. As noted soda selection is huge.  The thousand island sauce on the regular burgers tastes zesty and fantastic!  Excellent experience here.
I tried Rocket Burger the other day and enjoyed it.  I can't say I will be back unless I find myself in the area though.  They serve a decent fast-food type burger at a fair price.

Great food. Simple yet unique ingredients. (Like fried pineapple ring on the Chicken Teriyaki Sandwich)

The New Yorker was great. Really good Slaw on a Pastrami and Swiss sandwich.

Burgers were awesomely awesome! I ordered the Philly double burger and the NY double burger. The burgers were very reasonably priced at $8 a burger. The burgers were humongo!!! The only down side were the fries. They were soggy. I had to place in oven and turn the broiler on for a moment to crisp them up a bit. This was a great place to pick up burgers.
Burger was delicious and fresh. Fries were well seasoned and crispy. Huge selection of bottled sodas from across the nation. Fun and good! Definitely coming back.

I was fixated on the Rocket "Burger" of Rocket Burger & Subs... so much so that for my first visit, I though I'd be doing an injustice if I didn't get a burger.

Truth is: what's special about Rocket Burger is 1) the bread and  2) the rocket sauce.

The burger itself... eh, just fine. 

And, yes, there's forty million sodas to choose from but if you're looking for "diet," you'll be forced to choose pepsi.

Still: four stars because the bread is awesome! I can not wait to go back and get a sandwich! Chewy, but you're not going to break your jaw or cut the roof of your mouth on it. 

And, the rocket sauce puts other "secret sauces" to shame!

Bottom line: don't forget the "subs" at Rocket Burger!

Grease Pit ... Oh  my gosh  the oil was so old when you left the  place you had that smell all over you ..   Place was filthy.  Didnt like the burger  and it was just cheese burger and Bacon and grilled onions   onions  were so over cooked  like it had been days of reheating ...  would i go back NOOOOOOO
Great food, good portion sizes and decently priced! Cute little place would definitely go back.

Got the afterburner rocket burger (rocket burger has three patties on a sub bun) and added the ghost pepper cheese. It had this horseradish mayo and their signature relish that was a really good. 

This burger was worth the hype, granted it was 13 bucks it was really good and could be split with someone. The french fries and onion rings were just ok IMO.  

They had a crazy assortment of sodas, over 300 in the cooler alone with a soda shop next-door with 500+. 

Worth a visit and if come back. So many of their burgers on the menu looked appetizing it was hard to choose one
Best fried zucchini and mushrooms I've had in I don't know how long! Location was unexpected but we had great burgers and unique sodas. We'll be back!

Went here for lunch after looking at great reviews on Yelp. Divey place with very cool selection of sodas and quite a selection for burgers or subs. Ordered Bacon Ghost Pepper Cheese Burger, Fried Mushrooms, Philly Cheesesteak with Fries. The burger was great, not spicy at all. The Philly Cheesesteak, Fries and Fried Mushrooms were okay. Fast and friendly service. Will go here again and will try some of the sodas as well.

I have seen this place while on my way to work and have always wanted to go try it So I stopped by one day and it was probably one of the best tasting sandwiches I've had in quite a while. They are always Courteous, kind, and friendly. And they have a soda shop right next to it they had almost 600 different kinds of sodas it's really cool and fun. If they have a suggestion box I would suggest having a partyHave people pay $10 to get a soda taste test then they will know which ones they like.

This place is a lot of fun... my kids spent about 30 minutes just picking out their drinks!
Literally hundreds of different sodas! I settled on a Pecan Root Beer that was interesting and unique.  I had to, the brand name on it was "Pappa Joe's"

The food was good, not amazing, not "WOW!" but really good. The servers were friendly and nice and very patient with my kids.  The corn dog nuggets were the hit of dinner.

My kids picked a second soda and made them into floats for dessert... that was awesome (any of their drinks can be made into floats)

I will definitely return.

I love me a good burger and I was excited to check this place out.  Unfortunately their burger left me feeling queasy, it was just too much grease.  The service was friendly and I bought some tasty sodas but not enough to bring me back again.

Never Ending 

This describes the choices of food and drink here. 

On today's menu was a small toasted California Club and a Black Cherry sodee-pop. 

Don't let the sound of small fool you either, it is huge! Crammed packed with turkey, bacon, tomato and sprouts. This is a sub to try!

The staff including the owners are amazing. They have such a great selection of food and drink you can take your picky eating kid or a cranky grandad, both will find something to enjoy.

This place is a neat find! More then the usual burger shop, but hidden is a strip center. Not an impressive atmosphere but don't let that turn you away. The dining  area is surrounded by coolers full of unusual bottled beverages. Besides the bottled variety there is also a fountain full of other choices that that will please anyone that are included in your typical combo meal. I had one of the specials on the chalk board and I have to say it was one of the best burgers I have had in a while, pepper jack cheese and spicy mayo just made my mouth the happiest it's been for a while. There is plenty to look at while waiting for your burger to be served to you at your table. During your wait you can check out the beverage selection, and I will just say I have never seen such a great selection! Check this place out!

Really good burgers!! Thin patties but the toppings make the burgers really good! Lots of options. The cheese curds are also good. Frys we're good but not crispy! Def a spot to return to! California and western burger were delicious

5 for sure. I love this place. Found on Yelp. We are from Cleveland, Ohio & it's hard to find anything in Phoenix to fit our taste buds. Fortunately for us, we stumbled upon this place and decided to try it out. First off, I give them a 5 for customer service. They were so nice, helpful and accommodated to our every need. I am beyond picky. I ordered a gyro burger & I have to say it was one of the better gyro I've had. I also  ordered a plain hot dog but I  had to customize it with a few things just like I would back home (fries, bbq sauce & coleslaw) aka polish boy. And I'd have to say it was one of the best we've had. The coleslaw was perfect, bbq sauce was great & the fries, yummm. The only complaint I have is that I couldn't get a picture fast enough before we devoured our food.  We will definitely without a doubt be coming back.  Thank you so much Rocket burger for fulfilling our cravings.

Decided to drive a bit out of the my way to try Rocket Burger & Subs based on the "Yelper" reviews!!  This place is too clean for a "Greasy or a Dive" title, but there food reminds me of some of the BEST greasy/dives out there!  

They have a wide variety of food choices and there menu doesn't tell the whole story, so you may need to ask some questions.  When I looked through their burgers I noticed the "Eddie Lopez".
