To my surprise there is a better burger topping than bacon...  Hot Pastrami!!!  It was a mouth watering double burger that came with Hot Pastrami stacked on top of the two patties covered in melty-cheesy goodness, toppings and their thousand island dressing.  It was FANTASTIC!! 

We also had the "sub of the day" ~ the Big Dipper.  The roast beef was delicious and it had just the right amount of cheese.  Their au jus dipping sauce was not good, but the sandwich was superb.  Their Au jus did not have a beefy taste, it was too thin, too hot and did not set well on the pallet with this sandwich.

Their fries are fresh but a bit too greasy for our taste.  Will try to get them well done on our next visit or try their onion rings.  Their cheese curds were very good!

They do have one of the largest selections of soda, pop in a bottle.  It's fun to try a soda you've never heard about before like an imported micro brew root beer or cream soda!  (Both were very good BTW)

Rocket Burger & Subs, even though it will be extremely hard for me to consider ordering something other than the Eddie Lopez burger, I'm looking forward to my next visit, trying something else and plan to bring some friends with me. If you have not tried RB&S, they are a solid place to "Book Mark"!

Yelpers, what is your favorite Rocket Burger or Sub??

There bugers are awesome! I got the new York burger it is amazing. With fried mushrooms you can't go wrong. I will drive across town for the burgers! The inside could use a revamp design wise. Don't think twice if your in the area you can't go wrong!

Had the Cali burger. it was good. my wife had a pastrami sandwich. it had more coleslaw than pastrami, rather disappointing. soda selection was unbelievable, overall, it was middle of the road. staff very friendly.

Looking for a soda?  Rocket Burger had over 200 flavors. My fav is Faygo creme soda.
35th and Cactus behind Church's chicken.

Lots of retro sodas to choose from! Nice locally owed burger joint that also serves gyro's, and other sandwiches.  You gotta love a place that cuts their own spuds at least I do.  I had the cheeseburger special for 3.99 nice size patty, fries and a drink with free refills.

Wow!!!!!!!! Now that was a great lunch. Found the location on Yelp and decided to give it a try. We were rewarded with a wonderful meal at an affordable price. I have driven by this location numerous times and truly never even thought twice about stopping by. Boy, had I been missing out. We knocked out the fish sandwich, the Cali burger, the chicken salad, and the best cheese curds I have ever had. Every item listed was awesome. The burger was huge, as was the salad. The fish sandwich was so tasty. The negative, the place is so far from my house. Love the food and the large variety of drinks to try. Who has ginger soda as a fountain drink? Yep, this place. And Shirley temple? Yep, this place. Oh and to top it off, 10% off by checking in on Yelp. A perfect experience!!!!
Love little mom and pop places like this. Service was fast  and super friendly and he burger was so cool! Too many options for  bottled drinks, my head was spinning. Definitely my new burger joint

Just a quick review of our first visit...

Bacon cheeseburger was really tasty, with several strips of crispy bacon on a golden bun. It may have been a bit heavy on the shredded lettuce, but that is easily fixed. The onion rings were crisp, a bit salty, and delicious!  The craft sodas and selection of bottled beverages is more than found in most grocery stores. If you have a favorite that isn't Coke or Pepsi, you can probably find it here.

Enjoyed their New York burger! It was a good size!  Tasted good! You have to upgrade for a meal but it's worth it so you can try the craft sodas. The ginger beer tastes just like ginger... It was "interesting". We tried all of the flavor in the machine because why not? The inside isn't anything special. It kind of reminds me of a cafeteria but the burgers are worth it! They are juicy and fresh! They also have a wide selection of  sodas!

I discovered this place via Yelp. Again, my fellow Yelpers weren't wrong! This place was delicious. I had the Cali Burger and rings. The burger was good and better than I expected. Toppings were generous, meat was good quality and cooked right. The bun was very good....held the fixings In till the last bite, no "bottom bun slippage"!
Service was friendly and although I don't drink pop, the selection was ridiculous.....something for everyone!!

Rocket Burger, 5 Stars!

I had the Gyro Burger - Amazing! Stellar! So much flavor... So much flavor... (I said that twice on purpose)

The cheese curds were out of this world... Perfectly breaded and gooey inside.

They have a massive selection of soda too. 

All around great experience!

OMG!!!! Did your sandwhiches just get bigger guys? Holy cow! yumm!!!!
Tamara

Yum, just yum. Super cool place with great food. Check it out, you won't regret it. The staff is great, the drink selection is unbelievable, all different types of bottled soda. My favorite budget goes between the Sante Fe and the Philly

What can I say if you are craving burger that's juice drips down to your elbows with great variety and flavor this is the place. I have been here 7 or 8 times always great. The fries are hit or miss in the crunch scale. Other than that small hiccup this place is phenomenal.

Disappointing. Had a so-called Philly cheese steak. I think it's the first one that's ever been made. Had to explain how to make it. Tasted strange. I believe I asked for onions and green peppers and I'll be darn if I could find them. The mustard had a strange taste to it also. The place was also unbearably hot inside. I guess they're saving on air-conditioning. Don't plan on going back.
Came to Rocket Burger for take-out dinner, and the bbq pulled pork sandwich was absolutely delicious! By far one of the best burger places around!

Perfect price, perfect service, and you can bet I'll eat here again! Had the Gyro Burger because it was on special, but I could not have picked a better start to this place. Made me realize there's more to burgers than some of the other places in the area. 

Fries were on point and everything on the menu seems amazing. I mean, mini corn dogs, really guys, thank you..Plus, any time you spend more than 10 minutes to decide what to drink, it's not really indecisiveness, it's exploration. I can almost guarantee that there's 30-40 that you've never even seen before.

It's no wonder it lead the charts while searching for a local burger joint...

Let's start with the good; The staff was very friendly and super helpful. I watched them remake a burger that another customer ordered wrong no questions asked. Staff was great. They have a super fun selection of craft sodas which was fun to look through and try. Burger was average and nothing special. After that it starts to go down hill. The fryer and flat top are basically in the same space as the dining room so everything is covered in oil. The seats, the floor, the counter and so on you get the picture. Everything fried came out over done and with bits of everything else stuck in. Overall not a great experience we will not be back.

Found this hidden gem and we absolutely love eating here! They have so many menu options as well as drinking options! It's a nice cozy restaurant with very friendly staff and the dining area is very clean! Highly recommend checking them out.

This place is great. 

Old School burger done well. 

Their bottled soda selection is insane. They had a Peoples Court soda! Wasn't sure I want to know how that one came about, but thought it was pretty cool.

Generally, I really like Rocket Burger and appreciate all the different sides and root beers available.  However, I feel it can be hit or miss at times depending on the staff.  Some days, they are very nice greeting patrons and the food is top quality (specifically the cheese curds).  But sometimes, for example, the staff acts annoyed that you are there, or 80% of the cheese curd basket is just a pile of nasty crumbs with no cheese, or the hogie bread (for a cheesesteak) is so stale that it must be days old.  I just think they need to work on their management and consistency.  If it's your first time, best to just stick to the standard burger and fries so that you have a good first experience.

Just so you know a bit about me, I will drive miles for a good burger. Lucky for me this place is close by and seriously delicious. So not only are the burgers good but there's like a thousand different bottles of soda to pick from. Holy memory lane batman, there were things I haven't seen in bottles since childhood. Good place to bring the fam too.
Great soda collection.. Its fun to try new flavors. Food was ok but nothing i really want to go back for.

Your Cali burger rocks, it's the best burger in town, when ever I'am really hungry I stop at this place and order the Cali rocket burger and that fills me up like nothing else, love this place, and your staff are always kind and very helpful. Thank you Rocket burger!!!!!!.

These guys know how to fry!  I had fried zucchini with a good cheeseburger. Terry had the fried chicken sandwich   The best he has ever had!

They have a huge wall of sodas!
Awesome place with all the different sodas you can choose from. The ranch is great so order the fried mushrooms if you like them. The burgers are good too.

Best chicken sandwich! Little gem in the middle of a strip mall. Tons of old school sodas to choose from and really, really great food. Ask for ranch on the side if you order the chicken sandwich. Fries were cooked perfectly and the strawberry cream soda was heaven. I'd be a regular at this place if lived in Phoenix.

What a great place!
Looks like an old convenience store and a perfect place for a huge burger and fries!
The soda selection is unique and expansive.  I really wanted to try three or four kinds!
The ghost pepper chicken sandwich was Amazing and the Chicago dog was on point!
This is a great place to stop if you are looking for a fantastic burger!

I've wanted to try this place based on the Yelp reviews. Bad decision! I honestly had to think twice about going in this place. It's not well lit in the parking lot and there were, in my opinion, unsavory people hanging around outside asking for change.

So, against my better judgement, I went in and was a bit confused at the theme/decor. I thought it was a liquor at first glance but quickly realized it was an assortment of craft sodas. They even have two types of self serve soda stations. One, with the typical sodas (Cherry Pepsi, Tropicana lemonade, etc) and the other had craft soda flavors like Shirley Temple, Black Cherry  and a few others. I filled my cup with the Shirley Temple...yum.

When you go to order, there was an older guy standing/waiting at the counter to take your order. Don't expect any suggestions, even after advising it was my first time there and that the sandwich menu was "overwhelming ". It wasn't until I asked for a vegan option that he advised for an upcharge of $1, I could substitute a veggie pattie. I did. I ordered the California burger with the veggie pattie. It had Avocado, lettuce, tomato and something similar to a Comeback sauce which I got on the side.

$12+ later/lighter and I couldn't eat the fries because they were too hard, dry and old. The color tells me the grease should be changed. The burger  initially looked delicious, but I judged the book by its cover. The bun and lettuce was fresh, but the veggie pattie was dry and some parts were inedible. Long story short, I threw it all away. The best part of the meal was the craft soda .  My only regret is that I forgot to mention Yelp for a 10% discount.

Maybe if I ate beef I would have had a better experience, but that's no excuse for bad fries. It's sacrilege. Overpriced and disgusting! Buyer beware and take security.
Great cheesesteak, fries far better than average, craft soda, black cherry. I will return.

Another incredible experience at rocket burger. This is the ultimate dive spot! Food is amazing and like no other. Perfect comfort meal. It's a small quick place so you wouldn't expect the quality of food that comes out of here! I love the wall of the fun soda brands you can't find anywhere else. Always got to get me a sarsaparilla when I'm here! 

I love the philly cheese burger. Caramelized green peppers, onions with melted provolone cheese on top. My mouth is still watering!!  There fries are good too! They could be a little crisper but overall they still have a lot of flavor. We got a chilly cheese hot dog too that was very good. Good size hot dog. 

Highly recommend! Perfect place to take a friend, family, or even boyfriend/girlfriend for an amazing casual comforting meal.Thanks rockets! (:

Good burgers, but the folks at the office and I like the sandwiches better.  The burgers are not spectacular, but better than McDonald's.  The soda selection is worth the trip and a burger itself.  I'd go back when I'm the mood for a neat choice of burgers or a sandwich, but not for a fantastic burger, I'd go to Zinburger for that!

If you're looking for a good old fashioned  mom and pop burger joint Rocket's your place.  Cheap, delicious, fresh burgers and sammiches, crisp cut fries, friendly attentive service and a wall of assorted soda's that'll put any other in town to shame.  Rocket doesn't need to be flashy or have a big hook.  It's simple food done well.  If I lived a little closer this would be my default hangout.

I have been coming to this place regularly for over a year now and the quality remains outstanding with phenomenal customer service. They have a huge selection of bottled soda and offer discounts for checking in on facebook. Well worth your business and better by far than any of your franchise burger joints.
Great lunch place with lots of options for a great burger, sandwich, hot dogs...And every soda possible!!!

I love burgers there! I've only been there once because I don't live that close but I will definitely go there whenever I am in the neighborhood! I love burgers and if you love burgers then I bet that you will love this place. They really know how to make them!

Went here with my husband after craving a good burger and reading good reviews on yelp. We will certainly return! I ordered a cheeseburger which was prepared to order. The beef is never frozen, fresh angus beef. Cheeseburger is made with American cheese. I would have preferred cheddar which wasn't an option. Hubby got the Philly burger- an amazing burger to see piled high with meat and all the cheese steak fixings. I've read poor reviews about the fries- don't pass them up! Fries were perfectly cooked- crispy but not burnt with some softness in the middle. Seasoned to perfection. The owner took our order, he was very friendly and helpful. We bought 6 sodas (drank 1 each, took the rest home) out of amazement. The selection is like nothing I've ever seen. I think this place should be featured on a show like diners, drive ins and dives. The wall of sodas bottles for sale is enough to make a trip for, and the burgers are very tasty.  The sodas come from from every state, maker, flavor, etc you could ever imagine. Lots of nostalgic flavors and memories await you here. This would be a really fun place to go for fathers day or a birthday- a man cave for sure. Parking isn't great- its a hole in a wall place in a strip mall. Nothing fancy- just tasty, laid back. The perfect dive and tons of fun!!

LOVE the local joints. Actually found this place on Yelp and was glad that we did. Ordered the pastrami burger and let me tell you, there is absolutely no comparing that masterpiece with anything else. The burger was completely delicious. It literally punched me in the mouth with flavor. We also got their philly and wow. Every ingredient was proportionate and made every bite damn near heaven. This place knows what a good meal is and the portions are completely adequate. Fries are completely legit. I can't believe I never knew of this place back in my high school days. Would have been a regular for sure.

Great burgers with many different choices. Lots of different sodas to choose from. The staff is helpful, informed, and good at their jobs. Will definitely be going back. The garlic burger is the best as well as the burger with the pastrami.

I've been meaning to try this place forever.  It is just a little to far from my shop to go for lunch.  Recently I was driving down I17 and wanted a burger for lunch and remembered about this place and got off sooner than I normally would.  I got a cheeseburger combo with onion rings which came with a nice dipping sauce.  Pretty good burger.  Even with all those bottled sodas I just had the fountain drink that came with the combo.  It's fast casual, order at the counter and they bring it to you.

If you like avocado burgers, Cali burger is the way to go 5 out of 5. Pastrami lovers Eddie Lopez burger is for you 5 out of 5. The onion rings was good 4 out of 5, chili fries are the best chili fries I've taste since living in az 5 out of 5. Milk shake was great 5 out of 5

such a fantastic little place! the chicken tender bites are SO good. I love the craft soda choices as well. the staff were all very friendly. my boyfriend got the gyro burger and said it was great as well. the prices are affordable. we will definitely be back.

The name of the place is Rocket Burgers, yet somehow I got a sub. And let me tell you it was so dang delish!! It was the New Yorker loaded with Pastrami with homemade cole slaw swiss cheese and rocket burgers own sauce. OOOHHHH dang!! So delish!! I love a good pastrami sammie!  Their fries are delish as well.  But this place has over 300 different types of sodas, and even carries Dublin Dr Pepper, you might get a little over whelm on which soda to choose from but it's interesting to see the different types from all over. I settled on a frosty vanilla root beer and was not disappointed. Can't wait to come back and try out other sandwiches and burgers!

First time here and it was very tasty. The service was fast. There is no exaggeration on the soda options. There must be over 100 different craft options. Very unique flavors such as pumpkin apple and snoozberry. Burgers were great and the fries are fresh.
This place is cool... Great burgers and fizzy drinks game is fucken on point... Great for quick burger fix!

This place offers so many options! 
Walk in see a lot of sodas and interesting drinks to find in one place. The food is yummy. 
Owner is nice.

I'm never ordering a rocket burger again, was it bad?  No of course not, I got it with the intention of having half and saving the other half for later, instead I'm in a food coma because just couldn't stop pecking away. It literally took two hours to finish with fries on the side. Sure I could have had self control but just couldnt, was too good. Second time been there while visiting, will be back before leaving town. Fries are fresh cut as well, all around good stuff.

I was wary of trusting Yelp after the debacle of culinary excrement served to me at Wineburger, but Rocket Burger delivered the beefy goods. Great soda selection, friendly service, and the BURGER. Wow. I had the Baja Burger, and it packed an explosion of flavor. I made the mistake of getting a "Rocket" burger, which was too large for even me. After a while, I ditched the bun and went to town on the meaty goods. This is a place that knows how to season meat.

Rocket Burger, I shall return.

My wife and I were in the area and decided to give Rocket Burger a try. When we first walked in we were pleased with the large variety of bottled sodas they have. We ordered the Baja burger and a Philly cheesesteak with some cheese curds. It was absolutely delicious and we will definitely be back.
Best burger ever served on Cactus or in the northwest valley. Period . Great soda selection. Family friendly.

I can't believe I ate the whole burger! This place is a hidden gem. I have lived in the valley for over 15 years and have driven past this intersection many times. Recently a friend told me about the best hamburger he has ever had. I went to rocket burger not expecting anything but a regular hamburger. OMG was I wrong!! I had the chili burger and I could not believe how good it was. I will definitely be back. Thank you Rocket burger for this wonderful food!

absolutely loved the food....I got the ghost pepper burger and oh man....so good...forgot what my husband got....I think it was called "after burner" he loved it 

So many options for sodas it was amazing. Owner and staff are super friendly and will recommend things for you to try. 

I cant wait to go back and try something new....definitely worth it! 

Try the ginger/vanilla root beer....oooohh myyy goooddd! You wont regret it!

I absolutely love their crispy chicken salad! The chicken pieces are moist, delicious and flavorful.  The portion size is more than generous and it's just plain beautiful. If I can post a picture I will so you can see for yourself.
Amazing burgers, good fries, so many soda they even have mini corn dogs  a huge menu.  can always find something to eat.

Ok.. Yummmmmmmmmmm 

Positives:
Best cheese curds ever. Amazing seasoning on their fries and the California burger was bomb. Not our usual area of town but hubby wanted to check it out and I am so glad we did!  Anyone looking for a phenomenal burger you must give it a try. 

Negatives:
The location isn't great for me. 

I will be going back!

Stopped in for a late lunch on a work day.  Friendly place, they weren't busy so the service was pretty quick.  Had a burger combo, really enjoyed the fries.  Should have had a double on the burger though.  If I'm in the area I'll eat there but I don't think it's going to be one of my "usuals".

Love this place.  Definitely my go to burger and fries place when I'm in need of a 5 star meal.  Prices are super reasonable, service is friendly enough, and they have an array of sodas from which to choose.  I've tried maybe 5 different burgers/sandwiches, and they've all been amazing.  

Go out of your way to come here.

Checked this place out for lunch today looking for a hotdog. I got the chili cheese dog and cheese curds. Everything was mediocre at best. The curds are super greasy, more than could be enjoyed, and the chili wasn't the best. Maybe the burgers and sandwiches are better.
Excellent service, tasty burgers of all kinds, and best soda selection I've ever seen.

Solid food and service! I had the double NY burger, and the pastrami coleslaw combo was messy but delicious.  The fries aren't the best, but I'm looking forward to trying the other sides in the future.
Awesome burgers!!! I wish they would extend their hours a bit. Who closes up during late dinner rush times? Silly. Still worth making sure you get there early enough though because yuuuum.

I had the Chicago Burger. It was a nice,combination of cucumbers, jalapenos, and mustard. The fries were good and the onion rings we 're delicious. We 2njoyed browsing through their sodas. The atmosphere was casual. It was slightly cramped because we had a stroller. The staff was life and friendly. The best hamburger place we found in Phoenix, it was recommended by our family and they were right. It was great.

3 month update! I live right next to this place, so I have been coming in occasionally and have been consistently impressed by the service and the food.

The staff are usually friendly, quirky, and fun individuals. Food always comes out hot and fast. Sandwiches and burgers are good, onion rings are great, fries are pretty good too.

I'm not a soda person, but if I were, they have a massive collection of craft sodas and root beer.

Definitely recommend this place!

My daughter and I were heading to the Glendale drive-in and I felt like having a hamburger in the west valley so I looked on yelp and found this place. it is definitely unique with all their soda selections but I can't speak highly of the food nor can I speak negatively it's just a regular burger. the burger was fine but it was nothing that I would drive all the way from Eastvalley to the West Valley to have. The fries were good. One thing I did not appreciate about the place was the guy behind the wall who was cooking (manager or owner) was really micromanaging the people up front. I was just waiting there until they had a moment but he was like you need to help, you need help and he was just kind of rude to his employees. They were helping and he was just making a scene. that was a turnoff for me and I probably won't return because of that.

We ate here last week. A surprising gem! The burgers were very good. I had the gyro double. Too much food. But sooo good. The corn dogs were delicious as well. Definitely hand made. I also being able to pick some wild and crazy sodas. We will be back!

Oh my goodness, I have forgotten to review Rocket Burger?! I'm such a bad customer, because I love this place and feel everyone should try them out. I've had:

California Club
The New Yorker -yum!
BBQ pulled pork- even good straight out of the fridge next day with no warm up!
Regular burger
Some special burger they did on Memorial Day with the Rocket Relish- so good and spicy!
Fries
Cheese curds- never had these before, and I really like them now
Chili cheese fries
Brownie

So anyhow... I've been there a time or 6. Good food, great prices, friendly service. Definite go-to spot when I'm around the area

Yummy little dive in a strip mall. We got takeout from here- French dip sandwich, pastrami, and fried zucchini. It was yummy but wish the zucchini was cut in strips instead of rounds. They have every kind of soda you can think of so that's pretty cool as well.
Update: the suite next door has been opened by Rocket Burger as Pop The Soda Shop and they have an even larger selection of sodas now!
Great food and freash. Got the fish sandwich and it was huge. Could have used a sub roll instead of the bun and needed a few more condiments but other than that was good.

WOW!! Amazing food and great Customer service.. just brought my husband here, we just moved here and read such great reviews, he actually decided to go here instead if a big restaurant for hia fathers day lunch. WE ARE SO GLAD WE DID. It's a hidden gem, so delicious. I order the Mexican coleslaw fish sandwich and onion rings, my Hubby got the new New York burger with fried zucchini. And our son had the mini corn dogs.. everything was sooo good.. even down to the little mini  corn dog. The onion rings were so amazing and their ranch you can tell is homemade. My husband lived his New York pastrami, and the zucchini was fried to perfection. We will definitely be back to this spot. Don't let the outside fool u. It's hidden in a tiny little old shopping center.. but you will not be disappointed.

Try it, you'll love it. Good food and great selection of bottled soda (about $2.50 each). You can make any drink into a float by adding $1. The owner actually helps out & chatted with us a bit. It's always fun to learn the history & passion of how an eatery came to be. Try Ghost Cheese Pepper on your burger or sandwich. They also accommodate for those who are on a low carb diet & want to omit the bread, they replace it with extra lettuce or coleslaw.
holy crap, best burger alive!!  why have i not been to this place until today!!
Best burgers in Phoenix no question! Same with the slush puppy. The service is great we got our burgers (4) in less than 5 minutes! They have over 1000 types of bottled sodas. This place is amazing
One of the best burgers I've ever had (Philly cheesesteak burger). Add a pumpkin pie soda and BAM, awesome lunch!

I can't seem to figure out how this place has such good reviews when the restaurant is filthy dirty.  The walls and ceilings were so dirty along with the grease and mess by the soda machines...I will admit that the burgers are good - the Chicago burger looked super fresh and yummy but the cheese curds were crazy salty.  The soda selection is huge and was fun to look at, but there was literally some homeless guy shooting heroin in the bathroom and the dust and grease on the walls and ceilings is so super gross.  I guess if you're coming here, get the food to go!!

'There is no way we are going to finish all of this' 

This is what we told ourselves we stared at the sizable amount of food placed in front of us.  What possessed us to order two double cheeseburgers, fries AND onion rings?  We wanted them. That is why. 

I can see how easy it is to over-order at Rocket Burger. Everything looks good. Cheese fries with real cheese? Yes! Rocket (onion) Rings that magically and mysteriously aren't greasy? Yes! Tender, juicy burgers with lots o' cheese? Yes, Yes, Yes! 

Rocket Burger isn't fancy. It isn't a 'dress to impress' destination. In fact, it appears that maybe once upon a time it was a convenience store. Coolers line one wall containing a fascinating assortment of beverages, including one whole section dedicated to root beer, and one drink the owner admits tastes like 'tree'. Really, tree. If you can't find it here, it probably doesn't exist! 

The charm in Rocket Burger is that it isn't trying to be something it is not. In fact, you can see the whole open kitchen area behind the counter/cash register. It is simply good food, prepared and served by friendly owners and staff. 

Oh and yes, we ate it all. :)

One of the best burgers I've ever had. They pull out the fresh beef and throw in down on the flat top right in front of you. Everything is fresh, I ordered take out and they even cut a corner section out of my French fry "to go" container for it to air out on the way home and not be soggy! Genius! Everything about the place is authentic. So yummy. Can't wait to try other things on the menu.

I am grime El Paso, TX. I traveled to Phoenix for the weekend to visit my son. Looked up burger places and this business came up. Well gotta say it was better than what I thought! The New York burger was delicious and definitely coming back.  They also have a variety of sodas and pop to choose from. Great little business in AZ.

How can I be craving a Rocket Burger Reuben and I have only had 3 in my life? That is how delish this place is! Went there for carryout today. The owners are super nice, as usual. When I got home, mu food was piping hot and YUMMY! I hope everyone in the Northern Phx area begins frequenting this semi hidden gem. The food is excellent and affordable and the service is the best!
Some the best burgers i have had in a long time. The BLT was great lots of favor, very big had cut it in half.

Rocket Burger is totally out of this world!  This place blasted into my universe about a year ago and I have been coming in for frequent landings ever since.  Rocket has arguably the best burger in Universe! I bet the astronauts on all of those Apollo missions and up on the space station wish they had it this good.  

Steve and Denis, the owners, are both really nice guys. "Fresh is where it's at" at Rocket Burger and they have over 300 sodas in stock! But hey, don't take my word for it. Let's hear what the Steve and Denis have to say...

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3MqQQvX0Ock

Gotta love that commercial. I wish it played on local TV. 

I'm telling you this place is seriously really great. I always go with a bacon double cheeseburger, with pickles, onions, jalapenos, and man oh man that Rocket Sauce. I think I could drink it! Good thing I don't though. Check out my picture from this place. I mean seriously, how good does that look?!? I also recommend getting a side of their ranch for your fries. I know, I'm sounding like a total health nut right now, but bear with me. I think this place would be a perfect candidate for Diners, Drive Ins, & Dives.

It's T minus 10 and counting until I get in my car and blast off to Rocket Burger and Subs. I'm sure the burger and fries will have another great landing in my belly.

Get Your Rocket On!

This place was definitely worth the hype. Just the variety of vintage sodas they have is enough to warrant five stars from me. For a small fee they will make any soda you choose into a float. The food was great as well. I had a double Afterburn which had two patties, jalapeños, and horseradish sauce and an order of their cheese curds. I will definitely be back soon to try some of their other burgers and subs as well as the multitude of soda they have.
This little hole in the wall has delicious sandwiches! They have a huge collection of old school sodas and you can turn any one into a float.
Awesome place bring stretchy pants you're going to need them .., food is that good., an insane amount of sodas to choose my family loves this place

This place is awesome. The food is great and they have just about any soda you could want and the fries are killer. Im lucky that this place is so close to where I live that I can eat there just about anytime I want. I still cant decide what burger is better the Teriyaki Burger, Philly Burger, or the New York Burger. They are all so good.

Burgers are great.  My choice has always been a top notch burger.  My girlfriend's hasn't been so lucky.  The coleslaw is sometimes too runny and it left a pool at the bottom of her burger container.  The sauce is pretty thick, but I'm always a no sauce guy.  The place is cheap enough to try out burgers regularly though.  Can't wait to try one rocket style.

Great spot for a fantastic burger, sub or even hotdog!! Lots of bottled drinks to choose from. For a quick and easy lunch spot, this is our go to!!! 

Rocket sauce makes everything better!!!

I've actually visited Rocket Burger for several times already. One word that I can describe their service is it is CONSISTENTLY GOOD. I've tried other burger joints but they simply don't get it that when I say "well done", I mean "well done". 

Anyway, my fave is their Bacon Cheeseburger and their Philly Burger (hey, I'm a burger guy!). Meat is fresh and is cooked very well. The cheese properly melted making every bite a sumptuous rush. Will be back for more my friends!

It's ok.  Not really sure what the hype is all about.  Italian sub was mediocre with, what I feel, was way too thickly sliced meat.  The burger was ok.  The best part was soda fountain and customer service.  Everyone was very friendly.
Gave it a try because of the positive Yelp reviews. Glad I did!  Delish!!  We had the Italian Classic & a Ruben on rye with fries. It was all very tasty!  Tons of bottled soda to choose from!!

After reading yelp reviews of this place I decided to swing by and try it out. I got the California burger and it wasn't the best burger I've ever had, but it was pretty good. It was pretty neat seeing all the different sodas, I hadn't had a jones soda in so long so they get points for that. 

It was good enough that I'll be back to try them again eventually, just not anything to drive out of the way for anytime soon.

This is a cool little hidden cheeseburger shop. I got bacon cheeseburger l with fries. I got the double and, I could've honestly went without the fries. It was a lot of food. Fries were kind of dry for my personal liking, but I'm sure if you get some rocket sauce to go with them...they'd be lit. They had a ton of craft soda. They have craft soda bottled and in multiple fountain machine choices. Added an extra star just because if the price. My $11 dollar total meal would've been $16 anywhere else. 

I'll be back for sure. The young crew up front was able to answer all of my questions and refer things. A+ for customer service.
Awesome handcrafted Burgers . Bun was soft sweet and held until last bite . Burger was juicy and toppings fresh . Craft sodas and properly made homemade fries !

The owners and crew at Rocket are some of the hardest workers. The food is fresh not frozen and good. We always get a six pack of soda togo because they have so many unique kinds. The daily specials get us to make the drive down to visit them.

I had the pleasure of eating here 2 times so far.  They have a wide variety of yummy sandwiches, burgers and hot dogs! There is a nice park close by and could turn into an easy picnic. They also have a huge collection of different sodas from around the world.
I usually get the gyro but the bread I think is old due to the bread falls apart and they fries  have a bit  to be desired

This was place was delicious. Now, I won't say it was the best food I ever had or anything but it was delicious. I ordered the Philly cheesesteak with fried mushrooms. The cheesesteak was pretty damn tasty. It wasn't as stuffed as I've seen others but the flavor was definitely there. The mushrooms were also good. For the drink, I got a bottle of root beer from their refrigerators. Here's where rocket burger shines: their selection of sodas and drinks is ridiculous. One door is nothing but root beer. (And I love root beer) I got a salted Carmel one that was alright, but just the fact that I can choose from so many was nice. The looks? Well the place isn't fancy, so don't expect to be wowed by appearances. The place is a little pricey than fast food, so expect to spend 10 to 15 bucks when you go. I will definitely return.

Amazing burgers and sandwiches with hundreds of crazy soda choices . We tried the New York burger !!! Omg great !! We tried the California club !!omg great !! We had double cheeseburgers !! It was great ! The onion rings were excellent and fries good ! So many other burger combos I would love to try ! 100's of soda options from all over !! This place is fantastic !!

Rocket Burger is the best burger in Glendale. Maybe all of Phoenix. The burgers are delicious with their special, handmade sauce and the fries are the greasy, delicious fries everyone in America loves. I'm not big on sandwiches or hot dogs from anywhere so I'm not judging them on that, but the burgers are enough to give these guys 5 stars all on their own.

I think this may become one of my favorite places to come for a quick and delicious meal. From the outside of the building, it doesn't look as though it would offer anything that great, but this place is amazing! From the service to the food, everything was awesome. 

=Food=
This restaurant has a large variety of items on their menu from burgers, Rocket dogs, subs, sandwiches, mini corn dogs, salads, fries, onion rings, and so much more. I was interested in a spicy chicken sandwich, but they didn't offer anything close to what I was looking for so I got the Gyro combo meal which came with a side of fries and a drink and cost $7.29. A great price for the quality of food I received. The Gyro was stuffed full of tender meat that was well flavored and cooked to perfection. The sauce was good, but not as "authentic" tasting as I've had while I was in Europe. The side of fries was very generous and was well cooked. My guest got the Bacon Cheeseburger combo and upgraded his fries to chili cheese fries which cost $10 total. He said the Bacon Cheeseburger single was more than enough for him, so was thankful not to have gotten the double. The burger was nicely cooked and well flavored. The chili cheese fries were a whole serving and not the side size, so it was more than enough to feed two people. Fries were covered in lots of chili and cheese. They are more than generous with their portions and definitely don't hold back on toppings. Both combos came with a drink. 

=Service=
The girl Alexis that took our order was very friendly. She was very knowledgeable of the menu and gave suggestions when I asked about certain items that they may have or be able to add to my meal. She took our order and repeated it to us to make sure she had gotten our order correct. I do like that about a food place! We waited around 10 minutes for our food to come out as there were several large families ahead of us, but when our food came out, the server was very polite and asked if we needed anything extra like BBQ sauce or Ranch. Told us to let them know if they could help us out at any point during our meal. 

Everything here was awesome and I'll definitely be back again to try other items on their menu. The only complaint would be the parking situation. They don't have many parking spaces, so some people had to park over in the next restaurant's parking lot.

Over a year later and still great. Went in on a Sunday afternoon for a late lunch and got the California burger (sans tomatoes and pickles). The avocado was fresh, the bun wasn't dry, and their "secret" sauce was still perfectly peppery and went great with the avocado and cheese. It's also one of the only places to get a lot of the soda they have on offer and today I chose a vanilla root beer from Barrel Brothers.

It seems that they bought most of the mini-mall they're in so there's more parking and will soon be a lot more seating. Good for them!

The food is too greasy for me. But, I love stopping  by because of the huge selection of soda. This is the only place in the valley I know of where I can get Ale-8-One, reminds me of my time in the south living in Tennessee and Georgia. There are tons of different and hard to find drinks. This place also has real slush puppies.

An old classmate of mine, that comes here regularly, highly recommended this place.  It definitely doesn't disappoint.  I didn't try the burgers but the fish sandwich I ordered was great.  It was dressed with a pico de gallo slaw.  You won't go away hungry with this dish or any dish probably.  And, they have a throw back to classic sodas...that was cool.  It appears that they own/operate the Pop shop next door too; which houses even more soda...nice overall throw back feel.  The place has about 8-10 tables, so it can easily seat about 40 people.  I believe it's a family run place and they are all friendly.  I can parking will be an issue if the have a full house, just plan to going during less busy times and/or order to go. I will definitely be back whether dine in or take out... ;p

WOW.  
Trust me when I say This place is the only place to go for a burger!  If you like onion rings some of the best.  Let's not talk about their Fried Zucchini or their Ranch Dressing because they are just as good.  Oh and did I forget to say that everything is made from scratch.  Another place to put on your bucket list!

This place is REDIC!!!!
Love the food ate the afterburner burger.
Service was great lots of help and the food was on our table in minutes. Lots of choices would comeback again for sure.

Best teriyaki burger I've ever had! Great tasting fries and fried zucchini. A hole in the wall place, looks like it used to be a convenience store, but such a fun little eatery. Soda selection is unique,  we bought 4 different ones to try at home. The owner is a sweet Filipino lady and so fun to talk to! I support you, rocket burger. We will definitely be coming back!!!

Can't go wrong here. Burgers are great,subs,dogs and salads plus all the soda choices. My favorite is the NY burger,the pastrami and slaw make this burger really good. Today the slaw dog is still the special so I had it...again.big beef hot dog with slaw and pastrami,side of onion rings,which are also very good!

Yo. I've never stopped here before today, and now I'm kicking myself. The burgers are top notch, and they have a huge selection of bottled novelty sodas that are only $1.99 each. Finding my favorite soda from MI was a treat.

The cheese curds were pretty underwhelming, but the fries were solid. The burgers are served on a fluffy but substantial bun, and cooked perfectly. Service was prompt and friendly. We will definitely be back.
Always a fun time here! Food is great and cheap definitely come here if you live close and if you don't then make the drive!

This place is great. Everything is home made, hand breaded and cooked just for you. We had burgers and fries, cheese curds, chicken sandwich and chili fries. Everything was great. The owner was super friendly and said we should try the fish sandwich voted top 10 in Phx. The really great surprise when you get there is allll the soda selections. Gourmet sodas and craft fountain sodas. Yum.

Price is decent, I do feel like the place is way over hyped. The burgers are good but not good enough to travel all the way to chandler from West Phoenix. 
The pace is small which makes it a bit awkward, because when one gets up, lot of people stare... 

My conclusion was that people love coming here because they have a great selection of sodas, from cream sodas to citrus sodas. Sodas from all over the country.
They have a really expansive burger menu but are way too expensive for what you get. The quality is lacking and next time I'll go to in and out. I really wanted to like this place too

Salad at a burger place usually a disappointment but not here. Their Greek salad is to die for. It is loaded and I mean loaded with tons of goodies like larger slices carrots, shredded purple cabbage huge radishes, bell peppers, onions olives galore and. Wet fresh crisp lettuce. I will recommend this salad to all my friends and family. I am a Vegan and so happy I found a yummy salad worth every penny.

Rocket Subs & More opened about three weeks ago. It's hidden away in the Church's Chicken plaza at 35th avenue and Cactus. The boy and I were on our way to another sub shop today when we drove by this sub place, we made a quick executive decision to go here instead and pulled in.

Walking in, there's the counter to order on your right, seating to the left, and cases of sodas and beverages along the back wall, with shelving for chips, corn nuts, etc. After some brief decision making, we decided to order a Rocket Dog combo meal (easy on the mustard and ketchup, with onions), and a Country Club sub, toasted.

Combo meals here are awesome, you get chips or fries and a drink from their first case (cans of your everyday soda brands), for a dollar more, you can select a soda or drink from one of the other cases - and that is where the fun begins. They had TONS of different brands and flavors of sodas to choose from. I chose a Mason's root beer in a super cute glass bottle, and the boy chose Pepsi (boo - boring choice!).

It took less than 5 minutes for our food to be brought out to us. The sub? Amazingly toasted goodness - eat your heart out, Quizno's! My hot dog and fries were also awesome. The fries were well seasoned and crunchy, the hot dog made perfectly to order. :)

The owner swung by our table and asked how everything was (awesome, thanks!) and he also shared that starting next week they will be serving hamburgers and cheeseburgers.

Overall, the food was awesome, the selection of drinks was great, and we will be back for more.

Last, but certainly not least - the price? Great! For two sodas, a huge sub, a hot dog, and a giant side of fries it came to $11.00! :) 

Before leaving we also took some sodas for the road (Captain Eli's Ginger Beer, anyone?)

The burgers here are OK. Went in with extremely high expectations (I have those with any restaurant that is rated 4 1/2 stars) and I was disappointed by the very salty, greasy, and overly sauced burger/fries. I couldn't even finish my food. I get why soda fanatics love the variety, but the food is not the kind that has me coming back by any means. Although, I do have to say the cheese curds and customer service are great.

Love this place! Was so excited to see this pop up in the East Valley after years of making the trek to the west side. Friendly staff, amazing burgers, and an iconic wall of glass soda bottles. Try the California burger and the craft soda ginger beer!

I had the "Afterburner"... It was really fresh and really good. I wasn't real crazy about the horse radish on it, but that's just me. The chicken was awesome. My daughters had the Gyro burger. I sniped a taste, it was exceptionally good. They have an absurd variety of sodas... including Jones and Jolt -two of my childhood favorites. My bill with those three combos was a little over $27. I don't ever give 5 stars so this was as good as it gets. 4 stars.

It's hard to not give this a five and I may just end up doing so just to frustrate people that hate seeing perfect scores: Seriously I was skeptical but after what seems like a streak of  3 star reviews I finally have something good to report on the end of the food chain I can speak to:) 

Is it the best chili cheese dog I've had? No.The best  chilli-cheese fries? No.Most extensive selection of sodas? Again no but truly this place adds up to more than the sum of its parts.It has nearly the best of all three  in one friendly, clean place that I'm looking forward to returning to. 

Their Chili-cheese dog takes Sonic's to school and steals its lunch money. The texture of  fine ground meat  / amount makes it easy enough to eat and theirs actually has flavor in the chilli, you know  unlike every chain that tries to sell you the same thing. 

When added to cheese and the  fries it was really great  though my preference is for fatter fries this was a great portion for the money.  

Wife's  bare lettuce and meat burger was tasty with maybe a slightly enthusiastic shake of the seasonings  but to be fair if it was a fully dressed burger I bet it would be hard to tell.

Kid's Cheese burger ,oh yes, very very good and hopefully he appreciates now why we keep him away from that clown. 
  
Really the choice is great, the soda's great,  friendly people that ask, and really seem to care, if you liked the food give this a 4.5   rounded to five.

I for one, fail to see the allure of this place.  The reviews way oversell the food.  The fries are over cooked, the grilled onions that were on my sandwich were awful.  The onions tasted like they were accompanied by the scrapings off the grill.  I wouldn't send people here and the only reason I would consider returning is to try one of their speciality burgers that don't involve onions.  Yuck.

They do have ALOT of sodas to choose from to wash down the grill garbage.
Love love love this place. The fries are awesome and the people are sweeeet! Try the double gyro burger. Dare you to finish it in one sitting.
I would say this is just an average burger place.  They do have lots of delicious soda to choose from but just an okay burger joint!

Wowza!  This place is AMAZING!  Thanks to Paul V. I was able to try Rocket Burger many times and every time has been fantastic.  I had the Bacon double cheeseburger  with fries or cheese curds and it's so delicious.  The burger is greasy, cheesy, and has lots of bacon.  Ya can't go wrong!  The french fries are also good, especially the cheese fries.   
Paul has ordered take out from here for me quite often as well.  The cheese curds get a bit mushy if not eaten right away so go with french fries if you have take out.  

Whether you eat in or get take out the food is awesome!

Rocket Burger's restaurant setup is far from trendy, especially in comparison to all of the other burger places that keep popping up all over the city. But don't let this fool you. Rocket Burger offers an above average burger, including some unique creations that might be somewhat intimidating to try at first.  

Everything I've tried has been good, but not quite as alarmingly great as some people describe. Additionally, both their regular seasoned and cheese fries are also worth trying when paying a visit.

The cool thing about Rocket Burger is their massive variety of sodas! They carry many of my favorite brands, including Boylan and Jones, as well as many obscure flavors that you probably won't find anywhere else in Phoenix.

Very cool place that I recommend trying!

Oooooh...

I was a little apprehensive about Rocket. Their vegetarian selection did not look promising. No veggie burger? What?!

We ordered the mushrooms and zucchini to start. Oh-em-geeee! These were home made morsels of joy with a mouthwatering, well seasoned batter. 

I ordered a veggie sub and everyone else ordered a burger. The burgers were raved about with every bite. My veggie sub on the other hand? Just so-so. The bread was really good and the quality and variety of veggies was good. Something just didn't work though... I think it didn't have enough mustard/ mayo/ sauce/ dressing. It needed something. And more cheese probably.

We also had fries and cheese curds on the side. Fries were fresh, not frozen. Yay! Cheese curds were tasty.

Soda wall was a bit insane. I'm not a soda person. I was getting a toothache just looking at this wall. I would prefer a beer wall...
Stumbled across the lil gem. Classic sodas, great burgers and the best fried mushrooms. Good for pickup or dining in. I got Philly Cheese steak and chili fries.

First time here today. As awesome as I had hoped! Total hole in the wall place in phoenix, but definitely worth the drive if you aren't close. Lots and lots of burgers and subs to choose from.
I had a double new york burger, and it was everything I wanted it to be. Greasy, meaty, cheesy. Root beer and fries? Yes please. Plus a six pack of assorted premium not-from-this-world sodas to take home.
I miss pop the soda shop, as it was so close to where I lived. Same sodas here for the most part, plus...burgers. It's a bit of a drive, but worth it. 

I'll be back. GET IN DA ROCKET BURGER YEEAARRRGGGHHH!!!
Give me your clothes, your boots, and your rocket sauce. 

I'm gonna go watch T2 and enjoy my dogs and suds root beer now.

I was in the area and starving.  Read the reviews and this place was spot on.  It's got that soda shop feel with classic big burgers.   I went with the bacon one and it did not disappoint.  It's off the roadway but worth the stop.  Friendly staff!
Best BURGERS and sides on three planet! All scratch made at a great price! Get a soda float AWESOME!
Low prices and great food. Fast service.... definitely one of my favorite places! AMAZING selection of indie sodas!

I was craving a Chicago dog and my husband wanted a burger. Found this gem!!! My husband loved the California burger and I loved their Chicago dog. They even toast your buns!!!! The owner was super nice too, can't wait to go back and try more! Draft sodas were a nice touch.

This place is awesome looks like a liquor store when u come in but it has tables n a lot of different bottled sodas n pops.! The menu is great so much to choose from, my meal was great i got the philly cheese steak with onion rings n my kids got the chicken bites kids meal n cheese curds are yuuummmm.! Imma come bak to trybthe rest of the menu specially the gyro burger ohh holly molly it looked great.

This place is outstanding!! Burgers are fantastic, huge boutique soda selection, soft serve ice cream with owners that are friendly and happy to provide great service and food!! I will be back as often as I can!

Wow wow wow!! This place is amazing!! I was out on this side of town and always like to try new places and found this on Google maps and thought I'd give it a try and so glad I did!! Ordered a double garlic melt and it was fricking delicious!! They have so many different choices.. Chicago burger, California burger, chili and the list goes on!! can't wait to go again!! I took my order to go and my box of fries had even been vented to allow the steam not to sog up the fries which yes they are awesome too!! The people working there are so very nice and it was just such a great experience all around!! Remember this is not just a burger joint they offer sandwiches and salads I saw on the menu board too!! Yep worth the trip to eat here!!

The only good thing about this place the service. The people were very kind! This place has decent portions, but the food was not tasty. That's why I rated them so low. Their fries were the best thing there, but even those were way too greasy. The spread on their burgers tasted awful like coleslaw - like if they were trying to copy the In-N-Out spread. Epic fail! My visit here was not very pleasant either seeing as how they weren't very cleanly and the floors were very slippery. They were out of cheese curds, straws and Dr. Pepper - The only soda I will drink. Supposedly they're known for having "the biggest soda selection in Phoenix." Don't make me laugh. The setup is very outdated too, and not in a cute way. It's cold and hard with bright lights - very sad in there.

My reasoning for checking out Rocket Burger is kind of weird but I'm glad it got me through the door.  One of my friends from Ohio always talks about Faygo soda and when I saw that in one of the pictures for Rocket Burger I knew I had to go for that and then after seeing all the great reviews I was excited about the food too.

Had a little trouble trying to find it at first so for everyone trying to find it for the first time, it's on the South West corner of Cactus and 35th Ave.  You probably won't see it from the street but there's a Church's Chicken right in front of it so just pull into that parking lot and Rocket Burger is right behind it.

I got the Single Bacon Cheeseburger with fries and a Faygo soda (of course!).  The guy at the counter was nice and polite but not overly friendly.  The food came out very quickly, probably under 5 minutes and it was nice and hot.  The burger was good, they really stack it with the toppings too and you can tell they're quality.  No soggy veggies and limp bacon here.  I loved the fries too!  They're shoestring and they're coated with some kind of seasoning salt that gives them a great flavor.  So glad that my quest for soda helped me discover a great burger place too!
I love this place! They have amazing food with a HUGE selection of bottled sodas. I have not yet had anything that I didn't like. Awesome burgers and subs!

I have eaten here 2 times  and both times the burgers were great.  I tryed the cali burger and the eddie lopez burger both were great.  The fryed zucchini and mushrooms are very good.  The food  is fresh and priced  right, service is perfect.i called and food was ready for pickup when i  got there.   If you want a good burger. This is the place to go.

Went to Rocket Burger tonight and Jesse ( not sure if that's his correct spelling) but the last few times we were in he waited in us and he's always very friendly and really knows the menu well! Great place, great food, you never have to wait long for your food to arrive! The only thing is the hamburger buns do tend to fall apart while your eating, but otherwise you won't be disappointed stopping in here to eat!

Burger was good, but the size of the bun is a bit to much for a single. The fries were very tasty, seasoned to perfection. Great selection of Soda's and a good variety of items on the menu. Seating was a bit limited. Overall a cool little place to have a quick bite.

We came here during my Winter Break and this place looks creepy from the outside, but once you are inside it's like "WOW"  they have so many types of soda like 300's from all over the world.  That was my boyfriends favorite part, who knows how many he drank. LOL.  We ordered burgers and we were very satisfied, can't wait to go again!
Awesome Burger joint. The best soda varieties in town!!! All the employees were fast and efficient.

I will travel for a delicious burger. So why the eff did I not know about this place that I can effing walk to? Seriously?! First thing, when you walk in, you're overwhelmed by all of the yummy soda. I mean there is stuff here that your parents grew up with. Jolt cola? Yummo! Espresso cola? Why yes please, butterscotch root beer? Omg yum. And here's a fun fact, you can make ANY OF THEM  a float! Sold! Next thing is the burgers. The bun is effing delicious. So not only is this burger giant, but the bun will not fall apart. I'm not sure if they are made in house, but who cares! Lastly the fries. Oh god. Fresh potato fries that are cooked to perfection. This is a great place to have a cheat meal, plus they are very quick with the cooking and delivery to your table. This place is a KEEPER!

Came with my kids and they digged the burgers they got, not so much the fries. I got the chili burger and zucchini fries and it was real good! Atmosphere is fun with the soda bottles for sale in the area, its a small establishment you'll miss it driving by. We'll be back for sure to try a new burger off their menu!!
Super nice people. We order three kids cheeseburger meals, two doubles cheeseburgers? meals, a Santa Fe meal and cheese curds. Great price!
Greasy burgers, but they are so good. Reminds me of Bob's Burgers a bit. If you're a fan of soda, hit this place up -- they honestly have about 100 different choices of soda!

Skip the In n Out down the street and come here instead. Seriously. Top quality burgers that you actually want and leave you satisfied. Philly is ALWAYS the go to. Even though it's not a "true" cheesesteak, the flavors are still there, and is amazing in its own right. Excellent soda selections with some unique and bizarre flavors. Haven't found a better place to get burgers. Mini corn dogs are also a great option. 

In all honesty, this place is so good my girlfriend and I splurged and binged WAAAAY too hard and came here 4 days in a row to try different things . Would not recommend doing what we did unless you're ready to run your ass off afterwards.

Prologue:
I discovered this restaurant recently while surfing around on Yelp and bookmarked it after reading a couple of 5-star reviews.
My girlfriend and I were in the mood for a good burger this afternoon so we decided to give it a try.

The Plot:
We shared a single Chicago Burger, a single New York Burger, and an order of Chili Fries.

The Scene:
The portion sizes were good and plenty for the two of us.
Okay, so topping a burger with bright green relish, pickle, and cucumber and then calling it a Chicago Burger seems pretty obvious.
The same goes for topping a burger with pastrami and coleslaw and then calling it a New York Burger.
However, what makes the real difference is how it's done and in this case both were done quite well.
The specialty ingredients nicely complimented the beef in both cases while still being reminiscent of their cities of origin.
The burgers themselves were tasty, juicy, and properly cooked on the flat top.
The other ingredients were also of good quality and properly prepared.
My girlfriend especially liked the balance of sweet and savory in the New York Burger.
We also liked the fact that the seasoned Chili Fries stood up well enough on their own and didn't need to be covered in cheese in order to taste good.

The Rest of the Story:
My girlfriend thought there was a bit too much mustard on the Chicago Burger and I had to agree that it somewhat overpowered the other flavors.
It also occurred to me that a split kosher hotdog cooked on the flat top would have been a nice addition to the Chicago Burger as the pastrami was for the New York Burger.

Epilogue:
Prompt, courteous service, reasonable prices.
We were both very satisfied with our meal.
My girlfriend, who is more discriminating that I am when it comes to burgers, remarked a couple of times that she thought the burgers were good and we'll quite likely return the next time she's in the mood for some.

Photo design by Billie Z.
Went there last week.  Hamburger tasted like it had a gallon of stale grease on it. Won't be back.
Striking this one off our list of burger joints, unfortunately.  Soda selection is the best thing about the place, so we'll head down when we feel like trying a new soda flavor.

Honestly best all around burger joint in central / N phoenix. Menu is stacked with amazing burgers and selections great dynamics to have for building such a juicy burger. they craft in house soda with cane sugar, fries are amazing, bottle soda selection is amazing. make sure to check into the specials on hand also, props to Rocket Burger keep it up!

This place rocks and is so affordable. They have the best sandwiches in town and the Gyro is sooo good. You can get one of their delicious sandwiches for less than $5. Unbelievable!! and all of those soda choices!!!!!!!! I wish you were closer to my house because I would go there all the time!!

One word comes to mind..... YUM!  Everyone is ranting and raving about the burgers (which are  scrumptious), but you need to try the subs here too!!!

The subs here are amazing!  They are a great price and you get a lot of sub for your buck.  The meat, bacon, cheese, lettuce, tomatoes, avocado, etc are stuffed into delicious whole wheat bread (they have other types of bread too) and the toppings practically over flow out of the sandwich.  This place is great because they have different types of food to please almost any one and it is all delish.  They have a good selection including burgers, subs, mini corn dogs, salads, gyros, fries, onion rings, etc etc that are all custom made to order.  The burgers are great and I tried the "moo-yorker" on a whim which was delicious.  The fries are fresh cut on site and the kitchen is open.  They also have a HUGE soda collection that has many different types of specialty sodas from all over the place. 

I have gone to this restaurant many times and the atmosphere is laid back, casual, and down to the basics.  Good place to go if you have kids.  However, it is a smaller restaurant with limited seating. Also, if you are trying to impress a pretentious date this is probably not the spot for you. The people that work here are all very friendly, helpful, and has a family owner-ship vibe.  

Basically.....  This restaurant has yummy food and great prices.  I definitely recommend that you stop by if your in the area!

Came here yesterday because I was craving a burger. This is definitely a no frills type of place.  8 or so tables with order at the counter service (they'll bring your food to the table when it's ready). Settled on the Cali burger and a vanilla milkshake.  While I waited, I browsed what seemed to be an infinite number of bottled soda selections.  They were categorized by what appeared to be flavor so you can hone in on what you're in the mood for.  Both of the girls working the counter were extremely pleasant.  My food (to go) took about 7 minutes from the time I ordered it.  Total for the burger(single patty, no fries) and milkshake was about $9.50.  Got home and tore that burger apart.  Man, that was good.  I liked the Rocket Sauce that came on the burger.  Think a ketchup/mayo blend with a ton of pepper for kick.  I didn't even need to put ketchup on the burger.  The bacon was crisp (score!) and the avocado perfectly ripe. The buns they use are also on point.  Definitely more "sturdy" than a traditional bun (it reminded me of challah bread).  
I saw a couple other burgers I'd like to try so I'll definitely come back and bring some friends along.

this place is truly one of a kind. the guy who has worked here for a long time (the owner?) is pretty introverted, but a reply good guy. I don't think he means to be rude, he's just an awesome quiet guy. the food is always on point and the soda is always cold. the only thing that would make it better is a bigger spot for this place to really grow. another thing that I wouldn't mind is bigger patties on the burgers. the double patty is a must here.
Here for the second time... looking forward to tasting the chicken teriyaki sandwich. The Cali burger is on point!
This is an awesome place! We would come here again. The burgers and sandwiches are huge! The soda is awesome!

If you are tired of the usual place or chain restaurant you MUST TRY the DELICIOUS food here!!  Combo is a great deal! Soda fountain is not your standard fountain adding that extra flair to the overall experience.  

I had the California Chicken Sandwich with a side of Mushrooms while my husband had one of the burgers with what very well could be the best cheese curds outside of Wisconsin!!  No joke!

It's small but they serve a might meal for a great price. Make this stop a "usual"!!!  Owner is from Delaware and very friendly too!

Best chicken sandwich I have ever had! They have ghost pepper cheese and cheese curds! Great old fashioned soda choices and the owner is very nice. It is in the plaza of safelite so kind of hard to see but definitely worth it! Lots of variety for all different kinds of taste buds!

Third time in today. This mini-mart converted into hamburger making awesomeness does not disappoint. Onion rings with panko breading, yes please! Hamburger with rocket sauce, heck yah! Cheese curds, any flavor of soda you would ever want and then some....must stop drooling. 
I need to go here more often, the service is great. The owner is always there, he treats you like a person. 
My 5 year old ate the WHOLE burger tonight, this was after doing some sort of moon dance because I mentioned we were going to Rocket Burger. Burgerlishious!

Well thanks to Yelp I found another local hidden gem. Specifically in the west side! I had no idea about this place but was in the area and was hungry and wanted something that wasn't a chain. Well Rocket was just the answer. Located in a small run down strip mall I wouldn't have expected such a good place. I was on the run so I ordered the open faced  Big Dipper to go. I really liked how even though it was to go they included a large Cup of an jus to dip my sandwich in. After the sub I was very satisfied. 

As mentioned in other reviews they have a large selection of sodas to drink for sale. I really wasn't in the mood for a soda or I would have tried one. 

I'd like to come back to try more sandwiches and a burger. I was impressed with the friendliness of the staff and value and quality of my sandwich. I'm so glad for Yelp for introducing me Rockets, I will make my way back here sometime soon!

Can I get a "god damn" for the best New Yorker in town.  I think its the cold slaw that has a sweet flavoring that matches well with everything.  If you haven't tried the New Yorker....get it done already, if you haven't tried Rocket Burger.....then you are neglecting yourself.  It's great food at super great prices!

Their teriyaki pineapple chicken sandwich is AMAZING. And their fries are very good as well. Perfect flavors! I have been in Phoenix for work for about a week and have eaten here three times so far! If I lived here I would eat here a ton! And their drink selection is also extensive..I tried some old styled root beers and cream sodas!

Wednesday night, nearing end of semester, crazy busy at work--what's a momma to do for dinner? Rocket Burgers for the win! 

Super friendly staff. Basketball on TV. Not the big corporate soda fountain choices. Kids are excited to eat--bonus!! 3 cheeseburgers and one ketchup only burger ordered. Chili cheese fries order is HUGE ("could have gotten this as a meal").  4 kids who eat adult sized foods so our bill is usually between $30-40. Our total tonight, $42. 

Best part? Kids who ate without complaining. All of them--at the same time. Well, at least for 3 minutes. A new record. 

I concur with the seating issue but whatev. I have a car where I've been known to eat. A lot. Especially with these guys. 

Could only be made better if they made milkshakes.  Go. Now. Get your fix.

I'm shocked by the reviews. All of the good reviews are what led us to this place. Was so excited to try it out. Akward (not very friendly) people at register, the place was filthy, the food was not great at all and we tried several items on the menu (about 5 different things). The fries were very greasy and mushy. The food was nothing to rave about. And the bathroom was disgusting. After seeing the bathroom, I really regretted stepping foot in there and eating! Not sure what the hype is about. Will not go back.

This place is awesome. 

I wish I lived closer... actually I take that back, if I lived closer I'd gain 50 pounds because I would be here every other day. 

The claim to fame at Rocket Burger & Subs, I would say, isn't the Burgers or the Subs... It's the assortment of soda. That rhymed. See how I did that? Assortment of Sodas. Sorry, I'm easily distracted. 

Anyhow, there are so many sodas. I had heard about this soda assortment. There I go rhyming again like P-Diddy. But I don't think you can really appreciate it until you see it. 

Being a craft beer fan, I first tried a root beer made by Abita, a brewer based out of Louisiana. I don't even consider myself a liker of root beer but it was a solid choice. 

As far as food, I got a chili dog which was good, but didn't knock my socks off because I was wearing sandals. Flip flops, I think... because I'm classy. 

I did however really like the fried mushrooms. So good. The breading tastes like they surely make it in house. Being from the south originally it reminded me of the breading used on really good fried green tomatoes. So what am I saying here? I'm saying I would like the owner of RBS to consider making fried green tomatoes. But if they don't, it's fine because they also have a fried zucchini that is fantastic. 

I couldn't get get through the meal with out a second soda so I got a Swamp Pop Cola, another Louisiana drink. I didn't plan the Louisiana soda theme, but it worked out because it was pretty good as well.

Will I be back to Rocket Burgers and Subs? Yep! As many times as possible. 

Will I put on at least 10 pounds due to these visits? Yep! Don't judge me...

The New Yorker is made with the juiciest and most flavorful pastrami I have ever tasted! I really value the fact that the meat doesn't taste like it's been simmering in a steam-table all day. The variety of rare bottled drinks is a really cool way to enjoy a refreshing beverage with your meal. I will definitely be back when I'm in the area.

The best burger spot in town! So glad I found this gem not far from my house.  The garlic melt burger on sourdough with added avocado and ghost pepper cheese was serious food porn! Been back 3 times in the first week. Staff are very nice as well!
Always friendly and great food with hundreds of soda choices. Try the Gyro burger and the cheese curds!

Great food at reasonable prices. What more could you want? Oh, you want lots of choices in sodas? They have you covered. Craft sodas on tap, three coolers full of bottles of sodas - many of them I'd never heard of before, and shelves more of sodas waiting to be chilled. It's soda heaven.

Go. Go now.

Firstly...really friendly staff.  The guy at the counter was patient and helpful.  We ordered easily, and the food came out quickly.

Secondly...both our burgers (I got a regular hamburger and hubby got the Santa Fe burger) were drenched in their "Rocket Sauce".  My burger was literally falling apart, and I couldn't even taste if I had a patty in there, or not.  It was dripping so much in my basket, I wouldn't have been able to put it down, to taste anything else.  The sauce has a very pickley flavor to it, which neither of us are fans of--we always ask for no pickles on any sandwich.  Hubby couldn't taste his green chile, which is the main reason he got that burger.

Thirdly...I got the fries as a side, and they were the best part of our meal.  Hubby ended up sharing them with me, which I didn't mind, since they do give you a lot.  They're thinly cut and somewhat crispy, but they were all gone at the end of our meal.  As a side, hubby got the fried zucchini.  They were okay, and you could tell they were made there and not frozen.  The only problem was, they were cut way too thick, and the breading was falling off.  We didn't even finish them.

Lastly...the walls of sodas was really impressive.  Hubby got an orange soda by Faygo (we'd seen someone mention it on "Check Please, Arizona!").  He downed it quickly.  I'm not a soda-drinker, so I got a bottled water...sorry, not too exciting.  But, it was fun to look at the different brands they had.

Chances are, we won't be going back...we were a little disappointed.

My family has been searching for a good burger place in chandler for years and I think we finally found one! I had the California burger , it was amazing! The fries are perfectly cooked , not too soggy or too hard! My husband had the bacon burger and loved it! My kids even said "this is my new favorite mom" which is a huge compliment they have a huge variety of soda. Many I've never seen or heard of which I like! Hope this restaurant lasts a longgggg time!
The best burgers so far! Fresh, not salty. Cool place and super friendly peeps. We loved it and my boys are very selective and I'm done searching finally. It took 7 years.

I'm on the fence with this one.  The  burger was so huge with pounds of cheese and onions that I couldn't even enjoy the meal.  The big draw is the hundreds of soda bottles to purchase. I didn't care for my Cola. I'll probably return one day to try again.

Got the Mexiburger. Freaking delicious. Bacon. Guacamole. Who knows what other amazingness they put in there. It was perfect. The only reason they don't get five stars is cause they didn't have coke products. C'moooooooon.

Fly me to the moon on a rocket because these rocket burgers are out of this world! (Just kidding don't really do that, I'm afraid of heights.)

It wasn't too busy on a Friday night when we came in, which allowed us to browse through the menu leisurely. There is an extensive selection of burgers in single, double, or rocket size (3 patties on a sub roll. Wow!) and an equally impressive selection of sodas to choose from. The sodas in the cases are sorted out very nicely by flavor, and I love that they offer craft sodas at the fountain (Batch brand). 

I decided on a cheeseburger with avocado and tried some of the Reuburger. For sides we had the "pick two" option of fried zucchini and onion rings. The meals came out swiftly and we were on our way to satisfy our growling stomachs!

The cheeseburger was served on a buttered, toasted bun with onions, pickles, lettuce and tomato. I loved the crisp, fresh vegetables with the buttery lightly toasted bun and melted cheese. It was hard to discern a lot of burger/meat flavor with a single patty though so I will have to order this as a double for next time. Note that all patties are served well done. The Reuburger was a combination of Reuben and burger, served with sauerkraut and pastrami. I loved the mix of ground beef with pastrami in conjunction with the sauerkraut. 

The sides were crispy and piping hot from the fryer. The vegetables were tender on the inside and I loved the addition of cornmeal as an added crunch to the batter.

Service was great. Our cashier was friendly and the owner stopped by to make sure we were enjoying our meals.

Overall 4.5/5. This is a excellent place to get a burger! 

P.S. Where else are you going to find Snozzberry soda on tap to go with your tasty burger and sides?
Best burgers in Town period. Fried green chili burger is the bomb. If you check in at yelp. 10% off combo

I really liked this place! Fried cheese curds, burgers, and a giant fridge with hundreds of sodas of all brands and flavors. I will go back!
* update: There are some new tech upgrades that make an option for ordering online and receiving receipts via text, email, etc. Very convenient! I just ordered online drove over and picked up my hot food that was ready to go!

I went to Rocket Burger this afternoon and got the single Ghost Burger. If you like something with a little kick this is the burger for you! The chipotle mayo, along with the Ghost cheese will have you feeling a little heat. The fries were delicious. I got a raspberry soda and wish I would have chosen a different one -- it was just weird tasting. The restaurant looks like a hole in the wall but was very clean with great staff.

Tried Rocket Burger for the first time at lunch yesterday and had to come back again tonight. The Afterburner Burger was amazing. Going for the Eddie Lopez tonight.
