The fries are perfectly crispy with a hint of seasoned salt, just right. I really enjoy the selection of bottled craft sodas from all over the country - even the fountain sodas aren't your typical big brands - a nice change of pace. 

The Eddie Lopez did not disappoint! I was told that it was voted best burger in the valley last year and I can see why. Very flavorful and drippingly juicy! 

I'll be back to try them all!
Wow! Great food and hundreds of pop choices too.  I had gyros and a unique root beer.  I highly recommend it!

I honestly don't know where to start with Rocket Burger. I came here for lunch one day after a friend recommended it. The first thing I noticed was the huge selection of specialty sodas to pick from. Then, I saw the menu and was pleasantly surprised at the plages selection of burgers and subs to choose from. After 5 minutes of trying to decide, I ended up going with the Bacon Cheeseburger (not very adventurous on my part, I know...) and a side of Cheese Curds. 

Wow! I can honestly say that it was one of the best burgers I've ever had. I'm not exactly sure why, but it might have something to do with the Rocket Sauce that they put on it. Bottom line, it was fantastic!

It's a cool little restaurant with awesome food. I can't wait to go back and try something new. I'm definitely a fan!!
This is an absolute dive but it is so incredibly worth it. The food is so good and the people are so kind and accommodating.

Great place to grab a burger in the East Valley. They use a better bun than normal fast food places like In-n-Out and Culver's. The burger patties are well seasoned, but pretty thin. I recommend getting the double because it's a much better value. The Santa Fe burger is probably my favorite. 

4 stars because the patties are cooked to medium well, but I prefer when burgers are still pink inside. Decent fries and a huge selection of craft sodas to pair with your meal.

You walk in and are greeted by a selection of over 300 bootled sodas (they also have a fountain with pepsi products and SLUSH PUPPIES!) I got the California burger rocket style which comes with three patties on a 12 inch sub roll.  It was fantastic! Plenty of bacon and cheese and they definitely didn't skimp on the avocado!  The bread was freshly baked and fluffy. I also ordered onion rings.  Perfect amount of cornmeal breading, very crispy and not greasy at all. While they specialize in burgers they also serve salads, subs, gyros etc. Great place to stop in for a quick bite. You'll also receivea discount if you check in on YELP :-)
This is one of the best places for Philly style cheesesteak in the Phoenix area! The fries are also awesome as well as the humongous choices of unique bottled soda pop!

So thankful to find this local gem. Is the dining area a little small? Yep. Nothing fancy here (and it sits to the side of a Church's chicken, not a Canes - and I've never had any issue with ample parking). That said, I don't come here for the ambiance, I come here for the food! 

Their service is second only to their burgers, and while the burger patty itself is nothing special, the combinations of toppings and styles they offer are nothing short of spectacular for the price. Also, if you're a fan of fried zucchini - this is *the* place. The amount of food you get is more than satisfactory and man does it taste good!!

It's small, but it's clean. It's super friendly, reasonably priced, and ... well... it's wonderful! It would be hard to go wrong in here, highly recommended!
was a little disappointed the second time around. I had the gyro burger this time and it wasn't really that great. Still impressed with the soda selection tho. The onion rings were quite well done.
I love this place, i go here for lunch all the time!!! There prices are super decent for the size of everything. I love the chili cheese fries!! 10/10

this place is a must go if your into dive burger/sandwich/soda shops. My burger which was a special was amazing. Everything worked perfectly together in it. I only wish I had ordered a double instead of the single. Not that the single lacked neat in any way. It just would have made it even better. I had the garlic melt burger combo which included fries and a fountain drink. The burger was cooked perfectly medium rare as ordered. The bun was super fresh and soft. It had garlic mayo, bacon, grilled onions and mushrooms on it. They have craft soda on tap by Batch Craft Soda out of California which is made with real sugar and was delicious. The fries ( which are great!) are hand cut thin with the skins still on them. The woman behind the counter was very nice and the cook that bright me my food was as well. Also saved 10% of my combo by checking in. Enjoy!!!

Rocket Burger's homemade onion rings are some of the best I've ever had. I love the California burger, and the gyro burger is super awesome. I always make sure to steal a bite of Andy F's rocket burger (it's three patties! on a sub roll! so epic). Part of the fun of eating at Rocket Burger is spending way too long examining all the soda options - last time, I found a dandelion soda, but was just too chicken to try it (but YOU should - and tell me about it!)

The owners and staff are lovely, and you can tell they really care about this place. Andy and I actually had a really terrible experience our first time here (waited an hour + for food that was cold on arrival, etc), and when Andy yelped about it, the owner reached out. He said there was no excuse for the terrible service, but he'd instituted some changes and hoped we'd come back. We've been back a dozen times since that fateful day, and never once have we regretted it! 

Well, I regret not having tried all the sodas. But I feel I made a valiant effort!

I've been waiting to come here for a long time and I finally made it (Well my boyfriend ordered carry out). The food came out super fast so that is a plus. My boyfriend and I ordered the same thing... double philly cheese steak burger with cheese fries. Zero stars for the fries they were tasteless even with the cheese on them. The fries had no crunch and seemed like they were baked or just not fresh. On with the burger.... it was just ok. The Patty was definitely overcooked and the Philly cheese steak was dry.

Let's not all go crazy about Rocket Burger. The burger wasn't great and it certainly didn't beat Five Guys or In-N-Out. The fried foods, onion rings and fries were pretty good. Didn't care much for the unique fountain drink options. Put some Dr. Pepper and Coke in the soda fountain.
Just had a "Gyro Burger' and washed it down with a Lime Ricky soda. My taste buds are flipping out!  Awesome. Fun. Unique. Rocket Burger Rocks!

I had the western bbq burger. What's not to like about onion rings, bbq sauce and MEAT? If you order this you will be totally satisfied! Everything about this burger hits on all points. The bun is nice and soft with the right amount of grill char. The patty was thick but not under cooked. Very flavorful. The fries are home cut and were delicious too. I had a Snozzberry and ginger beer soda which was refreshing and tasty since Snozzberry is not on everyone's menu. When I thought it couldn't get any better I had the homemade cookies. This place is great and the food is even better.

This place rocks for value!!. I just had a California Sub and it was FANTASTIC! extra sweet coleslaw with pastrami stuffed in a fresh yogi roll. I really reccomend this one.

This place is kinda tucked away behind Churches Chicken but way worth the trip. They even have exotic sodas in bottles including REAL DR PEPPER. You should try it sometime. Best of all they now have Pepsi in the Fountain drink. A perfect compliment to an awsome sandwich.

If your on a budget and want to get stuffed come here you won't be dissapointed!

I ate here a long time ago and today I went back to buy a root beer. As everyone else says, their soda selection is outstanding. They have a very wide ranging menu and seem to have added to it since the last time I was there. I remember the hamburger being very good with a slight peppery taste...which I like. The fries were also well above average and service was friendly and efficient.

For a burger joint, this is as good as it gets.  I especially loved the large selection of specialty sodas.  They also have the best chili cheese fries, I have never had better chili, it was meaty and tasty and best of all not greasy!  I will definitely go back when we are in the area.
The burgers are ok, nothing special in my opinion. The rocket burger is just 3 patties on a hoagie roll. Overall, I'd rate as average. Staff was very pleasant though

So I saw this place while my son was signing paperwork in the military recruitment center next door ( GO ARMY!)

We finally were able to make it in and have dinner.
Love it!!
I got the philly cheesesteak and the chili cheese fries.
Both were excellent!  So far, their philly is the closest to a PENN STATION cheesesteak we can find this side of the Mississippi.

The chili cheese fries were like a strange fusion.  
The fries, themselves, were also VERY similar to Penn Station..which we love.  So that's another win.  BUT..the chili on the fries is very similar to Tommys Hamburgers. If you don't know what Tommys is..you haven't lived!!

So its basically an amazing combination!!
The guys working in the place( who mysteriously looked and acted like military recruits) were very friendly, and had our food out promptly.

They also have a HUGE assortment of retro and small batch sodas!
Very cool!
We will be back!

This place is great! I had the Santa Fe with a fried chili on it! Delicious! Also tried the onion rings which did not disappoint. The soda selection is amazing and completes the meal. 
Only draw back is sticky floor and tables.
I love the selection of drinks and how laid back it is! The only complaint I have is that the fries could be a lot better but hey, pretty good joint overall.

I love local shops but this food is sub par to say the least. Im all about greasy hole in the wall, but that does not mean quality has to be terrible, and that is what this place is. I give it two stars for the excellent selection of drinks!
I just happened to stumble upon this place. This place has some awesome food. I live in Avondale and I drive across town to get food from here.
Went here to eat dinner to be told they are about to close and the guy up front had a shitty attitude about it. This has completely turned me off from trying this place.

Read the reviews and drove 20 min down there to try it. The cooler of sodas are awesome and found a Colorado one from Durango that was very good.  There was an angry customer who was upset over their version of a gyro. His hair was a greasy as the fries (I'll touch on the later). He exchanged the gyro for a hamburger and when the owner brought it to the table he got to close to the angry  customer and I thought a fight was gonna bust out. 
Now on to the food. I consider myself a foodie. The burger meat itself was "wimpy" and covered in a sauce. The bun did not end up standing up to said sauce and disintegrated before I was finished. I ordered the cheese fries and wished I hadn't. It was a large portion covered with shredded cheddar and was GREASY blech. I ended up leaving hungry. I did buy a four pack of soda for seven dollars....  I wasn't impressed at all!

This place is surely a blast from the past.  With the prices it's definitely a restaurant fit for the high school students located just a short walk down the street.  I wish there was a place like this near my high school back in my days.

Rocket Burger isn't just for the kids though.  If you're looking for some tastey food and don't want to pay much this a place worth stepping foot into.  The choice in beverages offered is also another reason alone to come here.  You name it, just about every non-alcoholic drink is in their wall of drinks.

If in the area I'd recommend stopping by.  If not for one of their burgers, subs, hot dogs, gyros, or corn dogs, maybe for a drink to cool off.  I can't wait to come back to the Rocket.
The food was so good I almost re activated my Facebook just to like the establishment. You will not be disappointed. Wish I found this place sooner. Close to asu west

A good place for satisfyingly indulgent bad for you, but oh so good foods. New Yorker burger is great. Remember to grab napkins before you leave! They put rocket sauce and their special coleslaw on many of their items. Both are delicious , but make for a messy experience. We also love the mini corn dogs. Large portions of everything, especially the fries (one side is totally enough for 2 adults). They have every soda you could ever want, even faygo which is hard to find outside of Michigan. They've also added taps with craft soda. Cool place, not for those on a diet lol :D

Really enjoyed the food.  It's a very small area inside and a few tables outside, but food was excellent.  Also an amazing offering of sodas in a bottle and some good fountain sodas.  I had the Chicago burger and it was excellent.  I also did the chili cheese fries, the chili had a quick to it, very good.  I will definitely be back.

I try to live my life with no regrets. Live everyday like it's your last, right? Maybe insert some other cliches in here. Well I can tell you this, I certainly left Rocket Burger & Subs with a huge regret.....REGRET THAT I COULDN'T EAT MORE! Or that I should of tried one of there speciality burgers.

I went and was slightly overwhelmed with the choices I had. It was unexpected given the humble surroundings....it's in a small strip mall...small place... They have all kinds of burgers, your basic, bacon cheese, Mexican, Chili, Eddie Lopez, Baja, Cali, Chicago, Philly and Pastrami. That's not all but just some of what they offer. I ordered the basic bacon cheeseburger. It came out in a reasonable amount of time allowing me a small window of opportunity to sample their craft sodas....Snozzberry, Tahitian Treat and your regular flavors as well. All of them were good.

My burger was exceptional. Nice char on the outside, cheese evenly melted, ample lettuce and tomatoes, bacon was crisp and burger was still juicy. I have to mention the bun was nice and soft allowing me to squeeze it down to take that good bite. Great flavor like you'd expect. Salty and beefy. Once taking that first bite my mind became curious and wondered what that Mexican or Baja tasted like. Regrets like I should of tried pastrami or the Chicago....

Fries were crispy and salty as they should be. All in all...a great meal. I must mention the staff were exceptionally friendly. They all seemed happy which lended itself to the relaxed atmosphere.

I will definitely be back and will make my way through that menu.

Hope you enjoy it!

This place is worth a visit for the soda selection alone!  To say the least about the soda flavors, they have the usuals and some not-so-usuals (pumkin pie, bacon, king cake). And for those who are not fans of the syrupy sugar rush or if you are watching your waistline, they also have a great selection of unique and naturally flavored carbonated waters (my personal preference so I was thrilled!).

If you want a well-balanced hot dog this place is worth a try. They use beef Hebrew National Hotdogs. For those diehard dog lovers, this brand does contain a lot of sodium, nitrites, and they're plumped using soy protein filler so definitely not the best dog, but a tasty economical dog nonetheless. And the toppings were well-balanced. I can't resist a loaded chicago dog, it was delicious. 

As for the hamburgers, I was underwhelmed. They do have some interesting selections (pbj burger anyone?) but the burger patty is super thin and there isn't much flavor. My burger wasn't dripping with grease either but I definitely ran an extra mile the next day. Keep your expectations realistic and you won't be disappointed. It's fast food, not gourmet. 

Sides were good, aside from the cheese curds (my batch was super salty). Naturally everything is fried but the batter they use has a great consistency and crunch. You could also really taste the ingredients, there was no overwhelming fry oil flavor. I was also informed they prepare the zuchinni in house and nothing is packaged and shipped then flash fried so that's a bonus for sure. No stale box flavor here! 

The staff was also super friendly and patient with us as we perused our options (I am chronically indecisive). 

I may be back for the occassional hotdog hankering and fried zuccini fix and definitely for a carbonated flavor adventure but I wouldn't return for the burgers.

Rocket Burger is the best burger place in town! My go-to burger is the Cali Burger, but everything I've had so far is delicious, particularly the Eddie Lopez and Mexican Burger. All of the sides are amazing, as are the floats, and the soda selection is out of this world so I'm always able to try something new!

The only thing about Rocket Burger that I don't like is the fact that it's a bit of a drive for me, but in all honesty that's a good thing, because I'd probably eat there every single day if it was just down the road from me.

I tried the Phillyburger my wife tried the garlic malt both wore great.
cheese curds ,deep-fried mushrooms,fries all are good.
This soda selection is great
Highly recommended

Came here last night for the first time. I loved all of the soda options. This would be a really bad thing for me if I came here a lot. A bottled soda and fries were $5. That's a little steep. The employees were very friendly. I like the bun on the burger the best. I think the actual burger was just mediocre to me....reminded me of In-N-Out except a waaaaaaaaaay better bun. The fries were good and fresh!

Love the set-up and the fries are AMAZING! The bun on burger is too big, takes away from burger and veggies... personal preference, thus 4 stars. Definitely a local favorite and highly recommend visiting and supporting! Plus, try a soda you normally wouldn't!
This place is bad ass , so many different burgers its radonk! I highly recommend this place
Favorite place to go to for a simple yet great burger and cheese fries! Oh and also a very unique option of beverages bottled up in all the refrigerators!!

My previous experience hadn't been fantastic but I decided to try again and I am glad.  I ordered the BLT on toasted wheat and it was outrageously good.  They toasted the bread on the griddle.  It was really high-quality wheat bread.  The sandwich was loaded with bacon.  Only reason it isn't five stars is because of soda.  Yes I know they have an amazing selection but I am a Pepsiholic and the bottle Pepsi must be from Mexico because it has that formula flavor which is not my favorite.

My niece and I were having that conversation...where do you want to eat...I don't know where do you want to eat when we drove past the Rocket Burger corner.  I turned around to try it because of good Yelp reviews and my curiosity regarding the variety of Soda Pop.  We both got a large hot pastrami sandwich and soda pop.  The price was reasonable, the food was good and the soda pop made it a nostalgic experience.  I brought home half of my sandwich.  Just reheated it in the microwave and enjoyed it again.  I'll return to try the french dip sandwich on the menu.  P.S.  The meat and secret sauce gave the sandwich a great bite.  It blows away the 'roast beef' sandwich I had last week at Subway that looked like reconstituted meat.

Fan-freaking-tastic burgers paired with the finest selection of sodas anywhere?  This is a no-brainer...Rocket Burger should be on everyone's list.  I also love the build-your-own 4 and 6 packs of sodas to go, or enjoy with your food.  There's quite literally something for everyone, and the staff is extremely nice.  I order the Cali burger with fries and my wife had the New York with onion rings.  There's no doubt that we'll back....sooner than later!

The guy at the counter seemed impatient while i looked over the menu as i have never been here before. I told him ill just need a minute to look it over, he replied by saying nothing and continuing to stare. Talk about pressure. I loved the massive variety of soda in a glass bottle. I got a sandwich with a side salad. Loved the bread with the sandwich, it was stacked full making it a little messy to eat. Great, simple flavour. The salad was simple with large chopped veggies such as carots, cucumbers, bell peppers. Overall a great stop for lunch or dinner.

Fantastic little place in the neighborhood I grew up!

My husband had their bacon cheese burger combo, little guy had the hot dog combo and I had the Italian sun combo. 

French fries were fresh-cut, flavorful and perfectly fried. Their fries alone will get me to come back. 

I had a couple bites of my husband's burger which was very good! The bacon was cooked to the right amount of crispness and the bun tasted fresh baked (although I didn't verify)

The meats on my Italian sandwich were awesomely thick cut. If I get this sandwich again I'll probably ask for some Italian dressing on the side to dip. 

Little guy's hot dog was HUGE!!! The outside skin was nice and crisp so it snapped when you bite into it. 

In addition to the regular fountain drinks, they have a set of specialty fountains that contain root beer, black cherry, ginger beer, etc as well as hundreds of bottled specialty sodas. This place is awesome!

I had the Santa Fe Burger and it was really good! Coleslaw is so simple but amazing, want to try everything in the menu . Would not have found this place if it wasn't for yelp, ratings were good and decided to try it. It didn't disappoint! Owner and/or manager was very nice.

Was meeting up with someone for lunch in the area and decided to try it out since some friends have mentioned it before. Kind of an odd parking lot due to a Churches Chicken taking up most of the corner and HS kids are roaming around all the time. Just be patient and roll in. The lady at the counter was very nice, she not only answered our questions but asked a good amount of her own, very personable. I ordered the Cali burger with an egg and the ghost pepper cheese, It. Was. Amazing. The bread, it's always about the bread.. Perfection, amazing texture, kind of like Fuddruckers.  The meat patties were cooked perfectly and were delicious, especially with the fried egg bleeding yolk onto it. The kicker was the ghost pepper cheese, it was a good spicy, very flavorful, not hot just for the sake of being hot. Oh, and they have the largest selection of root beer you can possibly imagine, aaaand I got Dr Pepper.

Presentation is good. Beef patties/ burger meat had no flavor and patties are super thin--if used real burger meat and made own patties it would be better. Bacon used on burger was deep fat fried not pan fried and could tell by grease taste. Cheese looked yummy melted but again no taste--not real. Fries were way over-cooked and not seasoned with anything. Ranch dressing waa good for dipping condiment and tasted homemade. Fountain drinks were all low on flavor and just not good. My double bacon cheeseburger with fries and drink combo was $11.00 with a 10% off coupon. Not worth it. If they upgraded quality of food products served, I'd consider a return trip but not otherwise. You're seriously better off with a fast food chain burger combo. Sorry, keeping it real for real.

I was running some errands and figured it was time to go check out Rocket Burger's and subs. I've heard some pretty good things about this place so I stopped in and checked it out.

The place is located in a strip mall and actually kinda cool.  It's got a huge selection of pop along the wall, and has a great menu of items to choose from.  Prices are fair, and over all, it was a great experience.

I went with the Gyro burger with a pop, and it was out to my table in no time. Hot and tasty, and it hit the spot.  The burger itself was actually quite big, and stacked real high.  Pretty cool!  There's a reasonable amount of seating, with booths and tables like.
  
One thing I noticed is that they only have one unisex bathroom. I guess I'm used to a Men's and a woman's, but that's okay.  The parking lot was also overrun with teenagers for some reason, so I'm not sure what that's about.  There must be a high school near by, but they were just all hanging around, and some of them were in the restaurant as well. I guess it must be a fun place for them to hang out at!

Either way, if your on this side of town, and want something different and cool, go check this place out.  They seem to have something on the menu for everyone.

I had bookmarked this location after looking for new places to try out and decided to give it a try this past weekend. When you first get here, it doesn't look all that inviting, but the food is soooo good!! I can see why this place has good ratings. The service here is amazing. The two girls working behind the counter at the registers were very friendly and helpful and gave great suggestions of things on the menu to try since this way my first time here. 

I decided to do the bacon cheeseburger combo and upgraded my fries to chili cheese fries. Food came out fairly quickly, considering there were many people ahead of me. The young man that brought out my order was very professional and courteous. He smiled and asked if I needed anything extra before he left. Food portions are generous. I wasn't sure how big the burger would be, so I just order the single which was more than enough for me with the chili cheese fries. The burger was cooked well and tasted great! Chili cheese fries were a huge portion with lots of chili and cheese on top. Love that they give you enough chili and cheese to cover all the fries and not just the top ones. 

Inside of the restaurant is small, so many people had to take their food to go. Need to enlarge the seating area so more people can enjoy the whole experience of this restaurant. Parking isn't the best, so come early if you want to be able to find front parking, otherwise, you may be parking out by the dumpsters. 

Can't wait to come back and try more delicious food!

Definitely a place all burger lovers in the east valley should go to ! It looks like a 'hole in the wall' eatery but sometimes these turn out to be real gems. 
Single patty burgers are large enough, New York style fries are done perfectly plus they have an assortment of quirky bottled sodas which are hard to find anywhere else.

Wow!! I don't know how I missed this place!?  Where do I even start?? The yummy sodas ...made of pure cane sugar....nuff said. Delicious cheese curds fall apart in your hand! Fried mushrooms...oh..em...gee....so fresh and good! Lastly...but least... I had the Baja Burger...ah-ma-zing! The flavors were to die for. Very creative pieces of taste bud art. All the sauces are made in house. The cashier was cute...helpful and friendly. She gave me a sample of the sauce that goes in the fish sandwich....it honestly was like nothing I've never tasted. Again creative and full of flavor. Small quaint place that filled up quick at 530pm. They also have a large fridge with over 550 craft sodas. Even Faygo from back home. I'll be bringing my burger loving son here soon. Best food eating experience in a very long time. Definitely a must try.

This place is addicting! Literally hundreds of bottles of soda to choose from! They make some pretty awesome burgers, too! I always recommend getting whatever their daily special is, as it is usually a little cheaper with the fries and soda! Also, you won't find Coke or Pepsi products from the fountain...craft sodas only!! My favorite burger is the Ghost Burger...it is not for the faint of heart! The combination of chipotle sauce and ghost cheese will send smoke out your ears! The employees are really friendly, which makes deciding on what to order an easy process. Keep up the good work!!

The staff were super friendly and accommodating! The cheese curds were phenomenal....must have!! My son liked his chili burger and the onion rings were delish! I wasn't super impressed with my single bacon cheeseburger. The beef patty was super thin so it just tasted like bread and rocket sauce. I'll try something different next time! Amazing assortment of bottled pop!

Ok...I was so excited to eat here, from out of town and was sold by all the great posts and photos!! But it was one of the worst meals of my life. We enjoyed the sodas and bought 6. We ordered: New York burger, Mexican burger, Chicago dog, chili cheese dog, fried mushrooms. The hot dog buns were very hard, both me and my brother got a couple bits into our burgers and were almost completely turned off and couldn't eat another bit. The hot dogs were barely enjoyable as well... maybe the burger was so bad it made everything taste bad. Mushrooms were ok. We did take our food togo, but I wouldn't expect it to ruin the food this much. Very disappointed

It's okay but this place is a bit overrated for their food. Great select of soda though. 

Hot dogs seem like they've been warming all day, fries are alright but are too thin to be over cooked. Chili is decent. The wall of soda is what makes this place unique.
This place is amazing!  Such good quality.  Being in a not so good part of town, you might think the place is run down but it's great.  They have a huge selection of soda (pop)... and I mean HUGE!

HOW did my burger and fries come out so fast? I swear, I turned back to my booth from picking out a soda from the many to choose from, and there it was!

I'm not sold on the rocket sauce, but I can ask them to leave that off next time. My fries didn't seem totally fresh, but they weren't bad. Super crispy bacon for the win.

Filling, satisfyingly greasy, reasonable prices. I'd be willing to make a return trip and try something else from the menu.
Amazing. Sodas from all over the nation. Staff is super friendly. This is my go to burger place. I seriously drive 30 miles to get here from my house.

This burger joint is amazing...  Very limited seating so be prepared to eat family style if necessary; it adds to the charm.  The beverage choices are amazing and the prices are ridiculously cheap.  It takes me almost an hour to get there from my house and they've never disappointed me.

Let me start by saying the burger was 5 stars! However, the fried zucchini was just pretty good and the onion rings looked like it was the cooks first attempt ever at making them. The chili cheese fries were a disaster. Also, I thought it was lame that they charged me a dollar extra to do half n half on two items that were the same price. Greed isn't something that scores extra stars on Yelp. The service wasn't very good. The cook kept coming out and talking to people he knew in the dining area so our food took a long time. 

Would I go back- yes
Would I recommend the burgers- absolutely
Would I tip them- hell no! Need better service

Nice selection of sodas you probably have never seen or heard of too! I love Root beer and they have an entire fridge full to choose from. 

Overall incredible burger. Anything fried I would stay away from and wouldn't get the chili cheese fries, they are soggy and the chili is poor. 

Still worth it for the burgers tho, prices are reasonable as well.

Omg!! The Baja burger was amazing!!!! So flavorful and the coleslaw made the burger taste so yummy! The Santa Fe burger was good and it had fried peppers in it. It wasn't as good as the Baja burger but still yummy. I wasn't a fan of the onion rings but the fried zucchini was really good.

The portion sizes are freaking big and we ordered the smallest burgers! I can't even imagine what the rocket size looks like. 

I love how they have so many drink selections which are in fridges kinda like what you see at the gas stations. 

Expect to eat over 1000 calories!! Lol
Amazing one if the best burger spots in Phoenix, I eat here every time I think I deserve a treat.. Never tried the sodas but the food is always great

A little hard to find tucked behind a gas station and with all the window signage it looked closed but we were just to early before the lunch crowd lined up.
Luckily it wasn't super busy because we had a large party of kids and trying to get all their orders was something of an ordeal and then the adults all wanted something modified.
But our cashier deftly handled our entire order and didn't skip a beat or become frustrated. Yea!!!
We ordered quite the variety of grilled cheese and hot dogs, corn dogs and chilli dogs for the kids.
I had the double California burger with avocado and loved it. Super messy with fries to soak up everything.
The soda bar was pretty special with the natural sugar sodas which tasted much better then the regular sodas. You would be hard pressed to not find a soda you like here.
I can't wait to come back to try another concoction on their menu. Awesome!!!

When you go to Rocket Burger make sure to get the mushrooms. My favorite burger is the teriyaki burger. The burgers are huge and full of toppings. Make sure to have a large appetite.  You will order at the counter and the customer service is excellent.  They will help you with your needs. Don't forget they also have 100's of different kinds of sodas.

I'm not going to lie. When I first arrived, the outside of this store looked very ghetto. I hesitated to walk in but the review for this place is so well, I thought to myself that I need to give it a shot. The outcome is that I found a delicious burger place. This place had one of the best burgers I've had and I'd definitely recommend others to try.
Top 3 west side burger shop. Can possibly make # 1 after a few more visits and a couple cracks at the burgers on the menu. Philly burger with homemade fries oh my.

I'm not sure if I get the rocket love.  Maybe it's just not my speed, but after one visit, I'm not really inclined to return.  There is an awesome selection of soda's in the bottle though.  Maybe that's worth the trip.

The wife and I rolled in after attending an RV show in Peoria.  On the way home, I remembered all the raves about this place, and it was about lunch time, so we re-calculated our route and made a stop in here.

I'm kind of a Root Beer fanatic, and it was great to see all the different brands.  I just randomly picked one.  Not even sure what it was, didn't have much head, but good flavor.  I also had been craving a hot dog.  Got one of those along with a cheeseburger.  The hotdog was awesome, grilled all-beef quarter pounder served nicely on a toasted bun.  That fixed my craving.  The cheeseburger part was simply for reference.  It was decently prepared and presented, but the bun was stale.  Not stale enough to taste bad, but enough to crumble into unworkable chunks of bread before I finished the burger.  I probably left a quarter of the bun in crumbles in my basket.

So overall, this was a first-impression review and I can say while I wasn't blown away, It also was not bad either.  Maybe I'm spoiled by all the custom-burger places in my neighborhood, and after all the raves I've heard, maybe my expectations were too high.  But for the price, quality and ambiance (which is not something they have) of Rocket Burger, it's a decent option.

OK I will admit I am pretty ashamed of myself here. I did not realize I had not reviewed this place yet. SHAME ON ME!!!

I have been here half a dozen times and this place always makes me smile, and full.

The food here is awesome, dozens of Burgers, Hot Dogs, sides and do not forget the fried Cheese Curds. Then there is the infamous Rocket Burger. You can get any burger turned into a Rocket Burger (on a sesame seed sub bun) it is delicious but you have to have a huge stomach.

Sometimes I will stop in just to get a 6 pack of soda and then spend 20 minutes deciding which one I want. I believe I counted approx 360+ sodas?

They also have slush puppies, I have not seen or had these since I was a kid.

I would love to see this place expand it is awesome. All of the food I have tried was extremely good.

My kids beg to come here for dinner all the time!

...Why are you still reading this and not driving to this place? GO!!!
This place is awesome . Great burgers. Subs are excellent. Plan on going back soon. Overall experience was great

This is a great place to get a great burger.  The patties are somewhat thin so you might have get at least a double.  I noticed that the bun was very fresh and tasted great.  It's probably the best bun I have ever had on a burger.  It was just perfect.  I have noticed that other fellow Yelpers are also feeling the same way.

The fries were below average to me. I will be back again someday for the burger!
Very good place to break your diet :)  the fried zucchini are the best ! I love the green chili burger with the fried green chili !
Burger was big and greasy, if that's the way you like it. Huge root beer selection. HUGE. The owner was great. He stepped from behind the counter to help me pick one out.
So good! Kinda small on the inside of the restaurant but nothing wrong with taking this amazing burger home and destoying it. Everything is so fresh you taste a huge difference.
One of my favorite burger joints. They have such a fun selection of soda in all flavors. And lots of different types of burgers. Their rocket sauce is very good.

So, My husband and I were out and about when he said he wanted a burger, and his go-to place for burgers is In & Out *womp, womp*  Myself, on the other hand... I love burgers and finding new places....out comes the trusty dusty Yelp. We live fairly close to this location and due to the reviews we decided to try it out. 

When first arriving, I have never felt so welcome to a place before! Which quickly turned overwhelming by all the choices on the menu! Who knew you could have so many burger combos! It was worth the trip in just to see the soda selection as well. I loved all the different flavors.  I chose the Sante Fe burger which was delicious with the fried green chile. My husband chose the Afterburner Burger (I think, Which ever burger has all the hot peppers) 

I think the only complaint that we had was they didn't ask us how we liked the burgers... ie. medium rare or well done.... which made me believe at that time that maybe they were frozen patties?? Why else wouldn't they ask if they were fresh? So that warranted my 3 star review. When we were served our burgers, there was SO much toppings that we could barely taste the meat itself, So I would suggest getting a double patty next time. The burgers were also not very flavorful and really thin. Maybe so many toppings to give the burger flavor since the meat itself didn't have any. 

Regardless, the burger condiments and toppings were awesome. Fries were good too. Portion sizing was big as well.

I arrived here with my beau before a dinner rush. We both got the bacon cheeseburger and loved it! He rated it a 7.8/10 on the fast burger scale and i rated it a 7. It was messy, it had good fresh lettuce and tomatoes, everything a good burger should be and have in my opinion  The bottled soda was fun to look through. We both are fans of huckleberry so we got different huckleberry sodas, very fun. Price was very reasonable for a good thick burger.

I was craving a burger and I wanted a good one so I searched yelp for good burger reviews. I decided to try this place out today because it's just two miles from my home. The location isn't all that great, like someone else mentioned it's more like a convenient store than a restaraunt. I ordered the gyro burger and it was such a great idea and delicious. My only complaint is the burger patty was really small and didn't cover the whole bun. I washed it down with a Fentimans Dandelion & Burdock soda which was interestingly different tasting. They have so many different soda's it was hard to pick one so I just tried the one with the oddest ingredients I could find. My friend ordered the Baja burger and it was very messy but she said it was awesome. She liked the bread and the toppings. We're both fans now.

Mm this place is great. Kind servers, fast service, good food. My son spilled his drink, they were so understanding and nice about it. We had a good time while we were here. We will definitely come back n bring some friends! :)

Great customer service and amazing food, glad we found on yelp. They really love the food they make and it shows. Cant wait to try out more items and next time a beverage from their many choices !!! 
They are also down the street from us ! YAY!

Meh. I've had better burgers at the local Denny's. The fries were either old or refried. The chilli on my chilli-cheese-fries tasted like cheap canned chilli. Won't go back... Nothing there I can't get cheaper and better at other places.
The burger bread was soggy, fries was too salty, and the waitress gave my order to the wrong table.... but overall a good price, check in receives 10 percent off

I've been eyeing this place for a while and I finally made it! I can't believe I haven't been here sooner, me and my husband loved what we ordered. The New York burger and the garlic chicken sandwich. We both ordered a drink and got to choose from a variety of drinks they offered. We will definitely be back :)
Awesome place! Great burgers and every root beer you can imagine in a bottle! Definitely check it out!

First time visit, found using Yelp.  Decor is a little funky with colorful rockets painted on the walls.  First thing you notice is a set of large coolers with every brand of soft drink bottles and cans.  I had no idea there were so many different varieties and brands on the market.

Staff was very friendly and offered several suggestion as they have a large number of burgers with all sorts of choices available as single  and multiple patties.

My wife selected the California Burger with Avacado, Bacon, Swiss Cheese, Lettuce, Tomato and Onion Rings.  They offer their "Rocket Sauce" which is based on a variant of Thousand Island.  She had an order of Onion Rings.

I had a Teriyaki Burger which came with Cheese, Pineapple, Lettuce, Tomato, Mayo and a homemade  Teriyaki Sauce.  I had French Fries.

The Burgers were fabulous!  They have a special Bun, a giant step up from the more conventional mass produced bun.  The beef was not overcooked and was delicious. The bun was more dome shaped than flat and a challenge to open wide enough to get the burger in your mouth gracefully.

Generous slice of Pineapple and Tomato.

The Onion rings were some of the best we have ever had.  The coating was thinner than what you normally get but fabulous in taste.  The portion was very generous and came with a couple small containers of Ranch Dressing.

Unfortunately the French Fries were a disappointment.  Generous portion but rather small cut, texture was overly soft and color dark brown indicating a non premium type of potato.  Too little starch and to much sugar causing the overly dark color and somewhat oily taste.

Would have rated the meal as five stars but poor fries dropped them a full star.

Will definitely return and perhaps talk to the staff about selecting a better potato or more optimum cooking method.
Awesome burgers! I got the garlic special and it was delicious! I ordered the California burger this tube and it was delicious!

So happy to find a place where my friends and relatives can enjoy a delicious hamburger while I have the best vegetarian sandwich in town.Then, to top it off, there are great fries and an endless selection of pop to complete the meal. It takes me a while to decide which soda I'd like to try each time I'm there. The service is great and the employees are very curtious and helpful. I love this place.

Came in on 6/19 for lunch. My buddy was hyping this place up, so we came here.

The staff was very friendly and helpful with the menu. But, the prices are a little pricey for the size and quality of the food.

I ordered the Afterburner burger (single patty) with ghost pepper infused cheese and an order of zucchini. Along with the drink, it came out to just over $14. And to be honest, it wasn't worth it as I was expecting a decent kick from the jalapeños and ghost pepper cheese. The jalapeños were not even close to spicy and the cheese did provide a hint of spice. It also had this rocket sauce (I think that's what it was called) and I'm not sure what it was trying to do. It had no flavor. Then, I saw the patty and it was pretty sad as it looked like one of those frozen patties from those commercials. So the burger I rated as a 1 out of 5 stars. Then we had the fried zucchini and they were pretty good. I think they used corn dog breading and it was tasty. So those I'll rate at 4 out of 5 stars.

I'm pretty sure I wouldn't recommend this place for the burgers, but good thing they offer a good variety of other items. They also have a ton of different soda to choose from. Hell! They have root beer on tap.

After reading such great reviews about Rocketburger I thought I was just about to have the best burger I've ever tasted! But after ordering the Cali burger with fries and a specialty root beer, I was mistaken. It wasn't a bad burger by all means, but for the price it was disappointment. ($10.33, for a single burger, fries, and root beer.) although when placing my order the staff was very polite and delivered my burger very fast! Not sure I would make another visit though.

One of my favorite places to eat! New York Burger is absolutely delicious! Plus the enormous selection of soda is the best! If you haven't eaten here before you are missing out! It's a one of a kind place.
Good Burger !!! Good Service !! Great Soda Selection !!! Fast Friendly Service !!!  Great Menu of Burgers !!!

The burgers are good but not as good as the Yelp rating would indicate.  I had a sandwich there once and it was very mediocre.  The fries are terrible.  Ditto for the frozen soft serve ice cream or yogurt product.  It taste like low fat.  Exceptionally low quality.  I'd certainly eat the burgers again but not the other offerings.

This place just doesn't do it for me. Even with their check in special I feel like it's way over priced for what it is. It will cost min $50 for my family to eat there and that's too much for the area/food. These are burgers and hotdogs people. My kids hate the breading on their chicken but like the corn dogs. I love their cheese curds but the sauerkraut on their dogs is nasty. It's 'ok' but nothing to go out of your way for

I had the single California burger.   It was great.  It had avacado, swiss and lots of bacon.  Flavorful, thin burger medium rare.

The cook came over and served us.  He came back again to check on us.  We were all compliments. Great service.  I would come back.

A friend had the afterburner burger.  He had the double patty and raved about it.

The fries were good, a bit on the salty side.  

The menu is big.  Plenty of choices and they are quick!

The place used to a cousin's subs before and is bit hidden next to safelite auto glass.

I absolutely love this place!! The vibe is super awesome and there is a plethora of craft sodas to choose from!! 

The onion rings are the perfect mixture of onion and batter, not to thick and caked lightly. I get the New Yorker on marble rye with ghost pepper cheese, (warning it's HOT) the sandwich is filling and so flavorful! 

Don't forget the rocket sauce!
The best Burgers and home of a Thousand Sodas and beverages ,owner and staff are the best

Just tried this place out and i was really glad i did. I got a double bacon cheese burger which was very good. Was not a big fan of the fries but they're not too bad. And there was these 2 guys working that seemed a bit rude and immature. Overall i'd go back but definitely will say something if they act that way again.

Glad we tried this place.  It was delicious and the burgers were juicy. 
We got the philly burger, the garlic melt, cheese fries and chicken nugget kids meal. Everything was Cooked to perfection. Very large selection of crafted sodas glad they came to the neighborhood and looking forward to coming back.  Only suggestion I do have is to offer a gluten free bun.
Had the New Yorker burger, onion rings and peanut butter shake. It was all delicious. Bottle soda selection is amazing and have had many of the different root beers all of them awesome!

We are from So. Cal., have travelled far/wide in southwest/more & have never had as good a green chile cheeseburger anywhere. This scrumcious burger is called the Santa Fe Burger. Veggies (tomatoes, onions pickles), cheese, fried green chile, bacon & rocket sauce. The depth, taste, & texture was amazing. Served hot in a perfect crunchy outside/soft inside bun! Was not sure about a fried chile, thinking it may be heavily dipped/fried, but it was 'heavenly' breaded & fried to perfection, not oily, but fairly thick & crisp, adding another dimension to the old standby found in many New Mexico burger shops. Don't think it was the unsurpassed New Mexico Hatch chili which is the only thing that would improve this outstanding burger. I had the single which I could not finish because of its size & hubby had the double which he did finish. Num!

Fries were not memorable. Oil not hot enough, I believe.  They wilted as they cooled.  Next time we'll try the onion rings, zucchini, or mushrooms. Apparently for these other veggies, they use the same coating as the above-mentioned chili in the burger.  

We stuck w/ the regular soda machine, but hundreds of choices in chilled bottles are behind glass to choose from.

Wish we were staying one more night so we could go back and totally ruin our diets! Ha!  Excellent price points, as well. Get yourselves over there before they have to expand to a pricier market.
This is bar far the best burger in town. Make sure you try the santafe burger.  The onion rings holy shit  I swear you will hurt yourself

I really enjoyed rockets New york sub, it was like nothing i have tasted. The burgers are okay. The shakes are alright. I really enjoy the selection of beverages at this restaurant. The only thing i didnt really like was that the cheese curds were just too greasy. Other then that Rockets is where its at. Its nice for Moon Valley High School that this restaurant is right next door.Its just a bit pricey if youbuy for multiple people.
Greatest burgers, sandwiches, soda pop and zucchini fries but the French fries are disgusting. I'll never order there fries
Our burger was juicy and perfectly cooked to order and the fried green chili was different,  but really good.

This little place showed up on yelp and the wife and I just decided to give it a shot. When we entered we were greeted by two very nice men then I noticed the soda pop. Everything you have ever wanted in a soda pop selection. Everything from real sugar Pepsi to saranac Shirley temple. I decided to have the biggest burger I could and what a choice. I decided the newyork burger was what I craved. Burger on a fresh bun with tons of thin sliced cole slaw and amazing pastrami. The hot dog was the best my wife Ashley has had. Top it all off with chili cheese fries. No bean chili the way I like it. Fresh cut fries and it was cheesy heaven. The best part, 2 full people, 2 great sodas.....$12. Love it.

Guys, I love this place! We found it on accident and I've been back 5 times! 

Classic burger joint. The ambience is what you would expect. It's a burger joint! Come on! 

Every single roll I've had was delicious, warm, and fresh. It was great! 
If you love classic, real potato fries, this is your joint! 

I had the cherry slush-puppy with a gyro burger and it was freakin' great! I was  expecting just gyro meat, and it was loaded with meat & a burger patty that was flavorful and moist! 

The Philly is good, but we don't do green peppers, that's a Jersey thing! Get it right! 

There was this WALL OF SODA. This place has every flavor and brand of soda out there! Try the cream sodas, the maple bacon, the butter scotch, so much! 

Best part of the meal was the fried mushrooms. BEST. IN. THE. WORLD. 
I've never had better. Seasoned to PERFECTION! 

A little more expensive than average, but the food is above average so it's OK!
Love this place. Family owned feel with friendly staff. It's my family's favorite calorie splurge place. The burgers are amazing. We always leave stuffed.

I just had a rocket-sized bacon cheeseburger and soda float from Rocket Burgers & Subs. They were both absolutely delicious! This is a great place to dine and order food from. They have an amazing array of soda flavors. The staff is awesome with great customer service. Make sure you check out their menu.

Ohhh my yummmm!!! Their garlic mayo is the best on the burgers along with their fries !!! Very good burger fresh NOT frozen and they put a good amount of bacon,and alvacado on their cali burger !! I definitely found my go to spot for a vintage soda and a great burger and fries!!!

i dream about this place...in fact my stomach is growling just thinking about it. been here a few times, always down to try something new each time. however, my heart belongs to the eddie lopez burger. i've yet to get down on the cheese curds, the fries are tasty as well as the onion rings. the kids and i spend at least a good 15 minutes perusing the soda selection. this place makes me happy, so very very happy. i just wish i didn't live so bloody far...

After dining here almost every day of his week-long vacation, The Rob has decided that it is not a grease that comes off some of the burgers, (as previously stated) but a sort of au jus sauce, the contents of which is trying to break down with each visit.  Makes me feel a bit better about the massive amounts of beef, fried potatoes and fried cheese he ingested in such a short time.  

Oh, and we are super hooked on the fries now too.  Like, craving hooked.  Good for them, not good for me and my estranged relationship with the elliptical machine.  Sigh.

We went here for dinner tonight. Had the Chicago Dog and Fries. Steve had the Philly cheese steak sandwich and zucchini and a bottle of Dad's root beer. Loved everything. Will be going back soon. Good service and excellent food. Worth the drive.

We were looking for something different and in the mood for a good burger in Chandler.  Read the reviews on Yelp and decided to give Rocket Burger and Subs a try.  So glad we did, good burgers, fries and chicken sandwich special.  Owner came out to check on us and see how everything was, very friendly and good service.  We'll be back and plan to bring the ACP Erie crew since it is right around the corner!

This is one of the best dive burger shops in Phoenix.  They have a whole wall dedicated to glass bottle sodas, and you can find pretty much any soda you've ever wanted to try...including some you may not want to try (bacon flavored soda!)...but that's the fun of it.  

As far as food and burgers go, there are some real options here like the New York burger which comes with Pastrami, or the Philly Cheesesteak burger, which is also incredible.  They also have hot dogs, subs, desserts, and so much more. There are so many options, which leaves me hesitant at most places because I wonder how they can do so much and still uphold quality, but this place manages to do it (try the ghost pepper cheese on your burger!).  

On top of the food and soda, this is a local family-owned restaurant with friendly staff.  I have personally seen the owner talk with a homeless man who walked in and he gave him a drink and made him feel welcome even though the man didn't buy anything.  It's nice to have places like this in the neighborhood, and whenever I am in the neighborhood, I make sure to give this place my business.

First and foremost - DON'T BE SHOCKED BY THE LOCATION OR FIRST IMPRESSIONS! 
This place is awesome, has a great selection of drinks (especially root beers), and the value of the sandwiches is over the top! 
Don't forget to try the onion rings. They use their own breading made out of corn meal and spices. The amount of food you get is a great value. 
I travel the nation weekly, and will be visiting here again in the future.

Okay, let's get this straight...there are pros and cons here. 
Pro: I think they have more soda than Rocket Fizz. It's all refrigerated and ready to drink!
Pro: They have a Santa Fe Burger which involves a battered, deep-fried green chili which is utter genius. I repeat, Utter Genius.
Pro: The burgers are well-crafted with attention to detail and carefully laid out, not assembled by an uncaring worker and squished into a wrapper quickly.
Pro: They have Pepsi products on fountain in case for some reason ~300 types of bottled soda (most made with Real Cane Sugar OH YEAH) just doesn't do it for you and you need to blend your own suicide-soda.
Pro: They will make any soda you want into a float, using soft-serve, for a buck!
Pro: Locally-owned by a guy who seems pretty nice and genuinely interested in his customers and their thoughts. That's a HUGE PLUS, people...pay attention! 
Pro: The burgers' pickles are good! they don't taste like run-of-the-mill, cheap, food purveyor 5 gallon bucket pickles.
Pro: They have a website that seems to be pretty current, it alerted me to the fact that they have some of the last remaining Dublin Dr. Pepper in the world and I should buy now. (Disclosure: While I like Dr. Pepper - I'm not a superfan, and have never tried it - so I figured the $15/6packs were better left to the superfans and collectors).
Pro: The building seems to be laid out in an "L" fashion, with the soda selection and main tables on one side; and an 'extra" area of seating on the other side of the kitchen that seems to have a pass-thru ordering window. That probably comes in pretty handy during lunch rush when the kids from the hi-skool next door probably mob the place. We didn't notice this until we were leaving...so I'll have to explore that next time.

Con: The signs telling you about the $1 float options are too high to notice until you've already ordered. Perhaps this is another stroke of genius to encourage repeat business, perhaps its an oversight.
Con: It's an older property, so it doesn't have that super-clean feeling about it. It's not dirty by any means...but it's at that stage of life where its not sterile, but not quite yet charming. Of course, this whole part of town is at that stage - so you can't really hold that against the place.
Con: Soft-serve rather than real ice cream.  It's not that I hate soft-serve, I give it its credit...but I prefer real ice cream. (Disclosure: if they used real ice cream, I'd probably bitch about that too, because I'm kind of a dairy snob).
Con: Shoestring potatoes. I know they have the skin on, and are natural-cut, and shoestrings have millions of loyal followers...I'm not one of them. Give me a tater-tot any day.

Other things of note: My single burger was BIG. You can also go double or Rocket Burger, which is 3 patties on a sub roll. I can't imagine eating that - but I'm sure its a fave amongst many!

Bottom line: Pros obviously outweigh cons and the fact that it is a family-owned/run business always weights positive in my book! We'll be back.

I know this is a burger place. But I love hot dogs and good dogs are hard to find.  I especially love Chicago dogs.  Now these hot dogs are called Chicago dogs but are grilled and not on the traditional poppy seed bun. But we LOVED them!  And that's unusual for us as normally nothing  but a traditional Chicago dog will do.  Also great fries and onion rings. And love the craft sodas!  Have been twice already and will be back. A third time. And a fourth time. And so on and so on..

rocket burger is by far THE BEST.BURGER.PLACE.EVER!!!! I found it's also the best valley... when i eat here i feel i get way more than what i pay for!! we eat there on a regular basis and have never been disappointed even a little bit!!! when i move next month this is the only place i will miss in arizona!! and every visit back home we will come and eat here!!! oh and do you like soda? any kind that you can imagine they have it in cool glass bottles! Oh and slush puppies too! This place is great just come try it for yourself you'll know what I mean!!
I LOVE this place. Excellent quality fast food, great selection, friendliest people, and tons of gourmet sodas... recipe for success.

Meh. My Burger wasn't that great. The Bacon was overcooked. I came mostly for the soda selection. It takes a while to find the one you're looking for. They do have a lot of choices. I found the birch beer I wanted. I'll be back but mostly for the sodas.

Came here for the first time with my buddy. We both were absolutely NOT disappointed. Buddy ordered the Mexican burger which came with bacon and avocado. I ordered the bacon cheeseburger which comes with the special rocket sauce (think of Big Mac special sauce). I also ordered cheese curds. All burgers are made medium well which is how I like my burger but if you don't like pink in yours, make sure to say something. The burger was juicy and the bun was butter toasted to perfection. Cheese curds were cheesy and tasty. French fries were well seasoned and freshly made. Menu is expansive as is the bottled soda options. I look forward to coming back and trying different burgers. I also want to try the Mexican hot dog.

All the sodas you could want...from EVERYWHERE!!! Always a new delicious burger on the Specials menu and the fries are top notch!  Anytime we are in the area, we stop and get a good quick meal here :)

Heard these rocket burgers take you to the moon and back so I said why not give 'em a try!

Location & Aesthetics - located in Phoenix just off W Cactus Road at the intersection of N 35th & W Cactus Road.  The business is behind a Raising Cane's and I almost missed it as I had to swing around on N 35th Ave.
Parking was on the dismal side and there weren't enough spots available.  Luckily, I snagged that last remaining parking spot.  I'm unsure where I would've parked if there weren't any available spots....perhaps in Raising Cane's parking area (-1).
Interior decor is interesting as they have pictures of famous figures from sports and other areas with the accompanying prices of things from yesteryear, e.g. the cost of a soda in the '40's or '50's.
Seating was adequate and comfortable, and the dining areas was clean.  Along one wall was lined a wide selection of soda pop which was interesting.  Many different names and bottle shapes that is a must see if visiting.  
One negative was the dining area was on the small side so if you're coming with a party of more than 5, you may have to put some of the tables and chairs together (-1), and sadly there's no outdoor seating.

Menus - posted on a chalk board above the cashier who also takes your orders.  There are more detailed menus on the countertop which we were given.      

Service - Staff was very warm and welcoming, and answered any questions we had about the menu items.
If dining in, staff will bring your food to the table.  

Food - I had the double cheeseburger, fries and a strawberry shake.  
The shake tasted like there were real strawberries used, very creamy and thick, and very well mixed.  
The fries looked they were freshly cut with the potato skin still on them - crunchy, well seasoned, tasty, not too overcooked or limp, and not over salted.
The burger was juicy, well seasoned, tasty, not very greasy or runny, and cooked perfectly.

I am interested in trying some of their other inventions and will probably return though will probably order for take-out because of the lack of parking!

Just driving by Rocket Burger, you don't think much of it. Looks like no frills, hole in the wall burger joint thrown into the cityscape with every other place but TRY IT! It's a cute little counter service burger/sandwich joint owned and operated by an adorable married couple.

Honestly the food is in my opinion an A- but the customer service and selection of menu items as well as beverages is outstanding. The burgers are really good. Not the best I've ever had, but for a modest price, very well worth the money. Their fries are well seasoned and come in big portion sizes too.

Warning: this won't be everyone's experience! ...but, on my fiancee and my first time through, the wife/co-owner ended up bringing us a sample of some of the sides we had asked about while ordering. Didn't charge us or tell us she was doing anything; just brought it out and told us to enjoy. So nice! 

So the decor won't wow you and yeah you may find a slightly better gourmet burger somewhere else but this little gem is worth a visit for sure and I'll be going back!

I'm not one to usually make dramatic statements but : BEST BURGERS EVER

My office recently moved to this area and have come 3 times now. My favorite is the Afterburner Burger.  Also, an incredible selection of soda. Much of it pure cane sugar. Very nice staff, always busy.

I love this place !!!!! Living in cali im still to find good philly cheese steak out there and trust i have looked  . I will gladly drive 4.5 hours just for a good meal ...... thanks for the best philly cheese steak in the west !!!!

A large menu offering many different flavors that will impress you in comparison to even Red Robin. The venue is nothing to brag about so it's hard to bring guests from out of town here. The bottled soda selection will spin your head trying to select so hopefully you have an idea before going in.

I came here again with my wife for dinner. She had a chicken sandwich with a teriyaki pineapple sauce that was absolutely delicious. I did the Mexican hot dog again.

Once again I was reminded why this place is so highly recommended. The food was amazing, the fries have gotten much much better too! Keep it up Rocket Burger! 

I can't wait until next time. There's just so much good stuff on the menu that I think I'll be busy trying something new on each visit for a long time to come.

This place is really good. I had it bookmarked for such a long time & one night, I couldn't figure out what I wanted to eat for dinner & figured it would be the perfect time to check this place out. They have so many different options to choose from, it was so hard trying not to order everything all at once! Haha. I've been craving a Philly cheese steak for such a long time and this was also recommended by one of the employees at the register. 

I've had quite a few different Philly cheese steaks from other places but this one is definitely one of the best! The bread was so soft and nicely toasted & didn't get soggy (as some of them do from meat juices). Perfect amount of meat and cheese too. Their fries, I wasn't that impressed with. They definitely look and taste hand cut fresh potatoes. I usually like my fries crispy so I asked them to be well done. This was a mistake because they actually tasted burnt rather than being crispy. 

They have so many different soda's to choose from. They have so many bottle lined up against their windows and fridges full of bottles soda. & they also have craft soda on fountain.

First and foremost love the food.   Just a few things today that irritated me which I had let go in the past when it was one thing: a) the phone wasn't working so couldn't call in my order, b) then i tried their online system which worked, but the gal at the register tore off the previous order which listed a 2:41 pickup when mine was 12:30 so i had to wait when i was in a rush, and c) the damn avocado, one of the key ingredients, was missing from my california club.   

Shore it up please.   That's all.

A very tasty lunch or dinner option.  The portions are filling, and the meat and toppings are fresh and flavorful.  The French Fries are a perfect accompaniment.  Service is quick, selection is vast, and there are thousands of interesting soda choices, as well as fresh-brewed iced tea.

First time at Rocket Burger and Subs and we loved it! I had the turkey avocado and sprouts sub and it was bomb. Plus all the nostalgic sodas. I bought the Frosty orange and root beer. I live on the west side of town but definitely we'll be back. Steve the owner was very nice and very personable we enjoyed talking with him.
Awesome food! Sooooooo many hamburger combinations, my favorite is the Teriyaki burger, shoestring ff...and every brand of soda you can think of....

We went for lunch today - good burgers, subs, wide variety of craft sodas. Biggest drawback was lack of seating, I think there were 3 booths inside and 3-4 tables outside.  Business was constant but lack of seating  was a big drawback to us

This place is awesome! Been searching for a solid burger place since I moved here, and I found one! Rockets Burger and Subs is probably one of the best burger restaurant I've been too in a long time! It's a hole in wall, but that's where the best food comes from! The place is small, but very well maintained and clean! The burgers are beyond amazing! The burgers are freshly cooked and well seasoned! All the toppings are freshly added to your burger! The buns do get a little soggy over a short period of time, but the taste makes up for that! Hard to beat this place for pure quality of food and affordability. If there was a "Yelp hidden gem" of the year award, they would be nominated! Recommend this place for lunch, dinner or anytime you crave a burger!

This place has amazing burgers. I've never been disappointed. They carry a wide variety of sodas as well, from all over the world. It's kind of a small spot, or a hole in the wall. Even if you're not hungry, stop in and grab a weird/strange soda!

I've been wanting to try this place for awhile and finally did last night. The burger itself was pretty good. It's not going to replace my normal go-to places but I would definitely go back for another one. The fried zucchini and cheese curds were both pretty meh. I ended up tossing the cheese curds and only ate a few of the zucchini before they got ditched too. Both were insanely salty. The staff were friendly and helpful.

This is a chain of two locations, so I am told. The menu  is broad enough. I ordered the bacon cheeseburger combo. The French fries were limp, as if they had been sitting for some time. The cheeseburger was good and filling, as was the ice tea. 

The big negative is limited seating. Only three booths inside with 4 two person tables outside in the sun. 

Will give it some thought about returning, seating limitations is the real concern, even with small group.
Cali burger is delicious! Soft serve ice-cream twist half and half style! Huge drink selection including slush puppies what what!!!!
Great local place. Excellent burgers, sandwiches and sodas.

When my fiance and I decided to go to Rocket Burger, I was extremely excited about it...she, being a vegetarian, was not.  

We got there, and I'll admit, from the outside looking in, and even once inside the door, I was a little put off.  I wasn't sure I wanted to stay there and eat.  All that changed once we got a good dose of the service (and food)!  

She ordered some pizza bread, with pretty much every non-meat topping available, and some cheese fries with no chili.  I ordered a Chicago dog with chili fries (no cheese).  

We got a few drinks from their AMAZING soda selection.  She got two of the original Dr. Peppers, and I got a Leninade.  She ended up hating the Dr. Pepper because it used real sugar, and drank my Leninade...a taste of things to come once married I suspect.

The pizza bread, according to her, was delicious.  The fries, superb.  

My dog was amazing.  I expected the actual hot dog to be a little bigger, but with all the things you get on the dog, it's a real meal.  I ate that, and some of the fries (which were really really good...though I should have gotten the chili cheese fries instead of just chili) and was stuffed.  

The people that work there are very friendly.  They brought the food to us rather than just calling out our names, offered to exchange the unopened Dr. Pepper for something different since she didn't care for it, and had good humor when my fiance made a joke about them not having veggieburgers.  

The only thing holding it back from being 5 stars is that the tables needed wiped off.

Food: Burgers are ridiculous! If you want a burger with hot pastrami and special sauce this place has it. They have a variety of weirdly but awesome combinations of burgers and for the price it's better then any "Fast Food" burger. They also have other type subs like their French Dip is amazing and comes with a side of fantastic au jus for dipping. Let's talk about the ginormous variety of sodas from all over, their coolers take up most of the space to display all the sodas. Gotta try if you are craving a burger.

Decor: not much to say but it looks very much like a liquor store that sells burgers in the back of the store.

Service: Counter Service but friendly, willing to help you find something you'd like.

Overall: I like the Burgers but will probably take it Togo. Not really a place you want hang out in.
The California burger is amazing! My new favorite burger place. Everything is fresh and the employees are so friendly! This place is a hidden gem in Chandler!

I had an awesome Italian sandwich and root beer float.  I overheard the guy at the table next to us say the burger he was eating was the best burger he ever had.  I'll be back to cheek out the burgers...

So I was at the ER in Chandler and needed a quick meal. Found this place and I sure am glad I did. I got the gyro sandwich, an order of onion rings, and one each of their cookies. I am now back waiting in the ER and I can't wait till I can go back to try something else. The food is excellent, the staff is very friendly, and the place is very clean. I don't give five stars out often, but this place deserves it.

Outstanding place,  Slush Puppies, Craft Soda,  fresh shoestring cut fries....  

Large Italian,  fresh deli meats,  toppings,  provolone cheese was great n fresh hoagie bun..  toasted,  and was down right great.. 

New Yorker,  what the whattt,  usually not a huge fan of pastrami,  but this may be my #2 sammich now..  awesome slaw,  swiss cheese, n rocket suace..  I suggest u try it..  toasted as well.. 

Snoozeberry soda was great,  fries feshly cut shoestring,  little undercooked,  but,  take out didn't notice till home n still ate them all..  

Across street pretty much,  will try burger sub n philly cheesesteak next..  cheers n kudos,  keep up the great food.

Would give 3.5 stars if I could.  Came here looking for a great burger, fries and shake and left a little disappointed.  My burger was excellent but the single patty was paper thin.  Didn't look at all like some of the recent photos posted.  The fries were fine, nothing special.  The shake was I guess what you'd expect for $2.99.

A small independent burger joint with unique menu. It's stuck in the small shopping center behind the fried chicken place, on the corner. If you didn't know what you where looking for, you would miss it. You'd best not however, because it's that good! 

The menu is a mix of burgers, sandwiches and hot dogs. You can have fries or onion rings, and then there is your drink selection, that's where you can be sure of having some fun making up you mind. If you are a fan of nostalgia and love the old and new, you can rest assured that they will have something that will satisfy both. There is everything from cream soda's to root beer, they even have chocolate soda! 

I had the classic bacon cheese burger with onion rings. The burger was cooked just right with extra crispy pieces of bacon melted cheese, lettuce, tomato and pickles. The onion rings was coated with corn meal batter and fried to golden brown. It was a great choice. 

The locals seemed to be happy, service was great, and owner seemed genuinely interested in who was eating at his place and how we had discovered it. Overall, a good burger and well worth coming back for!

First of all don't judge a book by its cover. Most people would pass up the place from the outside. Which I guess is good for us locals! There are so many great things I can say about this place. First of all the burgers are amazing and quality is consistent. We have been going here since they opened and never have any issues. The staff is so friendly they know you by first name basis. If you are a bottle soda or flavored soda drinker this is the place for you. They have over 5 fridges full of selections to choose from. Now to the good stuff. I recommend that you try the After Burner burger. It is pepper jack cheese, jalapenos, this amazing mayo, and rocket relish...pretty much a pico de gallo. The Onion Rings and Fried Zucchini are coated perfectly and fried crisp not greasy. Don't forget to ask for the ranch it is also a customer favorite. Another good burger is the Cali burger which has fresh avocados on it. They have daily specials as well. Now for dessert don't forget to get a brownie that they make or a chocolate milk shake. For the kid in you they also have slush puppies they remind me of my childhood. 

I would say the main reason we go back is the vibe of the restaurant. They are like your family and they make you feel at home. They are the reason you go back!! Keep up the great work Rocket Burger!!!

Fantastic dinner!!!! This was my first time eating here. The place is hard to find, with road construction all around the complex.  I walked in and ordered the cheeseburger combo with fries. I asked for no salt, seasoning salt, or "Rocket Sauce". At first they looked at odds with my request. Then, I told them that I am highly allergic to MSG and don't want to take my chances. They were immediately responsive and said they understood.  I went to pour my soda and as soon as I sat down, my meal was being placed in front of me.  The cheeseburger was prepared exactly as ordered.  The fries were fresh cut, crispy brown, tasty, and salt free. Fantastic.  I only regret that I didn't order the double party cheeseburger.  I now have a new "go-to" burger joint! The owner is very friendly and personable.  He takes pride in his work.  Good job!!

I absolutely love this place! The food is excellent, the eddie burger and meatball sub have been my favorites so far. The chilli cheese fries are incredible, and the onion rings are awesome! You can tell a lot of love is put into this food, and if I go out to eat I drive 20 minutes out of my way to go to Rocket Burger. Absolutely love this place, and the soda selection is incredible!

Delicious! I ordered the Ghost Burger and expected it to be spicier, but it was still awesome. The Rocket Fries are fantastic. I took off one star because the cashier guy wasn't the friendliest, but the rest of the staff was.

This place is incredible. Today I had the Baja Burger with added Smoky Ghost Pepper Jack Cheese and the burger was simply amazing. I've been 3 times so far and each time I leave very satisfied. It's a hard place to find with no signs on the street, but once you find it, you'll never forget. Although I love both the burgers and sandwiches, I am not the biggest fan of their fries and would probably opt to get a different side than fries.
I love this place but without the owner being here the service sucks and the food sucks. I will be back like always but just hope they can get some consistency

I am so grateful to say I have had the famous Rocket Burger.  This place gets so much Yelp praise and for great reason.  

The soda selection is off the hook every soda you grew up with and then some all in coolers in bottles the even got YooHoo.

Fries are all natural cut and amazing there is just something great about fries with the skin on them they just taste better.
