The burger was Phenomenal I had the Santa Fe which had the amazing Rocket Sauce, bacon, and fried green chili.  It was outta this world good.  

I will be a loyal customer and I am sure will post numerous updates to this review cause this place is just that good.

I usually don't get excited about burgers but this place was really good. I got the double cheeseburger and my husband got the Chicago BURGER, chili dog, and why not some chili fries. 
Food came out super hot. Fries were hot. So you know they're fresh. Chili had a nice spice to it. 
I wasn't a fan of the raw onion on my burger but everything else was delish. Typically I don't eat the bun because it gets all soggy but this one was good. 
The wide selection of craft sodas was a fun touch! Definitely will be back. Service was great and place was clean.

5.4.3.2.1. Get ready for your taste buds to blast off!

Their menu makes ordering super easy.. it's not rocket science.

Actually.. deciding between the Eddie Lopez, and Cali Burger could be a real challenger.

Ehhh, I don't get it. It took me a minute to find it since its tucked behind a Church's Chicken. The employees were pleasant enough but the food was not good.

My burger was mushy and sloppy. The pickles even tasted weird and I love pickles. The fries were pretty gross. Undercooked and soggy. I was really disappointed because usually Yelp is spot on. I wish I had picked another place to eat while in Phoenix for the night.

We loved Rocket Burger!! What a fun place. The soda selection is crazy good and so cool that you get to make everything a float. We had the Rueben and a spicy burger. We were so impressed at how great everything tasted. I love it when local places are great!

Awesome Burger Joint. I've been here about 10 times now and can tell they serve some outstanding burgers and sandwiches. All the service pros are welcoming and seem happy to be there and serve.  Their soda "pop" selection is unreal. You look at all these different sodas and you can't help but feel you are in a "way back" machine.

Not too sure about Phoenix folks tastes in burgers.  2nd 4.5 star joint in a row that was meh!

Seeing is the name of this place is "Rocketburger", that is exactly what I got.  I ordered a Rocketburger with cheese and a fountain drink.  My total was just under $12.00.  Here is how it was..........

Rocketburger with cheese-  Meh.  This thing came with 3 patties, lettuce, tomato, onions and cheese.  It also had pickles and a "rocket sauce" aka thousand island.  The bun was a sub type roll and was fine.  All the ingredients were not that great though.  The burgers were way way way too salty, small and didn't taste good. The dressing had a weird "tang" to it also.  The cheese and bun were the only good things about it.  At around $10.00, I was dissapointed.  My mouth was swollen dry afterwards because of the salt!  Never again!  I ate the whole thing but would never get another one.

Diet Pepsi-  This was partly my bad.  They have 1000 or so bottled sodas for sale but I chose a fountain drink.  The Diet Pepsi was nasty!   The worst fountain soda I have ever had.  Tasted like root beer mixed with dirty water.   So nasty!

The guy at the counter and the guy who brought me my burger were friendly.  The food was below average and pricey,  and the soda was straight up nasty! Unfortunately I'm never coming back.
Friendly staff and good food. Rocket size is enough for multiple meals. I love the selection of bottled soda. Don't forget to check in to get 10% off.

Groupons are great and lead me to fun new places like this.  Went today for lunch- Teriyaki and Cali burgers, plus fries and one of the many bottled sodas they offer (vanilla creme).  The burgers were slightly smaller than at other burger places I've been to, but still more than enough.  Fries are freshly cut and yummy.  Prices are very reasonable and the owners were nice.

This is a place you want to take visiting friends. It looks like a hole in the wall in a sad strip mall, but it doesn't let you down. The burgers themselves aren't super special, but the topping combos are killer. The Santa Fe burger, with a whole fried green chile on top, is a sight to be seen. The fries are surprisingly delicious and have the skins still intact. They remind me of the fries at Five Guys, which I think is a really good thing. Last time we went I decided to try the subs, and I would heartily recommend you do the same. I was feeling something a little more traditional, so I tried their Reuben. The sauerkraut wasn't too overwhelming, the dressing was perfect, and there was a ton of melted cheese. Mmm. I will warn you though: Whatever you get is going to require a LOT of napkins, and possibly a knife and fork. This isn't a place to take a dainty eater.

Their selection of pop (yeah, I said pop) is insane. All of them are priced the same. No stressing out over picking one out before ordering and wondering how much each costs. And after you're done eating, go next door to the pop-only storefront and pick up a 4 or 6 pack to go. I asked the owner how many different varieties he has, and he said right now it's 700+, so the choice won't be easy, but you'll come away with some interesting varieties. I picked up a rhubarb soda, and a espresso soda last time, along with the key lime one I had with my meal.

Bacon cheeseburger was perfection. The meat was tender and juicy, cooked to medium perfection, the bacon was crispy and the right proportion to the beef. The lettuce was very finely shredded, onions were diced and blended well with the lettuce to add just the right amount to each bite. The bun was toasted lightly but still fluffy. 

The onion rings were very good... corn meal breading that was light and crispy, the onion was soft but didn't pull out of the breading. 

The cheese curds were amazing.  They were small, breading was very light and crispy.

The wall of soda is diverse and has something for everyone. I chose the Blenheim Ginger Ale pink cap (the spicier one). I was assisted with my choice which was great because I didn't know the difference between the options.

Staff was knowledgeable and very courteous.  The place has a bright and cheerful environment with "old timey" soda advertisement signs.

Nice little hidden jewel.  Had the double cheese burger, fresh ingredients loved the pickles and the bun, you cant go wrong with it.  Also had the Chili Dog it was great, i agree with the other reviewer that it kicks Sonic's butt.  Cant wait to try the subs the Roast Beast looks intriguing!
Such a great variety of sandwiches, burgers, hot dogs and SODAS! I usually always get two bottles of unique soda, one to drink and one for my collection at home

Typical diner look but a wall of frig doors loaded with different sodas. Had the pescado sandwich which is a monster size cornmeal crusted tilapia fillet with slaw, crudo, and salsa on a soft bun, also served with a large amount of seasoned fries everything piping hot.  To drink had the fountain crafted root beer nice.
One of the best burgers that I have ever had. The customer service was really great. Everyone was very friendly and the food was bomb.

Definitely a divey environment and unless you heard of this place from others or online, you would not see this place just driving by because it's tucked away in a large plaza. There's only 3 booths and a couple of tables outside so if you come here for dinner, don't be surprised if you have to eat outside in the dark as there's no lightning outside. Obviously you won't be eating outside forever like a sit-down restaurant, but it's definitely not appealing with your dinky phone flashlight on with car lights shining on you as they park in and out.

They offer the option of 1, 2 or 3 patties but I feel like that might be a mistake because they use the same bun for every burger. Not sure if you've seen the pictures posted by others, but these buns are surprisingly substantial themselves. The patties aren't thick either, but the thin kind. Thus, if you get 1 patty like me, even with the added pastrami and other toppings, the bun to burger ratio isn't right and the beef gets lost - making it feel like you're just eating bread and veggie toppings. For a moment there, I got a glimpse of what being a vegetarian was like and I felt like dying quick death. So definitely need to order 2 or 3 patties, no if's, ands, or buts about it. 

Unfortunately I have to say that if you're looking for a non-chain burger shop, go to Lenny's. Those burgers are worth driving into suicidal Central Phoenix traffic for (they have a couple of other locations as well). If you're ok with a chain, Fuddruckers will appease you more, even if they don't have the 20-something different combinations this place offers. Definitely give this place a try, but heed my tips and warnings above.

Also, the girl at the register is amazing customer service wise :)

I was disappointed. We ordered the Italian sub and the New Yorker and both were not that great. We only ate half of the sandwich. We also ordered fries which were greasy. The portion was huge so you can share them. I was grossed out and bloated all day from eating there. They do have a large assortment of different sodas. When we were there the soda fountain was leaking and the floor was wet.  All around the bottom of the walls is dirty which is gross. Maybe they are known for their burgers. I won't be going back to find out though.
I was blown away by the menu, my lunch and the kind people who work here.

Great tasking burgers and fries!!! This place doesn't use processed meat and junk to feed you, it really is quality. The flavor is amazing and makes me feel like I'm eating healthy while indulging in my favorite burger!!
Loved it! Had the double bacon cheeseburger with fries and onion rings. Will be back!!

My goodness, i totally underestimated the size of their "Rocket" sized sandwiches, which are a meal and a half.  I would totally go there again but this time spend a lot less knowing that im going to be more than satisfied with one Rocket sized meal.  They have a ton of variety, and i tried their Mexican sandwich which was great.

I love this place. I am trying to not write this review with my emotions, but to hell with it; Best Burger in Phoenix!
I have sampled an array of the offerings and I proclaim them all to be of better than decent quality, some are in fact astoundingly crafted to be in a high range of quality. My primary example of this is the New York Burger, which is a layer of pastrami a layer of cole slaw and a slice of really delicious cheese on the already amazing all-beef burger. The bread is also noticeably awesome here, the sub rolls are soft yet sturdy for stacking meats onto and the burger buns are to die for.
If I let this review go by without mentioning the fried zucchini it would be a crime against having good taste in the realm of food. The zuke is breaded and tastes very fresh, it is expertly packaged so as to not get mushy and the presentation is very appetizing to the eyes. 
I need at least one of these burgers a month in order so that I do not devolve into madness. 
I work in food prep and I can say that I recognize all the details they put into their food at Rocket Burger. I will leave the surprising selection of soda and bottled beverages for you to experience on your own as it adds to the charm of the establishment. 
A high five to the crew and owners for getting it right.

huge selection of burgers. The wait was a bit long but was def worth it. I would rather wait a few more minutes and have a great tasting burger than get it sooner and have it taste not so great. My nephew got the rocket. It is a sub sandwich but the contents of the inside of a hamburger. It was huge! excited to come back and try a different creation.

It takes a lot for me to write a review about a restaurant but this place is AMAZING!  I ordered the Mexican Burger which was probably one of the most delicious burgers I have ever had the pleasure of consuming. Not only was the food amazing the staff was super friendly and courteous even after I knocked my drink over.  

They are a little hard to find as they are tucked in the back in the corner of a building complex.  But if you do find this little gem eatery you will not be disappointed. You can taste all the love they invest into their food,  even if your not hungry swing by and check out there unmatched soda collection.

It's a strange phenomenon that happens so very rarely, where something is redone, a song or movie for example, and ends up better than the source material -- 

*More Real Than The Original*

...Buffy the Vampire Slayer television show vs. movie  

...Jimi Hendrix vs. Bob Dylan All Along The Watchtower (even Dylan admitted it was Jimi's song now)

There is a restaurant concept sweeping the valley right now, based on a certain small number (between 1 and 3) of people of a certain philosophy (free-wheeling, nature-loving, noodly-music-listening) and their crazy atmosphere establishments full of odd "paraphernalia".

Well, think about how one of those places got your hopes up and then  left them dashed, and head on over to Rocket Burgers & Subs for everything you thought you'd get with those other guys:

~A fresh, clean, uncluttered atmosphere that you can sit comfortably inside of while enjoying your meal.
~A HUGE selection of almost any kind of soft drink you'd desire to quench that thirsty, dry mouth of yours.
~Lots of variety of menu, all with inexpensive good quality items of decent portion
~A radio playing the xmsirius Grateful Dead Channel for your soothing/stimulating dining pleasure.
~and a couple of really nice, friendly, hippy-on-the-inside-not-just-for-show restauranteurs eager to discuss their business and products, who are not only present now, but seem that they'll be sticking around to ensure the quality and value of their new place doesn't wane.

The food is fresh, fast, and inexpensive.  If you want burgers, subs, dogs, pizza-bread, gyro, salad, handmade fries &  onion rings, PBJ with homemade jam  -- they've got it.  The chicken sandwich had a light crispy breading and a solid chunk of breast meat.  The burger was a smaller patty (available as a double) but not dry, and the condiments were fresh and generous.  
For both sandwiches, the standout part was the fresh bun from Simply Bread (local).  It was soft/firm enough to be just right, and had great flavor.
They have a cooler chock full of interesting and bizarre selections from Pop The Soda Shop (Jones Soda, imported ginger ales and root beers, glass bottle real sugar sodas from mexico, dublin dr pepper, etc). My spicy Bleinheim Ginger Ale did not skimp on the ginger flavor!

A couple of real ex hippies would do it like this -- 
no flashy superficial emphasis on outward appearances and gimmicks, just quality, freshness, and friendliness that is truly genuine and sincere.
I feel like I made a new friend.
Rocket Burgers & Subs is one out of this world place, and I'm glad it landed in my neighborhood.
This place has some good burgers and the largest variety of sodas I have ever seen. They sell foreign sodas if you know any of them. Customer service is represented here and helped me out.

Wow. Amazing bottled soda selection.  The people that work here are really nice and friendly.  The guy commented on my Seahawks shirt saying he himself is from the Seattle area.  The burger was amazing.  Melted cheese, tender beef and a great sauce that has a bit of a kick to it.  The fries are krinkle cut- nothing special but decent.  Any bottled soda you can imagine is here.  I got my food to go since the place is kind of small.  I hope that they franchise and start a few elsewhere around the valley- in bigger locations ;)
Had a burger here a few months ago and it was really good. I love the selection of sodas as well.

May seem over priced for burgers but once you have any of there burgers your going to put down that big Mac or whopper for and Eddie Lopez burger. Just wish the frys could stand up to the burgers. The fried mushrooms are way too salty though

I like this place, a lot. It's right behind Church's Chicken at Cactus and 35th Ave. This used to be a run-down strip mall, and this particular store was "Latino Food Market" and looked terrible inside. The 2 owners renovated it and started it up as "Rocket Subs" before changing it to its current name. Now, it looks bright and inviting.

They have Hebrew National hot dogs and a vast selection of soda, including the Mexican variety. The BLT sub I had was also very good. I've not had a chance to try the burgers. I recommend checking this place out if you're in the area.

This place is very expletive good. It isn't a place that's high end where their cows get back massages and pedicures before getting slaughtered and cooked in some fancy french culinary term, it's better. Just when I thought their burgers were the best,
I tried my wife's teriyaki chicken sandwhich after I swallowed my burger and it was heavenly. We don't drink soda either but we always split one, vanilla cream is the best. I would eat here all day everyday, unfortunately my pants are already getting tighter lol. It's a solid 10. Go have some please. Guy fierri needs to go there ASAP.
This place has an Amazing soda selection.  I had the gyro burger it was great. We also ordered the Garlic Melt burger which was good as well. We will come back.
Bomb every time. Amazing cheese curds! Crazy AMMMMMAAAAAZZZZING crispy chicken salad the small a wide, yet very unique selection of sodas.
Good food but the draw for us were all the funky sodas! It was a fun place to try and the staff was super friendly and the burgers were good.

I write this review as my boyfriend is next to me in a food coma! He just got back from a hiking trip and wanted a burger and fries. So I jumped on Yelp to see what we could find. After looking at a few places, we decided on Rocket Burger and Subs. When we walked through the door we were greated right away. Something I look for and think is very important. We were amazed at the soda selection! Some sodas I've haven't seen in YEARS! They even have Slush Puppies!!! What???? Yeppers, they sure do! We both decided on the birch beer. Sooooo good! I went simple and got a cheeseburger and fries. BF got a pastrami with cole slaw sandwich and fries. I have to agree with most on here and say the food here is outstanding! Very fresh and full of flavor. The fries were not greasy nor the burgers salty. And I for one do not use or like salt very much. I love how the skin was left on the fries! Very yummy! We will definitely be back when we have a craving for really good burgers and fries! Oh and if you check in on Yelp you get 10% off!!!

Awesome little burger and hot dog joint with a huge selection of different sodas as a nice little touch. All their burgers are huge and more than enough for one person, although we chose to splurge and grab onion rings with our meal. I've always been pretty fond of novelty and specialty sodas myself and it was awesome seeing a bunch of them at this little hole-in-the-wall burger joint.

Great place for some greasy, delicious fast food if you're craving some classic American burgers

I was in the mood to try somewhere new and Yelp brought my husband and I here on his lunch break. Based on all of the reviews I'm going to say I either came on an off day or ordered the wrong thing. I just wasn't impressed? However, I didn't order a burger so that could have been my big glaring error. I ordered the California chicken sandwich and the taste of lime just overwhelmed the whole sandwich. Here's what I think happened - I asked the cashier if she recommended grilled or breaded and she said they were both good. Me, being the carbaholic that I am, ordered the breaded chicken and the breading soaked up all and any lime flavoring they would normally put on the grilled chicken.  Also, I wasn't crazy about the fries. I like my fries really crispy and these just weren't my thing. My husband, on the other hand, liked his standard cheeseburger and these were his kind of fries. I like more crisp where he likes more "fry meat" (that's what I call it) and that's okay.  Even though I didn't like my meal, the environment was super casual, the service was friendly and fast, and my husband didn't have any complaints. Also, they have a ton of sodas, I'm boring and just ordered a Coke but if I ever went back, I'd definitely take my time and try to look through all of the different sodas they have. It's intense.

Wow! This is my spot, this is definitely my jam and my wife even loves this place! It's really hard to find a place that has more cheeses than American cheese to put on your burger.

I've been here a lot... pretty much come here 1-3 times a week. We crave rocket burger on the regular.

Burgers are fantastic. The owner is personable and very nice. He seems to be here a lot! I love the recommendations on the soda choices he gives. Honestly can say they have the best burger in chandler for the price. We have had a couple burgers that were not to perfection, but still was satisfied. Love the rocket sauce on the side for dipping sauce and burger topping, it has a nice sweet taste to it.

I recommend the onion rings or chili cheese fries along with any burger or sandwich. Have yet to be disappointed on any main courses.Didn't particularly care for the cheese curds though.

I hear people rant and rave about this place as they are eating in the next booth, the vibe here is friendly. They always have a special going on.

So many craft sodas to choose from! Small little place but packs a big punch! They seem to get you in and out quickly. I like that it's never packed but has a steady stream of customers.

Keep up the good work rocket burger

Love this place! I have been here several times and ordered several different things and everything has been great! Their fried zucchini and cheese curds are super tasty.  The staff here is also really friendly, informed on the menu and willing to help with suggesstions. Also the wall of soda!!! It's amazing, anything you could possibly want! Plus they have some homemade sodas on tap.

Vroom Vroom!  That's the sound of my red rocket taking off when I took the first bite of my California Chicken sandwich! This place is the real deal! 

I ordered the California chicken sandwich with some fries. The chicken was fried and juicy, cooked perfectly. The bacon was nice and crispy as well. It also came with avocado, and being from Arizona, naturally I love avocado. 

They have an awesome selection of different craft sodas. There must have been about 300 different ones to choose from. Will definitely be back.
Tried this place out for the first time today with the grand kids burgers and fries were great BLT was good too. Nice friendly helpful staff

If your a soda fan, this is your place.  Must have 200 different kinds of bottled soda.  Fried veggies are fresh and hand battered, very good.   Burgers were decent, but patties seemed like they were previously frozen or maybe just overcooked.  They looked like preformed frozen patties.  Food came out pretty fast and pretty good price.  I would try it again if I wanted a quick fast food meal and a new variety of soda.

Super friendly staff!! Came here for lunch with BFFs, at 10:30am (they open early, bonus!)  I had a great (but greasy) Reuben. Girlfriends ended up eating their burgers with a knife and fork... but they ate them happily!.  Generous amount of fries but not my favorite.. not sure how to describe them but I would go with chips next time (and I generally love fries).  The place has a whole cooler of just root beer, all different brands of course, and 2 additional coolers of every flavor of soda you could think of and then some, including retro sodas like Bubble Up. Overall, nice little place. Seems to get good traffic, even at 10:30 am. But this location has been needing a lunch place like this for a long time! Its not health food, but its good and I will be back.  Just gotta load up on the napkins.

Aren't the sketchiest places some of the best? I ordered the Philly Cheesesteak, and I was pleasantly surprised. The meat was seasoned deliciously. I would have preferred lettuce on it though... (weird huh?) any who, the price is decent for what you pay for. The only downside to this place though is that it's really small, and it gets crowded quick (beware if you have claustrophobia). I'm definitely going to back to try their other menu items.

Although their prices are a little steep for burgers they are worth it. I got the Philly cheese steak burger and it was to die for.... no for real I think I had a heart attack eating all that grease. but all jokes aside it was everything A burger should be! Can't wait to try some of the other menu items. I just wish they serve their cheese curds with marinara sauce

My husband and I were in town for the weekend. We were taking my sister out to eat and wanted good burgers. We found our place! And they have an awesome assortment of sodas. We found 'Ski' which is locally bottled in our home town in IL -- we were so excited!!!

this place is so amazing!!!!!!!!!! clean, super friendly, and the food omg the food. we were a sketched out by the area, but the best places always look like dives. We go in and the menu was clear, and the prices were awesome. We got a double new york burger, and cali burger, and a regular burger, onion rings, chili cheese fries, and 3 soda's, for 33.00! That is pretty awesome. the burgers are a good size, and perfect. The onion rings were amazing, and my husband devoured the chili cheese fries. What we really loved was the soda selection. I think we spent a majority of the time trying to decide what we wanted. my husband got candied bacon cream soda and it was amazing. I can without a doubt say we will be back here, and that this is our new favorite place! Go check it out!!!!!!!!!

After going to SmashBurger and not getting my burger smashed, I was not surprised when the burgers here were not actually made out of rockets. Interstellar is one of my favorite movies of all time and I wanted to feel like Matthew McConaughey blasting off into space as I ate. Unfortunately, my burger made me feel more like Anne Hathaway, which is weird because I've never been in love with Captain Edmunds, although I do agree that his planet shows the most promise. Still it was a pretty decent burger.

The atmosphere makes me feel like I'd traveled back in time about 50 years. This is, of course, possible with the help of some 4th dimensional beings, AKA ourselves in the future. If I could travel back in time to the day I ate at Rocket Burger, I would order another burger.

Honestly havent had a burger "WOW" me in quite a while.... his little hole in the wall was precisely what I had hoped for. I had the Rocket style (3 patties on a 10 inch roll) Cali burger that has bacon, avocado and rocket sauce, bread is toasted with butter so its not soggy, you can order your burger Med or well done which is a nice touch. My daughter had the corn dogs and even those were surprisingly really good. Go to this place now! Fries are actually great :)

PS. They have something like 500 bottles of flavored soda, check it out if its your thing
Good homemade burger join with hand-cut fries and fresh bread. Everything is made to order and very tasty. They have a huge selection of sodas if that's your thing. I definitely will be coming back.
Onion rings are good. The breading is very light and salty. Most definitely Not heavy like other places.

"I've always been obsessed with making a perfect hamburger.  There's nothing more American than a burger." ? Michael Symon

Do you guys know of Kate M. on Yelp from Chandler, AZ?  If you don't, go add her.  She has great reviews, posts yummy pictures, has funny check-in comments, and she likes to make fun of old people who plays Bingo.  Now why am I bringing her up again?  Oh yeah, she makes me try new places like Rocket Burger!

As soon as you get out of the car, the smell of grilled burgers hits you.  Yaaas...  The three of us ordered two Bacon Cheese Burgers [cheese, bacon, lettuce, tomato, onion, pickle, and rocket sauce], a Sante Fe Burger [lettuce, tomato, onion, pickle, cheese, fried green chili, bacon, rocket sauce], an order of Chili Cheese fries, and some Onion Rings.  The burger I had was a bacon cheese burger.  It hit the spot!  It had the perfect amount of char and was perfectly pink and juicy.  The chili fries stayed warm and cheesy even though we dined al fresco in 50°F weather this fine Friday evening.  The onion rings were also interesting.  The onion rings had a hard coating of cornmeal so be warned if you're expecting something else.  Along with a wide selection of interesting bottled sodas, they also have Batch Craft Soda as a fountain drink.  I dig it!

All in all, it's a great little shop [like three-tables-inside little] with a kind staff.  We were offered many apologies for having to eat outside since the dining area was full but that only speaks on how loved this place is.  My suggestion is to come during the off-peak hours!

It was a really good flat iron burger we decided to stop on our way through town and had been wanting to try their burgers. They were tasty and juicy not over cooked and the flavor was very good. Staff was friendly.

There is something special about having a whole wall dedicated to bottled soda. It really make my mouth light up with joy. This is what makes this whole in the wall memorable. I went for one of the blue cream sodas and really enjoyed it. Price wasn't too bad either. 
The food on the other hand... Well my bf would be able to make a more impressive sandwich. The ingredients seemed fresh and of good quality, but my sandwich, the turkey special for the day, was definitely lacking in the sauce department. Which was sad because it was a spicy root beer BBQ sauce, and what I could taste of it was spot on. 
Would have asked for extra sauce on the side, but the folks working there weren't very friendly or approachable. Seemed like there was some tension in the air. Maybe they were having a bad day...

I  dont leave very many reviews on yelp i mostly read them and then  I check out the place but I came here since I read great reviews.  I ordered the cheeseburger special for 6.99 which comes with frys and a drink. Which is a pretty good deal compaired to some fast food places.  I got my burger took the first bite and the bottom of the bun was soggy which I'm guessing was from the onion or lettuce but that just ruined the burger for me who wants to eat a soggy bun. I still ate half which was good. The fries were soggy greesy too but I like them like that just don't like potato skins on them but not too bad since they had good ranch.  I noticed they use grub hub for delivery which is cool if you wanted it delivered. Maybe I will give them another try just a bad day I guess.
Decent burgers not over priced like a lot of places but it also wasn't as good as a friend had led me to believe so I was slightly disappointed.

Authentic.  This place is authentic.  They do what they do really well, and their customer base knows it and appreciates it.  Come here for an enormous selection of handcrafted rootbeers, creme sodas, and more.  Pair those with traditional American lunch items like burgers, dogs, fries, rings, etc.  Simple enough.  Good tasting, reasonably priced.

Tucked behind a Church's fried chicken.  Service was friendly.  Too bad cheese curds were termporarily out of stock!

Rocket burger has been on my bookmark/bucket list of places to try and this was my first time here today.  I got the cheese burger special for 4.99 includes fries and a drink , plus the 10% off if you check in through yelp . The cheeseburger had really good flavor it was dressed with the usual and what made it so special was the burger sauce. The sauce had a little bit of a kick , not too much but enough to make you want more. The only negative is the bun was too thick for my taste, but I ripped the inside of the bun and enjoyed the burger . The fries seems to be hand cut and I think they are cooked in some kind of veggie oil like Crisco.  They looked better than they tasted. Then again everyone has their own preference in what they think is a good French fry. Who knows it might be your cup of tea. Oh and by the way they had a crazy cool collection of soda pop.

HOLY COW! An entire WALL of frosty specialty drinks?!?! Are you kidding!?!  I had a standard cheeseburger and it was phenomenal. The service was great- the flourescent green sodas that my kids chose from the wall were good. Weird, but good. Had a great time here with the family, will definitely go back the next time we are all in the mood for burgers and sodas.

Had the Red White and Blue burger with a second patty, extra pickles and the fries. The blue was blue cheese, the red a pepper and the white a jalapeno mayo type sauce.  The burger was awesome, I'd skip the fries next time and just go with a third burger patty. They also have hundreds of kinds of bottled soda, if that's your thing (it;s not mine, but was interesting to look.

Not much I can say that hasn't been mentioned already. I really like when the owner takes the time to come out and see if your enjoying your meal like this guy does, really nice guy. Food is great and the soda selection is super cool, the prices are very reasonable. You will spend MORE at the drive thru so instead go give your hear earned $$ to a local joint who appreciates the business.

My wife and I have been living close to this place for a while now.  We've seen it coming home more than a few times.  Tonight we jumped here on Yelp and saw they were rated pretty high and decide this was the place for dinner.  

I got the gyro burger combo with French fries and a sarsaparilla and my wife got the Cali Burger and onion rings.  Everything was fantastic.  They have a huge selection of pops that you won't find anywhere else.  Everything we had was great.  The French Fries and the onion rings were some of the best around.

If you are hankering for a good burger joint, this is definitely a good place to go.

Every time I house sit for my friend Keith, I eat at Rocket Burger. Partly because it's just down the street, but mostly because a good burger is a great way to end the day. I've never had a bad burger here. The chili cheese fries are pretty great. The fish sandwich is good but messy to eat by hand.

I don't drink soda, but if I did this place would be like heaven: a monterous  selection of carbonated beverages lines the back wall.
I go here all the time and keep coming back trying new stuff.  I'll probably make it through the menu someday... don't let text the outside discourage you!

A hidden gem of a place! This has become a regular for me and my daughter: pedicure/manicure and Rocket Burger! Lol

The menu is great with something for everyone. Portions are generous but the really neat thing (there's many at this place) is that they sell bottled drinks! I love the butterscotch sodas and my daughter goes for the red cream sodas! Over 100 types I'm sure! 

The food- amazing! I've had the small Rueben and it is a generous size. I haven't been able to finish it. I've even ordered to go for my husband. He's a hard sell and said the Santa Fe Burger was hands down the best burger he's ever had! 

Prices aren't bad, great food. The only downside is there are only 3 booths. You may want to get it to go if seating is tight. You won't be disappointed!
O boy I just discovered ROCKET BURGERS &SUBS. TOTALLY AWESOME!!!! This is the first time in a long while I drank 7-up from a bottle...tha fries are the bomb too!!!!!
Total gem hole in the wall. Flash back to the 80s...best burgers you'll find. Parking s a pain but it's well worth it I promise!!

Wish this place existed in Irvine!  Great menu and selection of menu items and yummy burger sandwich options!  Kids loved the mini corn dogs and selecting of craft sodas!  Will go back when in Arizona for sure!

What a fun find! I can't really add much that the other reviewers have not already said. Come by and check out the antique soda market. They own the one next door too. If you want to find a soda brand from your hometown and or your Glory Days of past, or not so Glory Days of past, they probably have it. 

The turkey sub was pretty good and the staff were extra nice. Hi Ruth! Ruth even gave me a small Yelp discount which was super nice of her. She did not have to do that because I did not buy the whole combo. I will definitely be going back to this fun place to try a burger too.

Love me some Rocket Burger! As a family we usually go on a Saturday for lunch. I would give 5 stars but the parking is tight and recently there has been a storage container next to Church's Chicken which makes it even tighter. 

My husband and I both usually get a bacon cheeseburger but this time I ventured outside my box and ordered the Thai chicken sandwich special. it came on the signature bun that is great and always fresh but never seems to hold up and at the end of the burger it falls apart..but I'm not complaining!

Sandwich was a real chicken breast breaded and fried with a spicy peanut sauce and a spicy slaw. Sandwich was amazing. Now I will be torn on what to order on future visits.

Hubs bacon burger is just that. A bacon burger, single patty with fresh customary burger toppings. Fries are always hot and freshly cut.

We also love the hundreds of bottled soda collection but find it a little pricey at $1.99 a bottle.

Rocket Burger is a great break from chain burgers and blows  most of them out of the water. Be prepared during busy times to wait for a table or clean your own.
GROSS! What a waste of $20! If you're looking for a good burger... this is NOT the place!

I visit Rocket Burger several times a month. Not as often as I would like. 
There are many reasons I go there. The food is good and the people that own the place and the workers are the best. 
We go there to eat and visit.
The nicest people you could ever meet. We try to go in the off hours so we have some time to talk with the owners and workers. 
Go in and say Hi. Again the food is good and the people are the nicest you can find anywhere.

I think this place qualifies as a dive. In a good way. Not much on decor and located behind a Church's Chicken which is very hard to find the restaurant.

 if you are into different kind of sodas this is your heaven. Not only different kind of soda for display but to drink.

Had the Eddie Lopez Single Burger which was a burger with Pastrami. Was pretty good and a solid bun to hold the burger together.  The fries were on the soggy side which I personally prefer to be crisp. 

The soda selection is second to none and really overwhelming but if you want to try something new and different this is the place. 

Would like to come back to try a hot dog or a sub which both look great. 

Overall come for the food and not the decor, this could easily be a candidate for diners drive ins and dives.

Good find and good food, I like these kind of unique places. Will be back again

So worth the drive! It's about 1 1/2 drive from where I live, but we had to come to Phoenix anyways. I'm glad we stop by this unique burger joint... I had the AfterBurner Burger & Onion Rings also got the Pizza Bread... Yummy! I was starving ok lol. My fiancé got a Fish Sandwhich and Fries he said it's like the best Fish Sandwich he's had. My little ones had the mini corn dogs & fries. So we enjoyed our self and the owners are really nice...
